Title: 23-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Mockery of justice: Killer Hunter Deserves More Time In Jail
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A man is driving around in his truck near </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:place><st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Lundar</SPAN></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, </SPAN><st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Man.</SPAN></st1:State></st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, along a wooded area that's privately owned. He sees something moving in the bush -- could be a man, a child, a dog, a deer, whatever. He has no idea what it is. Despite that, he takes out his high-powered rifle, points it out the truck window and from the road, shoots into the private property. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He's a good shot -- he hits the target square in the head. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The target is left slumped over its ATV. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Since deer and dogs generally don't drive ATVs, the shooter quickly figures out that he didn't hit an animal. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He hit a man -- 44-year-old Arden Miller. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The shooter turns to the passenger in his truck and says: "I could be up for manslaughter." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He realizes this was no accident. But he doesn't help the man he just shot. Like a scene out of Deliverance, he bolts from the crime scene and leaves Miller to die, telling his passenger friend to keep quiet about the incident. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Over the next two months, the shooter conceals his crime. He fails to take responsibility for it, even though others in the community are suspected of the shooting. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">FIVE YEARS <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The cops finally figure out who the real shooter is and they charge him. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">What do you think this guy should get in the courts? Twenty tears? Life? At least manslaughter with no chance of parole for 10 years? Try again. He got five years and he'll likely be out much sooner than that. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The shooter is John Douglas Mark, 56, convicted of killing Miller on </SPAN><st1:date Month="11" Day="15" Year="2001"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Nov. 15, 2001</SPAN></st1:date><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He was found guilty of criminal negligence causing death and sentenced last month by Queen's Bench Justice Wallace Darichuk. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Darichuk is the April winner of this column's Eight-Ball Award, handed out to recognize </SPAN><st1:State><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Manitoba</SPAN></st1:place></st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">'s worst perversions of justice. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The minimum sentence in this case was four years. But Darichuk should have thrown this guy away for a lot longer than that. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Five years is woefully inadequate and fails to meet the Criminal Code's basic sentencing principles of denunciation and deterrence. It definitely doesn't meet the code's criteria that a sentence must reflect the seriousness of a crime. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Here's a guy driving around in his truck shooting into people's private property without a clue of what he's shooting at. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He kills someone and hides from the crime hoping he'll never be caught. He fails to produce the firearm for police, saying it was misplaced, and pleads not guilty to the crime even after his arrest. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">How Mark only got five years for this serious, violent crime is beyond me. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He broke so many laws by doing what he did -- endangering the lives of anybody that happened to be in the area -- he should be locked up for a very long time. The guy is obviously a menace to society. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">It's illegal to shoot from a truck window. It's illegal to shoot from a roadway. It's illegal to shoot into private property without permission. And it's obviously illegal to shoot a human. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">This wasn't a hunting accident. This was reckless, criminal behaviour that warranted severe sanctions. Apparently Justice Darichuk didn't see it that way. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
Body: Mockery of justice: Killer Hunter Deserves More Time In Jail  WINNIPEG, MB  Sun  May 7/04    Page 5  By Tom Brodbeck<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A man is driving around in his truck near </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:place><st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Lundar</SPAN></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, </SPAN><st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Man.</SPAN></st1:State></st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, along a wooded area that's privately owned. But he doesn't help the man he just shot. Like a scene out of Deliverance, he bolts from the crime scene and leaves Miller to die, telling his passenger friend to keep quiet about the incident. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Over the next two months, the shooter conceals his crime. Twenty tears? Life? At least manslaughter with no chance of parole for 10 years? Try again. He got five years and he'll likely be out much sooner than that. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The shooter is John Douglas Mark, 56, convicted of killing Miller on </SPAN><st1:date Month="11" Day="15" Year="2001"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Nov. 15, 2001</SPAN></st1:date><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He was found guilty of criminal negligence causing death and sentenced last month by Queen's Bench Justice Wallace Darichuk. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Darichuk is the April winner of this column's Eight-Ball Award, handed out to recognize </SPAN><st1:State><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Manitoba</SPAN></st1:place></st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">'s worst perversions of justice. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The minimum sentence in this case was four years. But Darichuk should have thrown this guy away for a lot longer than that. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Five years is woefully inadequate and fails to meet the Criminal Code's basic sentencing principles of denunciation and deterrence. It definitely doesn't meet the code's criteria that a sentence must reflect the seriousness of a crime. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Here's a guy driving around in his truck shooting into people's private property without a clue of what he's shooting at. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He kills someone and hides from the crime hoping he'll never be caught. This was reckless, criminal behaviour that warranted severe sanctions. Title: 24-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: toyota trashed in crash : Injured To Hospital In Stable Condition
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Chia Hong was shopping with his family at Wal-Mart yesterday afternoon when he received one of the scariest phone calls one can imagine. "My friend ... told me my sister just got into a car accident," Hong said yesterday at the corner of </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Selkirk Avenue</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> and </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">McPhillips Street</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Hong, his wife and their young child quickly made their way to the North End intersection to find a red Toyota Rav 4 -- belonging to Hong's sister Khaleng Ma -- upside-down and crushed at both ends. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"I thought she was injured really bad," Hong said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A witness said Ma and her passenger were eastbound on </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Selkirk Avenue</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> with a green light, approaching </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">McPhillips Street</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> at about </SPAN><st1:time Hour="15" Minute="30"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">3:30 p.m.</SPAN></st1:time><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">At the same time, the witness said she noticed a grey older-model sedan travelling quickly northbound on McPhillips. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The witness decided she'd better move away from the edge of the road. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"I walked back this way a little," said the woman, who wouldn't give her name. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"That's when I saw all this glass coming behind me." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The witness said she turned around to see the </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Toyota</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> flip over on to its roof and careen into the light standard she'd been standing beside just moments before. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Police said two people were taken to </SPAN><st1:place><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Seven</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Oaks</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">General</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceType><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Hospital</SPAN></st1:PlaceType></st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> in stable condition. Officers weren't able to provide any additional details.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 25-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Trial politically tainted?: Lawyer Scorns Delays In Hit-Run Death Case
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A high-profile defence lawyer lashed out at the province yesterday, blaming "political interference" for stalling his client's sentencing in a fatal drunk driving case. "It's my strong suspicion political optics is preventing this matter from being resolved today," said defence lawyer Hymie Weinstein. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"If my suspicions are correct, and I believe they are, it is an affront to the independence of the Crown, the integrity of the Crown ... and the independence of the court. This is not a proud day in the administration of justice. It is a black day." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Weinstein's client, 20-year-old Lindsay McCaughan, was scheduled to enter guilty pleas of some sort yesterday, for her part in the </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:date Month="8" Day="15" Year="2003"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Aug. 15, 2003</SPAN></st1:date><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, car accident that took the life of newspaper carrier Michael Antosh. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Weinstein even expected to be able to move to sentencing submissions yesterday but learned at the last minute the Crown would be asking for an adjournment instead. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The Crown's reason for the delay? Prior to the accident, McCaughan had spent two months working as a cooking instructor at the Winnipeg Remand Centre, which technically makes her a former employee of Manitoba Justice, the same body that's prosecuting her. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">To avoid being caught in a position of conflict, the Crown has opted to hire independent counsel to handle the sentencing, Crown attorney Brian Bell told court yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Weinstein wasn't buying it. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"To say (McCaughan) was involved in the administration of justice is laughable ... an insult to my intelligence," Weinstein told court. "My suspicion is this request has been forced on (the Crown) ... from across the street at the Manitoba Legislature." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Weinstein thinks the decision to farm out the prosecution can be directly attributed to a news story that ran yesterday, in which a Tory justice critic challenged the province's position on conditional sentences. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He wasn't the only one who was upset. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Outside court, Antosh's widow described her disappointment over the still-unresolved matter. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"I have prepared myself, and I have accepted what they say is going to happen," said Epifania </SPAN><st1:country-region><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Austria</SPAN></st1:place></st1:country-region><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">. "Now I'm on a roller coaster of emotions again, to be told it's going to be another few weeks." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">'THIS WAS MURDER' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Alan Storie, Antosh's brother-in-law, said he's hopeful the delay will result in something stiffer than a conditional sentence for McCaughan. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"In my mind this was murder," said Storie. "My brother-in-law didn't have a choice. This person did." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A 40-year-old father of two, Antosh was delivering newspapers on </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Portage Avenue</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> when he stepped out of his Ford Bronco and was struck by a westbound vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">McCaughan, who lives with her parents in St. Francois Xavier, allegedly left the scene but returned a short time later and confessed to cops that she'd hit Antosh. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Her matter has been remanded until next month.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 26-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ‘A black day’ for justice: lawyer: Province Accused Of Interference
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, MB  Free Press    May.7/04    Page A1/A2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">THE provincial Justice Department was accused yesterday of interfering in a fatal drunk-driving case by overruling an agreement made by senior Crown prosecutors. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Justice officials were trying to dodge a possible backlash of public criticism for being too lenient on a drunk driver who killed a man, according to a lawyer in the case. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"This is political interference from across the street at the legislature," defence lawyer Hymie Weinstein told court in a biting, 10-minute speech. "This has absolutely no place in the courtroom. It is an affront to the independence and integrity of the Crown." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">His anger was aimed at Justice Minister Gord Mackintosh and deputy attorney general Bruce MacFarlane. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"This is not a proud day in the administration of justice. It is a black day," said Weinstein, who has been both a Crown and a defence lawyer during a 30-year career. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The surprising courtroom change triggered a chain reaction of events -- including a sudden adjournment of the case, expressions of anger by the families of both the accused and the victim and confusion within the Crown attorney's office. Weinstein's client, Lindsay McCaughan, 19, had struck a deal to plead guilty yesterday afternoon to impaired-driving charges relating to the August 2003 death of <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Winnipeg Free Press</SPAN></EM> carrier Mike Antosh. The 40-year-old married father of two was fatally injured when a car drove into him on </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Portage Avenue</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> in St. James. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Crown and defence lawyers agreed to make a joint recommendation for a controversial conditional sentence that would allow McCaughan to remain free in the community. She has no prior criminal record and is expressing deep remorse. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Veteran prosecutors Brian Bell and Don Slough had spoken to other senior Crowns in their office about the plea bargain and received their approval, Weinstein told court. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">As they were preparing for yesterday's sentencing, </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Bell</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> and </SPAN><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Slough</SPAN></st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> were notified around </SPAN><st1:time Hour="11" Minute="0"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">11 a.m.</SPAN></st1:time><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> by the provincial Justice Department that they had been pulled off the case and would be replaced by an independent, yet-to-be-named lawyer. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">MacFarlane claims Manitoba Justice was in a conflict of interest because McCaughan had just started working in the kitchen at the Winnipeg Remand Centre at the time of the tragedy, </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Bell</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> told court while reading from a prepared statement. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The Justice Department had previously ruled there was no conflict, but decided to re-evaluate its position at the last minute, said </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Bell</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">. The department now believed it was "in their best interests" to seek independent prosecution, even though McCaughan was fired immediately after her arrest. The independent prosecutor could be a private bar lawyer or a Crown counsel from outside the city or province. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"To say she was involved in the administration of justice is laughable," Weinstein told the court. "It is an insult to my intelligence. These reasons have been forced on my learned friends (</SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Bell</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> and </SPAN><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Slough</SPAN></st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">) from people across the street at the legislature. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"I don't appreciate people across the street, politicians, telling the courts a case can't go forward." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Weinstein claims the true story is that provincial justice officials learned of the plea bargain struck by the Crown and feared the bad publicity it would receive. They decided to farm the case out to an independent lawyer to allow justice officials to dodge the bullet. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He said an article in yesterday's <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Free Press </SPAN></EM>likely prompted the move. The article reported that Tory MLA Kelvin Goertzen has demanded Justice Minister Gord Mackintosh develop a provincial policy to direct Crowns when not to seek conditional sentences. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Goertzen's remarks came after a 22-year-old was given a conditional sentence at the Crown's request this week for sexually assaulting a 13-year-old girl he met over the Internet. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Several Crown attorneys confirmed Weinstein's version of events to the <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Free Press</SPAN></EM> yesterday. One senior prosecutor, who was not associated with this case and wished to remain anonymous, said yesterday "was the worst day of my career." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Mackintosh declined to comment yesterday, but a Justice Department spokesman said Weinstein's allegations were "nonsense." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">He said seeking outside counsel shows the Justice Department is doing everything to ensure there is no perception of bias. However, the spokesman couldn't say why the department originally found there was no conflict and suddenly changed its mind yesterday. This isn't the first time Mackintosh and his department have been accused of meddling with the courts. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Mackintosh outraged provincial judges and lawyers last summer when he ordered a review of the bail system after learning a man charged with murder had been released from custody only days earlier despite objections from the Crown. His move was seen by many as interference with the independence of the judiciary. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Last summer Mackintosh was angered when a conditional sentence was handed to a man convicted of killing a 58-year-old woman while driving drunk. The Crown had actually agreed to the conditional sentence. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">And in January he came out swinging again when another man was given a conditional sentence for aggravated assault in which he left his victim permanently brain-damaged. The Crown had been seeking prison time in that case.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 27-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Letters to the editor: It’s More Beautiful Outside Vehicles
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, MB  Free Press  May.7/04  Page A13
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">There's a simple answer to Gerald Flood's qualms over the possibility of east Portage being closed in accordance with the proposals for the redesign of Portage and Main: get out of the vehicle (<EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A perspective on city views</SPAN></EM>, page A10, May 5.) <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Flood is concerned that drivers will no longer be able to appreciate the unique perspective one has approaching the intersection at that angle. What went unmentioned is that as a result pedestrians are invited onto the street, and isn't that part of the purpose of this project -- to bring people back to these corners? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">An uncelebrated aspect of the downtown street parties was that they afforded a rare, exhilarating view of the intersection from the centre of it all. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Closing east </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Portage</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> could bestow this vista upon urbanites rather than those driving through without participating. Fleeting seconds stretch to minutes of awe. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">I join Flood in recommending a visit to </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Waterfront Drive</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, but after a few circles of a roundabout why not stop the machine and go for a walk? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">It's more beautiful outside those windows. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">KEN GERRARD <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Winnipeg</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 28-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Automotive Showcase: Car Colour Causes A Variety Of Effects -  Or  Does Complexion Affect The Driver?
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, mb    Free Press    May.7/04    Page F1
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">WE spend hours looking at paint swatches to find the perfect colour for our living rooms. We buy clothes based on the colours that make us look good and tell something about us. Many restaurants even pick their colour schemes based on our reaction to certain hues. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">So if colour has such a connection to those areas of our lives, it would stand to reason that colour has an affect on/or is affected by our lives behind the wheel. But what effects? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">For example, we've all heard the rumours about red cars attracting speeding tickets like bugs to windshields (especially the really big, messy ones). Is there any truth to it? And what about other colours? Are they secretly enhancing, complicating and/or ruining your life? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Here's what we dug up. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">* Saucy red numbers Asking if drivers of red cars really get more speeding tickets is sort of like asking if blondes really have more fun. It's all in the attitude of the person at the wheel. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">My local Boys in Blue didn't want to go on the record as saying so, but ask anyone who owns an 'arrest-me red' car and you'll get a pretty good idea. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"All of my life I've owned blue cars," says Madison Dunnigan. "I purchased a red Mustang (last) summer and I've been caught speeding four times!" <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Not to knock Miss Dunnigan, but it could be user error. Who wouldn't feel compelled to race around in a red Mustang? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Psychologist Daniel Ridbey, who has studied colour therapy, says red increases your breathing and heart rate, which in turn could make you drive faster. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"When your heart rate quickens, you do everything faster -- driving, talking, eating," he says. Bottom line? It's not the colour, but what the colour does to you. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">* Black cars look better in the shade <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Henry Ford once said he would sell cars in any colour -- as long as they were black. But I wonder if Hank would rethink that position if he heard that black cars show every tiny imperfection. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">In auto detailer Andrew Weston's opinion, it's a fact that black cars do show dust, dirt, swirl marks, scratches and dents more than cars of any and all other colours. He says it's because there's a bigger contrast between the light reflecting off the surface and the deep, dark black paint. The shinier the paint, the worse the overall problem. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The best colour to hide a multitude of owner-related sins? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"Silver, without a doubt," he says. "Scratches are camouflaged and they don't show the dirt like a white car does." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">If you're nuts about cleanliness and detail and then top it off by buying a black car, you'll drive yourself crazy trying to keep it clean and spend ALL your free time picking out the imperfections, now amplified by the black. Find an owner who doesn't regret the resulting headache from buying a black car, I dare ya. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">* White as the freshly-driven snow <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Kevin Trevhor, who manages a car-cleaning chain, would never buy white. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"They are high maintenance, that's for sure," he says with a whole-hearted laugh. "That's good for my business, but it's gotta be frustrating for owners. They spend a lot of money to clean their car and by the time they get home, they've driven through puddles or slush, or even just the dust and dirt flying up -- they're like magnets for dirt." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">On the up side, big, white cars often look like big, white police cars. If you notice that traffic is tip-toeing around you're white Ford Crown Victoria or Chevrolet Impala -- just in case you're the real thing -- you might be reaping some subliminal safety benefits from your choice of colour and model. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">* Cracking up over blue <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">It's the most popular colour choice for a car, according to a research study conducted by students at </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:place><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Andrew</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">S.</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Douglas</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Community</SPAN></st1:PlaceName><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> </SPAN><st1:PlaceType><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Academy</SPAN></st1:PlaceType></st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> in </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Milwaukee</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, Wisc. Insurance representative Nancy Martoni can't prove that if you own a blue car you're at greater risk of an accident, but, due to the sheer popularity of the colour, "I would say probably about 60 to 65 per cent of the claims I handle have involved blue- or grey-toned cars." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">One of Martoni's clients, who has written off four cars -- three of which were blue -- once joked that blue cars are like green screens in movies. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"It's like you can't see them," she says. "It's almost like they blend in with the sky or something." Her recommendation? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">"Go with a bright yellow... it's bright and cheery. How could you miss it?" <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><EM><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Catrina Coghill is a journalist with Wheelbase Communications, a worldwide supplier of automotive news, features and reviews. You can email her at <A href="mailto:cat@wheelbase.ws"><SPAN style="FONT-STYLE: normal">cat@wheelbase.ws</SPAN></A>.</SPAN></EM><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 29-Jun-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Loaded truck has hippo’s agility: Look Way Ahead, Brake and Steer Earlier To Avoid Surprises
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, Mb    Free Press    May.7/04    Page F4
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">YOU rarely see a 600-pound sumo wrestler on the parallel bars or doing a double flip off the horse. Nor should you expect sports car-like agility from your fully-laden SUV, minivan or pickup. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">There is a huge difference in steering and braking the same vehicle when it is lightly laden and when packed with hundreds of pounds of people and/or cargo. Let's assume you stay within the rated load of the vehicle -- something most owners do not: It will behave as if on drugs, with slow reactions and reluctance to follow directions when there are six or seven people aboard and/or big loads in back. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Generally speaking, drivers first notice the added load as they accelerate away from rest. An attentive driver will usually avoid sudden turns, but might forget about that extra weight when it comes time to stop, especially if confronted with the need to do so in a hurry. The laws of physics have been around for a while and have not been repealed. Everything else being equal, it takes more real estate to stop a heavy object than a light one. A driver used to being able to bring his pickup to an emergency stop in 150 feet or so is in for a very rude surprise when he stands on the brakes with an extra 800 lbs. in the back. Similarly, a parent familiar with the family minivan with one or two people aboard will be stunned at the difference in stopping ability with six children in back. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">A common problem is the case of the occasional loaded driver. Loaded in the sense they've gone to Home Depot and loaded up on the materials for that new deck or family room project. Hundreds of pounds of stuff has been put where it fits -- or in most cases, where it doesn't. That added weight out back -- or even worse, on top -- will come back to haunt you big time should you not take precautions in your driving. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">There are a number of issues related to driving with heavy loads, but for now let's concentrate on two -- braking distance and what happens to the load when you forget about braking distances. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Generally speaking, driving with a heavy load aboard requires the driver to do everything the same -- just sooner and with more care. With the knowledge you can't stop as quickly or turn as easily, the trick is to maximize your awareness, give yourself as much time and space as possible. Look up, way up, much farther down the road to ensure plenty of warning of developments that may require you to take action. Next start your steering or braking inputs sooner than would be the case without all that extra weight, and finally be smooth: Drive as though you had a full glass of water on your lap and try not to spill it. Weight transfer is at the centre of everything a driver does in a vehicle. The amount of weight on each of the four tires, or contact patches, determines the vehicle's ability to grip the road. When we turn, we transfer weight from one side of the vehicle to another, from the tires on one side to those on the opposite side. When we brake, we transfer weight from the rear tires to the fronts. The greater the weight, the greater the transfer effect. Smoothness in steering, braking and accelerating will prevent abrupt weight shifts and the accompanying loss of traction, which usually is a precursor to a loss of control. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">One other piece of advice -- stay alert and reduce speed accordingly. Remember your vehicle is not going to behave the way it normally does. You might have been able to avoid an incident by some last-minute braking or violent pull on the steering wheel when caught unawares in the past. But, if you are facing a similar situation with a heavy load aboard, you are in for a very nasty surprise should you be forced to try any last-second action.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 1-Jul-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ACCIDENT SENDS KIDS TO HOSPITAL
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB    Sun    May 9/04    Page A15
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police are investigating a car accident in the West End that took place yesterday sending two toddlers to hospital with minor injuries. A witness said he heard a "loud bang" about 10:30 a.m. while he was inside Sargent Blue Jeans, on Sargent Avenue at Valour Road. He rushed out of the store to see what happened. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H1 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">DAMAGED VAN<o:p></o:p></SPAN></H1>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He saw a car partially in the front yard of a Valour Road duplex and a damaged van sitting in the intersection. The car had smashed through a wooden fence. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The witness, who didn't want to be identified, said he was told the car was westbound on Sargent Avenue and the van was travelling north on Valour. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Both lights were green," the witness said jokingly, adding "the van hit the car and the car spun and hit the fence." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The man approached the van, which was carrying a young family with two children under five years old, to make sure no one was seriously injured. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He then called 911. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They didn't seem to be hurt. They were shook up, but they weren't hurt," said the witness. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police duty Insp. Tom Kloczko said paramedics transported two patients to Children's Hospital in stable condition. No other information was made available at press time, as officers continued their investigation. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Meanwhile, a passenger was in stable condition after a three-vehicle crash at Henderson Highway and Cheriton Street yesterday afternoon. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Emergency personnel were forced to use the Jaws of Life to remove the passenger from the vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The condition of the other drivers wasn't known at press time last night.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align=right><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">- Staff<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 2-Jul-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Accident kills woman: Early Morning Crash Sends Two To Hospital
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A woman was killed after the car she was riding in crossed a median and demolished a stone planter, a fire hydrant and a tree before careening into a men&#8217;s clothing store.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The smash-up occurred about 1:45 a.m. yesterday on Portage Avenue between Clifton Street and Valour Road.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;That&#8217;s the worst accident I&#8217;ve ever seen&#8221; said passerby Robert Jolivet as he surveyed the crumpled wreck.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;When you look at that, it&#8217;s hard to believe the driver is even alive.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading8 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><STRONG>JUMPED THE MEDIAN<o:p></o:p></STRONG></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 20-year-old victim, who had been in the front-passenger seat of the green Pontiac Grand Prix, was not identified yesterday.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police were having trouble reaching the victim&#8217;s relatives to inform them of her death, said Winnipeg police spokesman Const. Bob Johnson.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 27-year-old male driver was taken to Health Sciences Centre in critical condition.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He was later upgraded to stable.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 25-year-old male passenger was treated at HSC and released.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police are investigating whether alcohol played a role in the collision, said Winnipeg police spokeswoman Const. Shelly Glover.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">They are also analyzing whether speed was a factor.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Grand Prix &#8211; which was travelling east on Portage Avenue &#8211; jumped the median, flipped, then hit George Richards Big &amp; Tall Menswear. The building, located at 1295 Portage Ave., wasn&#8217;t seriously damaged.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Store manager Hans Bredo said he was called to work after the collision triggered a burglar alarm.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Witnesses said police handcuffed a man involved in the collision, said Bredo.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;There was a scuffle going on, too,&#8221; he said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Sabrina Sauderson, who lives near the site, said she was woken up by sirens. Someone told her two men jumped out of the back of the car shortly after she arrived at the scene, she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading8 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><STRONG>&#8216;LET&#8217;S GET OUT OF HERE&#8217;<o:p></o:p></STRONG></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;They said &#8216;Pedro, let&#8217;s go. Let&#8217;s get out of here,&#8221; said Sanderson.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">By yesterday afternoon a small bouquet of<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>flowers had been planted in a mound of gravel in front of the clothing store.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I love you always. Love Cory,&#8221; read the note.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The scene was closed to traffic for nearly 10 hours while police investigated.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">This is the second fatal accident at that location in as many years.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A high-speed crash killed William Kipling, 30 on Feb. 22, 2003, when a 2000 Ford Taurus hit the curb and rolled out of control.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police said that crash may have resulted from drag racing.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 3-Jul-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: High-speed crash kills woman: Car May Have Been Racing On Portage
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, Mb  Free Press    May.8/04    Page B1/B2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">SPEED is being blamed for a horrific single-vehicle collision on Portage Avenue early yesterday morning that killed a 20-year-old woman. The force of the crash was so great that the car, a newer model Pontiac Grand Am, spun into oncoming traffic, snapped a 10-inch diameter tree and bent a fire hydrant before coming to rest in front of George Richards men's clothing store at 1295 Portage Ave. at Spruce Street. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Two men survived the crash, likely because the car's airbags deployed. The 27-year-old driver was taken to the Health Sciences Centre in critical condition, and a 25-year-old male passenger was taken to the HSC where he was treated and released. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It looks like the guy just lost it," a witness said. "He was just going too fast. When he went into the westbound lane he hit an older van and a truck and kept going. It just happened so fast." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police have not released the names of the deceased or injured. The woman's family lives outside the city and was still being contacted by police late yesterday. Police believe the woman is the driver's girlfriend. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He must have been going real fast," King's Florist employee Stan Rowbotham said. "There are pieces of the car everywhere. One of the car's brake rotors broke off and went flying through our front door. There's shattered glass everywhere." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The rotor hit with such impact, the metal drum momentarily imbedded itself in a steel beam of King's Florists, at 1309 Portage, before its momentum flung it through the glass door. "You see things like this in the movies," Rowbotham added. "But this is real. This is horrible." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police believe the car was speeding east on Portage -- at about 120 km/h -- when the driver lost control before the lights at Valour at about 1:45 a.m. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The car went into a skid and hit a large concrete flower planter at the intersection, smashing it and sending the car careering about 75 metres down Portage from Valour Road into oncoming traffic. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The car then hit the tree and the fire hydrant before coming to rest on its wheels. At some point, a passenger's side door was torn off. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The witness said the woman was apparently thrown from the car before it stopped rolling. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"A lot of people were going out of their cars to help," he said. "The paramedics got there about 20 seconds later. They got there fast." Police shut down the west-bound lanes of Portage for most of the morning yesterday as investigators collected evidence. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police arriving at the scene first speculated the Grand Am was stolen. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">However, its keys were found in the ignition. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">There was also speculation the Grand Am was racing an older Dodge Shadow, but police could not verify that. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police are also investigating whether alcohol was involved. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">This is the second fatal accident of its kind at the area in the past two years. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On Feb. 22 last year, a 30-year-old Winnipeg man died when his Ford Taurus, travelling in the westbound lane, crashed into George Richards clothing store. The deceased was thrown from the car.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:Bruce.owen@freepress.mb.ca">Bruce.owen@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>-30-&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 4-Jul-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Police bicycle unit targets motorists in diamond lanes
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, mb  Free Press    May.8/04    Page B10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">THE Winnipeg Police Service's bicycle unit took to the city's streets yesterday to target motorists who use diamond lanes to get around slower-moving traffic. Const. Maxine Sech and Const. Doug Bailey, who head up the 10-member unit, said diamond lane enforcement is just one of the assignments given to the unit. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">They said some drivers use the marked diamond lanes, which are restricted to buses and cyclists during peak hours, to beat traffic jams. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Sech and Bailey also said officers with the unit will also ticket cyclists who ride on sidewalks and weave between pedestrians. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Members of the unit are on patrol at different times, 7 a.m. to midnight seven days a week. They patrol mostly the downtown area, including the riverbanks. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The bike unit was created in 1992 to give police a more visible presence downtown. Officers can be dispatched to any call and enforce any law. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Const. Rommel Vianzon, who's been on the unit for three years, said the officers are popular with the public. "We can also sneak up on the bad guys," he said. "They don't hear us coming." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Const. Brent Tully said officers in the unit can also get to calls quicker as they can go around or through traffic. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We can cover a lot of ground," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He said officers peddle as much as 60 kilometres a shift and average a speed of about 25-30 km/h. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gooch's Bicycle and Hobbies supplies and maintains the unit's mountain bikes.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:Buceowen@freepress.mb.ca">Buceowen@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 5-Jul-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: It’s may? no way!: Mean Ol’ Man Winter Sucker-Punches ‘Peg
NEWS_ITM_BYLN_TXT: By Natalie pona and kevin engstrom
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Note to Mother Nature -- enough already. A winter-like storm from </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:State><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Montana</SPAN></st1:place></st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> landed in the city yesterday, giving Winnipeggers something they thought they had left behind more than a month ago --snow. Up to 48 millimetres of snow and rain was forecast to fall on the city yesterday and today, leading Environment Canada's Jay Anderson to state the obvious. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's here, your worst nightmare," </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Anderson</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Although a May snowstorm isn't unheard of -- a </SPAN><st1:date Month="5" Day="9" Year="2002"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">May 9, 2002</SPAN></st1:date><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">, storm dumped 20 centimetres on unsuspecting Winnipeggers -- it nonetheless made life difficult for motorists. Conditions on the </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Perimeter Highway</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> were "worse than at any time during the past winter," said Headingley Traffic Patrol commander Sgt. Dave Mauro in a press release last night. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Outside the city, several minor collisions and rollovers were reported on various provincial highways. The poor driving conditions led to the partial closure of the </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Trans-Canada Highway</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading8 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><STRONG>COMPLETELY CLOSED <o:p></o:p></STRONG></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">That roadway closed between Headingley and the </SPAN><st1:State><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Saskatchewan</SPAN></st1:place></st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> border early yesterday and remained that way much of the day. The Trans-Canada was completely closed from Headingley to </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Portage</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> la Prairie and Brandon to the </SPAN><st1:State><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Saskatchewan</SPAN></st1:place></st1:State><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> border at press time. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Highway 10 was also closed between the </SPAN><st1:country-region><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">U.S.</SPAN></st1:place></st1:country-region><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> border and Minnedosa for several hours before re-opening. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Travel was still not recommended on that highway, as well as on various other roads throughout the province -- including south of </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Brandon</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">, east of </SPAN><st1:City><st1:place><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg</SPAN></st1:place></st1:City><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> on the </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt;
