The GM Advanced Hybrid System II, derived from the hybrid bus technology, will power GM's next generation of full size pickups due in 2008 and sport utility vehicles in 2007. Next year a belt alternator starter hybrid system coupled to a continuously variable transmission will be offered in the 2006 Saturn VUE while the new Chevrolet Malibu, due out in 2007, will share the same system as the Saturn. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 27-Sep-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: VICTIMS OF CAR THEFT CAUGHT IN A DIFFERENT KIND   OF TRAFFIC: Thieves in Montreal are often linked to organized crime   rings, report shows
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: GLOBE AND MAIL  May 28/04  Page A3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">MONTREAL -- One snowy morning last year, Chantal Verdon looked outside her suburban Montreal home and saw footsteps and tire tracks where her brand-new, $30,000 Subaru was sitting the night before.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">She and her spouse phoned the police. By the time they filed a report, however, the car was probably on a shipping container heading to Poland, Vietnam or South Africa. The couple never saw it again.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">"We were told the thieves had probably already put it in a container, and bye-bye," Ms. Verdon said yesterday.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">That's because Montreal has the worst recovery rate for stolen vehicles in the country. A Statistics Canada report released yesterday shows that while car thefts in Montreal are declining, the chance of owners ever seeing their vehicles again is only about 50 per cent.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">The reverse is true in Western Canada. Winnipeg and Regina have some of the worst car-theft rates in the country, but owners there have the consolation of knowing their vehicles are virtually always found.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">The difference between Montreal and Winnipeg boils down to who is stealing the car. In Montreal and other cities in Quebec and Ontario, the thief is often a criminal linked to an organized ring, who can steal a car in 10 seconds and then use the proceeds to fund illicit activities.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">In Western Canada, the thief is often a teenager who steals wheels for the thrill and abandons them a day or two later.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">"For kids in Winnipeg, the motivation is mainly to have fun," said Rick Linden, a criminologist at the University of Manitoba who heads the province's Auto Theft Task Force. "For people running car-theft rings, the motivation is making money. Shipping a car to Russia or Bahrain can make them $30,000 or $40,000. You'd have to steal from a lot of banks or 7-Elevens to add up to that kind of money."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">Evidence that car theft is no longer the purview of mischievous adolescents emerged when an alleged Hells Angels leader turned himself into Quebec provincial police last month, suspected of leading a car-theft ring that targeted high-end SUVs at luxury car dealerships in the Montreal area.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">According to the Statscan report, Canada's criminal rings are elaborate groups complete with middlemen and brokers, who deploy sophisticated techniques such as identity theft and forged documents to export or resell cars.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">And while some youthful car thieves in Canada may be teen pranksters, those lured into organized rings fit a different profile. A Swedish study found that young people recruited into such rings are most at risk of embarking on a career in crime.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">Overall, car thefts across the country declined in 2002, the year the federal agency studied. But the involvement of organized crime is rising dramatically. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">In 2002, one out of every five stolen vehicles in Canada was not recovered, and therefore may have been stolen by organized groups. In the 1970s, only about 2 per cent of stolen vehicles were never recovered.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">The percentage of stolen cars that aren't recovered varies dramatically across Canada, sinking to as low as 5 per cent in Winnipeg and Victoria, and rising to 44 per cent in Montreal.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">"Among the large [police] forces, Montreal appears to have the largest problem of organized vehicle theft in the country," Statistics Canada says.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">"Montreal is home to the most professional car thieves in North America," said Inspector Mike Diack of the RCMP in Vancouver, who specializes in auto crimes. "It's well known that the best car thieves come from Montreal."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">Statistics Canada says vehicles stolen from homes are much less likely to ever be recovered than those stolen from the street or parking lots. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">Criminals load their illicit cargo into containers with false documentation. Those shipped out of Montreal or Toronto may end up in Europe, South America or East Africa, Statistics Canada says. Those moving through Vancouver often head to Asia.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">"Europol estimates that organized international vehicle trafficking is more profitable than prostitution or any other black-market activity," the agency says.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 28-Sep-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: THEY NEED TO KNOW: What Led To Dad’s Fatal Crash
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The daughter of a 48-year-old West Kildonan man killed in a two-vehicle collision last week says the family wants to know exactly what lead to the deadly mishap. Candace Storoszczuk said she has struggled to find out why the driver of a Chevy Blazer struck her father's Buick Friday afternoon at McPhillips Street and Winnipeg Avenue. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">William Storoszczuk, who was known by his middle name, Jerry, was killed when an SUV with Alberta licence plates broadsided his sedan while he was stopped at a stop sign. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Candace said she wants to hear the full story directly from witnesses. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We want to talk to somebody to find out what happened so we can have closure," she said. "We're hearing all these different stories." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 39-year-old driver of the Blazer was taken into custody for questioning shortly after the collision. There is no further information regarding the status of the driver, police said yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He always told me I would always be his little girl," 28-year-old Candace said of her late father. "We just miss him. We love him. This is an innocent man who didn't do anything." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The father of three worked with disabled people and was en route to his job with a co-worker when the Blazer sheared a hydro pole at ground level, travelled another 15 metres and struck the eastbound Buick near the driver's door. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The force of the collision drove the Buick about six metres, taking out several traffic signs, witnesses said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was very kind-hearted. He would do anything for anybody. He was strong-willed," Candace said of her dad. "He was humorous. He always put a smile on everybody's face -- an all around good guy." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Blazer was seen swerving from side to side prior to colliding with the utility pole, witnesses said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver was treated for minor injuries and released from Seven Oaks General Hospital. Police have said alcohol was not a factor in the deadly collision. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">PASSENGER IN STABLE CONDITION <o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 59-year-old man, a passenger in the Buick, remains in stable condition, police said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Jerry's family said he loved music, his cats, working on classic cars and spending time with his grandkids. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He just wanted the best for us. He loved his grandchildren too. He just adored them," Candace said. "I didn't want to believe it. I thought it was a bad dream, this wasn't happening." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The family wants to thank emergency personnel and some 50 bystanders who tried to help at the scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Everybody tried to do the best they could," Candace said.</SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 29-Sep-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: FAMILY WANTS ANSWERS INTO WHAT CAUSED FATAL ACCIDENT
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  May.31/04  Page B1/B2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">THE family of a Winnipeg man killed Friday when the car he was driving was broadsided while stopped at an intersection is seeking answers about what happened. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police have said drugs and alcohol were not involved in the accident, in which a sport utility vehicle went over the curb on McPhillips Street and took out a hydro pole before striking William Storoszczuk's car. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Storoszczuk, 48, was stopped at a stop sign on Winnipeg Avenue shortly after noon, about to turn right onto McPhillips. He was killed, while a 59-year-old passenger in the car, who family members said was a co-worker, remains in hospital with a broken pelvis. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver of the SUV, a 39-year-old Alberta man, was not immediately charged. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Storoszczuk's youngest son, Terry, said he's received little information from the police about how the accident happened and would like to hear from any witnesses. "All I know is my dad was at a stop sign," he said. "We don't know what happened." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The traffic fatality was Winnipeg's sixth this year. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Storoszczuk is survived by three children: Terry, 25; Christopher, 27; and Candace, 28. He was separated from his second wife, Gale Storoszczuk, but the two remained friends. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Terry said he'll always remember how secure he felt around his father, a strict but fair man who enjoyed martial arts and was an expert in kung fu. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A lifelong Winnipeg resident "he was a well-respected man and it was always easy to talk to him," Terry Storoszczuk said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Storoszczuk loved working on cars and engines. But he also had a softer side. He enjoyed music and was a pet lover who will be buried with a photograph of one of his favourite cats. "He loved life," said Gale Storoszczuk. "He lived every day for the day." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">After working close to 30 years in milk production at Lucerne Foods Ltd., Storoszczuk had more recently worked with an agency that helped mentally handicapped people, family members said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The funeral is planned for Wednesday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:paul.egan@freepress.mb.ca">paul.egan@freepress.mb.ca</A></SPAN></I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 30-Sep-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: OTTAWA WANTS FUEL-EFFICIENT CARS ON CANADA’S ROAD: Review Rules Out Major Tax Hike At Pump
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  May.31/04  Page B8
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">OTTAWA -- The federal government is reviewing a range of proposals to lessen Canadians' reliance on gasoline and reduce the creation of fuel emissions, although a dramatic tax hike on pump prices has apparently been ruled out.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The proposals, presented by a group of officials from four government departments, are centred on new incentives to convince motorists to buy more fuel-efficient vehicles and for manufacturers to make them. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The package of proposals is part of the government's continuing attempts to reduce fuel emissions and meet Canada's Kyoto accord targets.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The proposals have been presented to MP Jim Karygiannis, parliamentary secretary to Transport Minister Tony Valeri.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mr. Karygiannis said all of the proposals -- except the option of boosting gas taxes by anywhere between 5 cents and 20 cents per litre -- will be considered. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We're looking at pretty well everything but the fuel tax."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The recommendations are expected to be taken to cabinet in the fall, said Robin Browne, spokesman for Transport Canada.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The proposals under strong consideration, compiled in a document called Fuel-efficient Working Group on Economic Instruments, include: <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">incentives for consumers to buy more efficient cars, including hybrids.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">incentives for auto makers to make more efficient cars, including hybrids.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">subsidies for taxi drivers to buy fuel-efficient vehicles.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">more federal government purchases of fuel-efficient or hybrid vehicles.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">increased tax on large, gas-guzzling vehicles.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">increased taxes -- or "feebates" --on all new vehicle purchases that would vary based on the car's efficiency.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">incentives for car makers to use more efficient technology in their manufacturing processes.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Increasing the gas tax, however, isn't the only proposal in the package that won't get strong consideration, Mr. Karygiannis said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It is also unlikely that the government will consider tax credits for the purchase of fuel-efficient vehicles, incentives for the construction of new plants that will make certain types of vehicles, a tax aimed solely at urban areas, or consumer rebates based on the purchase of technologies, instead of fuel efficiency.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Fuel emissions have become an increasingly controversial subject in Canada in recent years, prompting heated debates between regions and industrial sectors.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The federal government has angered auto makers by demanding they meet tough fuel economy standards by redesigning cars, trucks, minivans and sport utility vehicles so that by 2010, each company's fleet of vehicles burns less gasoline than it did at the beginning of the decade.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The automotive industry says Ottawa is demanding too much, while Environment Minister David Anderson has responded that the auto makers have known since 2002 that they would be included in Canada's Kyoto targets.</SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 1-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: NEIGHBOURS SHAKEN: Senior’s Home Mourns After Fatal Collision
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Sun  May 30/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The death of a 77-year-old Winnipeg woman in a head-on collision Friday has rocked the retirement home where she lived, friends say. "We've been doing a lot of sitting around and crying on each other's shoulders," Ruth Heinrichs said of her friend Sally Wiens. "We'll miss her." <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Jenny Giesbrecht said residents of Bethel Place, where Wiens lived on Stafford Street, are having a tough time knowing they won't see her again. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"She was a wonderful person, very caring," Giesbrecht said. "Everybody's in a very sad mood because we've never experienced anything like this." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wiens was a passenger in a 1995 Plymouth Voyageur minivan that collided with another van in the 3800-block of Henderson Highway. The accident crushed the passenger side of the minivan, driven by Bethel Place resident Margaret Lowe. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">East St. Paul Police Const. Jason Soltys said Wiens was rushed by ambulance to Concordia Hospital where she later died of her injuries. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Heinrichs, who met Wiens nearly six years ago, couldn't believe the grim news when a friend called yesterday morning. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I went down to see if the van was there and it wasn't," she said. "She loved to go for rides." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wiens, a widow who was retired, looked like "her jolly old self," said Heinrichs, who last saw her on Thursday having dinner with her daughter. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">GREEN THUMB <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wiens also has two sons, several grandchildren and great-grandchildren, Heinrichs said. Immediate family members could not be reached yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Friends will remember Wiens as a woman with a green thumb who loved to socialize and play card games, Heinrichs said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Lowe, who sustained non-life threatening injuries in the crash, was released from Seven Oaks Hospital Friday night, a spokeswoman for the health centre said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Three teenage occupants of the other vehicle, a 1992 Dodge Caravan, also suffered non-life threatening injuries. An update on their condition was not available.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 2-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CRUISERS PLAY IT SAFE: Dozens Of Hotrods Inspected At Clinic
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, MB  Sun  May.30/04  Page A10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">They came, they opened their hoods, they got warnings. Dozens of Sunday night cruisers, lured in by the possibility of winning expensive parts like rims and tires, allowed provincial vehicle inspectors to pore over their hotrods yesterday in the parking lot of Polo Park Shopping Centre. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They said both my taillights are out, my tachometer is obstructing my vision, my tires have low tread," said 18-year-old Dan Malcolmson, after having his burgundy 1970 Chevrolet Monte Carlo examined. "I've gotten a couple of tickets already for having low tread." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">PEEK UNDER THE HOOD <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police, along with the Manitoba Association of Auto Clubs, the Manitoba Safety Council and the provincial vehicle inspections branch, organized the car show and clinic at Polo Park. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The aim was to take a look at auto enthusiasts' vehicles and let them know whether their cars, trucks or motorcycles comply with the Manitoba Highway Traffic Act. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">To bring drivers in, they were offered a ballot and the chance to win cool car prizes in exchange for a short peek under the hood. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police usually hand out about 60 tickets to hotrodders each cruising night for infractions such as tinted windows, altered suspensions, noisy mufflers, neon underglow lights and squealing tires. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Patrol Sgt. Barb Tobin said many young people don't realize the fancy add-ons are actually against the law. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They need to be operating vehicles that are safe," she said. "They like the look of the car with different coloured lights or no licence plates on the front ... they're not realizing what they're doing is illegal." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Inspector Keith MacDonald said he saw loose batteries, tinted windows and poor suspension systems. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Many of the motorists he talked to were happy to have learned what was wrong with their cars before they got pulled over by the police. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They're pretty grateful," said MacDonald. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Too dark a tint is good for a $105 ticket."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 3-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: COLLISION KILLS MAN: Stopped car T-boned by speeding Blazer
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 48-year-old man was killed and a 58-year-old man was in stable condition at the Health Sciences Centre with a broken pelvis yesterday following a two-vehicle collision on McPhillips Street. The men were in an older model Buick sedan that was broadsided by a Chevy Blazer with Alberta licence plates about 12:15 p.m. as the car sat at a stop sign on Winnipeg Avenue. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 39-year-old driver of the Blazer was taken into custody for questioning shortly after the collision, said police spokesman Const. Bob Johnson. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He is thankful for air bags," said Johnson. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Blazer sheared a hydro pole at ground level prior to striking the Buick over the driver's door. The impact left only the top of the wooden pole dangling from the power lines.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">After demolishing the utility pole, the Blazer travelled another 15 metres into the side of the eastbound Buick. The force of the collision drove the Buick about six metres, taking out several traffic signs. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I heard the pole snap, ran outside and saw the white car hit the blue car at the stop sign," said Anh Ngo, a cashier at a business located across the street from the carnage. "The white car was speeding. There was a lot of smoke." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H2 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 3pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><EM>SWERVING FROM SIDE TO SIDE <o:p></o:p></EM></SPAN></H2>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Other witnesses said the Blazer was swerving from side to side prior to colliding with the utility pole. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Within seconds of the crash about 50 people were on scene to lend a hand, said Alan, who was sitting in his nearby office when the collision occurred. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I looked out the window and saw the hydro pole bobbing up and down and tons of smoke," said Alan, who did not want his last name used. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I tried to get near the Blazer but there was so much smoke I walked to the other side. The smoke was so thick you couldn't see the Buick. I thought it was going to blow," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Alan said he felt a sense of helplessness as he peered inside the passenger side window of the Buick. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The doors were pushed in so far there was no way I could get them out. The driver was right up against the passenger," said Alan. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Blazer was embedded almost a metre into the Buick. The smoke was caused when the Blazer's driver's-side front wheel continued to spin against the Buick's tire after the collision, said Alan. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Emergency workers needed 30 minutes to cut off the roof and remove the victims from the Buick. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The driver of the Blazer sat in the SUV until the police got him out. It seemed like he was pretty stunned," said Alan. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He was treated for minor injuries and released from Seven Oaks Hospital, said Insp. Blair McCorrister. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Alcohol was not a factor in the deadly collision, said McCorrister. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 4-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: HENDERSON VAN CRASH FATAL: Woman dies after smash-up; 3 hurt
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 77-year-old Winnipeg woman was killed yesterday afternoon after a near head-on crash along a quiet stretch of Henderson Highway. East St. Paul Police Chief Harry Bakema said city resident Sally Wiens succumbed to the serious injuries she sustained last night after the 1995 Plymouth Voyageur minivan she was riding in collided with another vehicle. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The accident occurred about 4:20 p.m. in the 3800-block of Henderson in East St. Paul. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A teenager at the scene, who didn't want to be named, said he was driving south on Henderson in his parents' Dodge Caravan when something went wrong and he collided with an oncoming Plymouth Voyageur. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The speed limit on the stretch of road is 70 km/h. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Everything was fine and the next second I was this way," said the youth, using his hand to show a sideways direction. "It was like, ditch. I don't even remember hitting the car." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The impact of the crash flipped the Caravan onto its roof and it came to rest in the east side ditch. The Voyageur, carrying Wiens and another elderly woman, stopped on the road with its windshield shattered and front end severely pushed in. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wiens died last night. The second woman was listed in stable condition. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A teenage boy and girl from the Caravan were also taken to hospital with non life-threatening injuries. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver, who suffered scratches, said he was devastated his friends had been hurt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'd rather it happened to me than happen to them," said the teenager, tears streaming down his face. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Bakema said officers are continuing to investigate. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 5-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: VANDALS TRASH CARS: Owner fumes as ‘morons’ strike
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Vandals rampaged through the lot of a St. Boniface autobody shop early yesterday morning, causing an estimated $12,000 in damage. The punks damaged 10 vehicles at Norland Auto Body at 750 Tache Ave. -- smashing windows, tearing out door locks and ignitions, and stealing two factory stereo systems. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I agree with what the police said. They called them 'mindless morons with nothing to do,'" said Garry Wachal, the angry owner. "They (cops) said there's not much chance of catching them." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">$15,000 DAMAGE <o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It's the second time in three years that Wachal has been hit by hooligans. An eerily similar incident occurred Aug. 11, 2001, when a couple of punks vandalized 10 vehicles in the lot just north of Provencher Boulevard, causing more than $15,000 damage. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">That incident was witnessed by then St. Boniface Coun. Dan Vandal and his wife, who live in a neighbouring home. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Vandal, who is running in the upcoming June 22 mayoral election, called police but they didn't show up until 90 minutes later. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wachal, 58, cannot believe no one in the area reported seeing anything. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"These guys had to be here for awhile," he said. "This wasn't a five-minute spree." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The damage won't be covered by his insurance because the open compound lot isn't fenced in, said the irate business owner. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The vandals also went through a dumpster and retrieved discarded fluorescent lights they later smashed on several vehicles. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">They even wrote on one vehicle with a substance that appeared to be strawberry jam. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They took stuff from one car and put it in another -- total useless movements," Wachal said. "You have to wonder where these people come from, what makes them tick."&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 6-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ONE DEAD, FOUR INJURED AS MINIVANS COLLIDE
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  May 29/04  Page A3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An elderly Winnipeg woman was killed and four people injured in a head-on collision on Henderson Highway north of the Perimeter Highway in East St. Paul yesterday. The victim was identified as Sally Wiens, 77. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She and another elderly woman were travelling north in a 1995 Plymouth Voyager when it collided head-on with a 1992 Dodge Caravan carrying three teenagers from Winnipeg, said Const. Norm Carter of the East. St. Paul police department. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">One teen was treated and released at the scene, while the other two were taken to Seven Oaks General Hospital, where Carter said they were reported in stable condition. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The elderly victim's friend is also being treated in hospital, he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Plymouth ended up in the ditch upside down following the accident, while the other heavily damaged van remained on the highway in a pile of broken glass and twisted metal. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Carter said the cause of the accident was under investigation. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The road was dry and the sky was crystal clear yesterday, but traffic-accident statistics shows that it's under those condition that most accidents happen. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Officials have said that dangerous driving conditions cause most drivers to slow down and take care, while perfect conditions often lead to complacency and high speeds. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 7-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ONE DEAD, ANOTHER HURT AFTER SUV HITS POLE, AUTO
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  May 29/04  Page B1
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">ONE man is dead and another is in hospital with a broken pelvis after a sport utility vehicle snapped a hydro pole and T-boned the car the two men were in shortly after noon yesterday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver of the SUV, a 39-year-old Alberta man, was not seriously injured. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The crash happened at McPhillips Street and Winnipeg Avenue. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The SUV, southbound on McPhillips, hopped the west curb and hit the hydro pole. It then collided with the car, which was stopped on Winnipeg Avenue facing east, waiting to turn south onto McPhillips, witnesses said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The car's driver, a 48-year-old Winnipeg man, died in the crash. Police did not identify him yesterday, pending notification of family. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The passenger in the car, a 58-year-old Winnipeg man, was listed in stable condition at Health Sciences Centre with a broken pelvis, police said. The driver of the SUV was treated at hospital and released. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Firefighters had to peel the roof off the badly damaged car to remove the two men. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Yesterday's death marked the sixth motor vehicle accident fatality in Winnipeg this year, a police spokesman said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg has averaged about 20 traffic fatalities a year in recent years. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Nobody has been charged and an investigation continues, police said. Alcohol was not a factor in the crash, the spokesman said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Cashier Anh Ngo was working at Van Loi Vegetables &amp; Asian Groceries on McPhillips when she saw the pole snap, then looked to see the impact of the two vehicles, she said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"There was tons of smoke for like 15 minutes," Ngo said. "None of them got out until the paramedics and the ambulance came." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The crash also toppled a fire hydrant. The bottom half of the hydro pole was on the ground and the top half was dangling from hydro wires. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dinh Duong, owner of another nearby shop, Fong Yinh, said the wheels of the SUV continued to spin after it came to a stop. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mary-Ellen Allen, a registered nurse, had just finished getting the oil in her vehicle changed at a Notre Dame Avenue and McPhillips service station when she heard the screeching impact. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She ran to the scene. Finding a retired paramedic and other passersby attending to the two men trapped inside the car, she turned her attention to the driver of the SUV. He was conscious but appeared to be in a daze, Allen said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He wanted to get out of the car; I wouldn't let him," said Allen, a Winnipeg woman who works at Seven Oaks General Hospital. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I undid his seatbelt so he could breathe better and I just stayed with him."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 8-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: POLICE BUSY DURING ROAD SAFETY WEEK
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  May 29/04  Page B6
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">RCMP in Manitoba charged 24 people with impaired driving on the week of the Victoria Day long weekend -- up eight from the year before. Const. Eric Edmonds said the increase shows more has to be done to educate motorists about the dangers of drinking and driving. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The charges were laid during Canada Road Safety Week May 17-24. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Edmonds said Mounties also ticketed 205 people for not wearing a seat-belt, 84 drivers for not stopping at a stop sign or traffic signal and 471 for speeding. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He said on the plus side, it appears more people are buckling up now that there are new penalties: The province recently raised the fine for not wearing a seat-belt to $230, up from $100. Since Nov. 1, Manitoba drivers who are caught not wearing seat-belts have also been assessed two driver's licence demerit points. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Edmonds also said nine people were seriously injured in collisions and one person was killed in Manitoba during national Road Safety Week. David Bate died May 23 when he lost control of his four-wheel all- terrain vehicle on Hazelridge Road east of Hwy. 12 in the RM of Springfield. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">No statistics were available from the Winnipeg Police Service. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 9-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: FARMER TO PAY FOR CRASHES: Cattle ran loose across highway
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  May 29/04  Page B7
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A Manitoba cattle farmer must pay more than $25,000 in damages caused when a herd of hungry heifers escaped from their fenced-in pasture and caused three separate highway crashes. Several of Glen Lamb's Black Angus cows died in the October 2001 carnage on Hwy. 250 near Newdale, but all motorists involved in the accident survived with only minor injuries. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Their vehicles weren't so lucky, with Manitoba Public Insurance paying out $33,000 in damages. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">MPI turned around and sued Lamb, claiming he was negligent by allowing his cattle to escape and run onto a darkened highway under a moonless nighttime sky. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Queen's Bench Justice Lea Duval agreed this week, finding Lamb hadn't kept the gate surrounding his 40-acre property in good repair. She also criticized the farmer for not seeking help once the herd was on the loose. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He breached his duty of care to persons travelling on Hwy. 250 when he attempted to herd his cattle without assistance across a two-lane highway in the dark and without establishing a warning system to prevent travellers on the roadway from colliding with crossing cattle," said Duval. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She noted Lamb's relatives lived on a nearby farm and could have helped him corral the cows. Lamb claimed the cattle got "spooked" and scattered in all directions of the highway after breaking his barbed-wire gate. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He told court of his desperate search-and-rescue efforts. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The first accident involved an MTS driver, who hit three head of cattle at nearly 60 km/h. Duval ruled that Lamb should have tried to flag down the motorist. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The motorist then drove away, his van still intact, only to hit another heifer two minutes later. The crash caused extensive damage to his vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Duval faulted the motorist for 50 per cent of that collision, claiming he was driving too fast considering he knew there were still cattle on the loose. Lamb must cover the other 50 per cent. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The other crash involved a semi-trailer that struck a cow while driving 100 km/h. The driver suffered a bruised sternum and was hospitalized with breathing difficulties. "The defendant has a legal duty to take reasonable care to ensure that his animals are securely fenced and do not escape onto a highway causing injury to persons or property," Duval wrote in her decision.</SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 10-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LOCAL ECONOMY, CHARITIES MAJOR BENEFICIARIES OF AUTO DEALERS
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press Insert  May 29/04  Page 2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">From joint fundraisers to direct economic spinoffs, members of the Manitoba Motor Dealers Association contribute millions of dollars annually to the province&#8217;s economy.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">As an employer, the industry keeps more than 5000 Manitobans working, providing a combined payroll in excess of $200 million, says says Shirley Canty, MMDA&#8217;s Executive Director.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The dealerships also generate more than $2 billion in annual sales with all the attendant economic spin-off benefits that implies, from staff who buy homes to those who support the professional and commercial sectors.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Meanwhile, a combined $50 million in taxes is generated by the dealerships for the municipal, provincial and federal levels of government. And if that isn&#8217;t enough, the Association&#8217;s 130 dealerships have also invested more than $500 million in their land, equipment and buildings.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;The dealer in your community personally invests money and provides local employment,&#8221; Ms. Canty says. &#8220;They are also active in local organizations and assist in the community as well as the business to grow and prosper.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">While the direct economic benefits may not be immediately obvious to customers who buy a vehicle or visit a dealership for maintenance work, many of today&#8217;s dealers are community minded and play a visible role in supporting and participating in local events and fundraisers.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Such is the case with the annual MMDA Charity Golf Tournament.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">$600,000 for Special Olympians<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Held each summer to raise funds for Special Olympics, this co-ed annual event has been successful in helping to raise $600,000 over the last 15 years, says Randy Gauthier, tournament chairman for the last five years.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;Last year, we raised about $65,000,&#8221; he adds, noting the tournament has become popular and never lacks for participants. Dealers and other volunteers organize the event and solicit prizes for winners.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">As a result, Mr. Gauthier says the MMDA &#8220;has probably got the best prize list in Manitoba.&#8221; Winners have collected TVs, barbecues, mountain bikes, watches, bracelets and electronic goods in addition to trophies.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The MMDA&#8217;s community and philanthropic efforts cover a wide scope. In 1999, for example, the MMDA partnered with the Kidney Foundation in the Kidney Cars program.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">This program generates funds for the Foundation by picking up and selling derelict vehicles. Dealers in Winnipeg, Brandon, Selkirk, Steinbach and Portage La Prairie act as drop-off depots.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In another provincial initiative, dealer members have provided vehicles for Manitoba Public Insurance&#8217;s Student Driver Education Program for years.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ms. Canty, representing the MMDA, has sat on the Driver Ed Steering Committee herself since program vas revamped. There has been a steady 20 percent increase in students per year.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Students, meanwhile, also benefit from the Gerald Rewucki Memorial Scholarship - a memorial fund in honour of the late Gerald Rewucki of Eastern Chrysler in Winnipeg. Mr. Rewucki sat on the MMDA board of directors at the time of his passing.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Two annual scholarships are also presented to Manitoba students attending Georgian College in Ontario and Assiniboine College in Manitoba.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In rural Manitoba, there is ongoing support for activities and programs too numerous to name, says Don Neufeld, MMDA President and owner of Auto City Mazda in Steinbach.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mr. Neufeld says the dealers are often asked for donations and willingly support local sports teams and other activities.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Bob Kozminski, MMDA&#8217;s immediate past president and owner of Keystone Ford Sales on Regent Avenue, says dealers there, in addition to helping with the golf tournament, support medical fundraising initiatives.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">These include the Run for a Cure for cancer and juvenile diabetes research among other joint community initiatives such as the fireworks display for Transcona&#8217;s annual Hi Neighbour festival.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 11-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: HOW A L'IL BOOST CAN BE LIFESAVER: $30 Child Seat A Must: Study
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It costs as little as $30 to dramatically improve the odds a small child will survive a car crash, but studies show more than 70% of parents don't bother with the expense. According to a Safe Kids Canada survey conducted this spring, only 28% of parents with children between four and nine said they used booster seats, which raise children enough to keep them secured by standard seatbelts. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Parents don't realize that children younger than six are not big enough to actually be safe in a seatbelt," said Dr. Sande Harlos, the Winnipeg Regional Health Authority's medical officer of health. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An average of 35 kids between four and nine die each year in car crashes, but many of those deaths could be prevented by the use of booster seats, Harlos said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Using it for every trip can save your children's lives and that certainly has to be worth it," Harlos said yesterday during a press conference to mark the beginning of Safe Kids Week. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">GREATER RISK <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The focus of this year's injury prevention campaign is child passenger safety. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Most parents believe their kids are too big or too old to use the safety device, Harlos said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Those kids are at a greater risk of suffering serious injuries to the upper body and head in a crash, said Dr. Patrick McDonald, a pediatric neurosurgeon at the Children's Hospital. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">To wear a seatbelt without a safety seat, a child should measure 63 cm from the tailbone to the top of the head while sitting up straight in a chair, Harlos said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In the car, the shoulder belt should not touch the child's neck while the lap belt should fit low over the hip bones. Seatbelts should not be tucked behind the child or under the arm, Harlos said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">There is legislation in Manitoba that makes booster seats mandatory for kids under five or 22.5 kg. It carries $230 fine, a government spokesman said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Healthy Living Minister Jim Rondeau said yesterday the province intends to amend the law once a national standard is developed. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It doesn't make sense to change ours until we get total agreement (amongst all provinces), which we're near, I understand," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service offers free child seat inspections at seven of its stations, platoon chief Bob Wright said.</SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 12-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: GONE CRUISIN’: Got My Wheels, Got A Mugen Front End – I’m Ready To Go
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Minutes after Sunday supper is cleared off the table, Jake Zoleta, 17, heads out to his 1996 Honda Civic and begins his weekly routine.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt;
