FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I usually have a route that I go,&#8221; says Zoleta, who&#8217;s had his licence for just over a year.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I go down Portage to Main Street, into Kildonan Park, back down Main onto Portage, down St. James to McDonald&#8217;s on St. James.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Tec Voc student often heads out with his friends and cousins or with other members of a cruising club based out of Street Image, a Keewatin Street auto part retailer.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading8 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><STRONG>&#8216;An icon in Winnipeg&#8217;<o:p></o:p></STRONG></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;It&#8217;s fun,&#8221; he says. &#8220;You see different kinds of cars and the effort that people go into making their cars look good.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dubbed &#8216;cruise night,&#8221; a drive through the city on a sunny Sunday evening is now Winnipeg&#8217;s biggest unorganized summer event.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;It&#8217;s an icon in Winnipeg,&#8221; says 17-year-old Jan Remer.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">But as the popularity of cruise nights has increased over the past the resulting noise, garbage and fast drivers.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Barbara Toban, an administrative sergeant in the traffic division of the Winnipeg Police Service, says noise, spectators and speed are the main factors with the large numbers of drivers on Sunday nights.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;It&#8217;s the whole noise thing that disturbs the peace of the residents in that area,&#8221; she says.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;There are real safety concerns there with the speeds that these cars attain.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Remer, who also hits the roads with his friends every Sunday, says there are two kinds of street races: Spot and drag.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He says spot races are more dangerous because they happen right on Portage.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I guess those are the stupid races,&#8221; he says.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Remer says drag races take place near city outskirts, such as Brady Road, Hamelin Street or Route 90.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading8 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><STRONG>Fast and the Furious wannabes<o:p></o:p></STRONG></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;They&#8217;ll pretty much do what you see in the Fast and the<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Furious,&#8221; he says, referring to the 2001 flick featuring slick Los<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Angeles drag races.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Over the past couple of summers, Daniel McIntyre Ward Coun, Harvey Smith has received many complaints from residents in his area about Sunday night drivers, mainly because of noise and garbage left lying around.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;Here&#8217;s an event that no one has planned, no one&#8217;s accountable, no one&#8217;s in charge of the event,&#8221; he says.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;To some extent young people are the ones largely credited with the problem.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Remer does not see himself as part of the problem. He works 38 hours every weekend at two jobs, and has put nearly $20,000 into fixing up his two vehicles &#8212; a 1991 and a 1993 5.0 litre Mustang (not to mention the two Mustangs he&#8217;s written off).<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;Personally, I guess I&#8217;ve always wanted to be the notorious street racer that gets the girls and the nice rides,&#8221; says Remer, who&#8217;s currently eyeing up his uncle&#8217;s 1968 Cougar.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Zoleta has also put a lot of money and effort into his car.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I got a Mugen front end, I did some engine work to it, I did suspension,&#8221; he says, adding he&#8217;s planning on installing Japanese-imported parts to improve the look of his car.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;You don&#8217;t have to have a cool car to take part, but I&#8217;d say to be cruising in a club or go racing, you&#8217;d definitely want a nice ccar,&#8221; says Remer.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 13-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: 'OLDER' KIDS STILL NEED BOOSTER SEATS
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.01/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">More than 70 per cent of parents are putting their older children at risk by not using booster seats in their vehicles, according to Safe Kids Canada. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A new study by the injury prevention program found that although booster seats are recommended for children aged four to nine, only 28 per cent of parents surveyed used them. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The results were announced yesterday during the launch of Safe Kids Week 2004. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"There's quite a misconception out there," said Dr. Sande Harlos, medical officer with the Winnipeg Regional Health Authority. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Booster seats are used in vehicles to help children fit more safely beneath a seatbelt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The majority of parents surveyed said their children were too big or old for booster seats, or simply didn't need one. Over half thought children were big enough for seat belts alone by the age of six. Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service platoon chief Bob Wright said this isn't the case. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It depends on the child's build more than anything else," said Wright. "Age has nothing to do with it." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">If children are too small for seatbelts, the belts will rest across their abdomen and neck, instead of the shoulder, chest and hipbones. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In an accident, they can suffer internal damage to areas like the liver, kidneys, and spine. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"These are injuries that are devastating injuries. Some of these children never walk again," said pediatric neurosurgeon Patrick McDonald. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The study found that over 35 Canadian children aged four to nine die every year in vehicle crashes, and an additional 360 have serious injuries. In Manitoba, 13 children under the age of nine died in motor vehicle accidents between 1999-2002, according to the Children's Hospital. It's believed 30 to 40 per cent of them weren't properly restrained. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"If many of those children were in booster seats rather than seat belts, may of those injuries, we feel, could have been prevented," said Harlos. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Over 40 children from Tuxedo Park School were in attendance for yesterday's launch. When asked if they used booster seats, only a handful raised their hand. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wright said peer pressure might play a role in the number of children who don't want booster seats. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"You know what it's like when you go to school. You're a baby if you have to sit in a booster seat," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Safe Kids Canada is distributing pamphlets and measuring charts to 740 schools in the province. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Seven of the Winnipeg Fire Paramedics Service branches are offering free inspections to make sure the seats are installed correctly. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Safe Kids Canada says most children under the age of nine should use booster seats, and should have a seated height of at least 63 cm before using a seat belt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:lindsey.wiebe@freepress.mb.ca">lindsey.wiebe@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 14-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: MOST KIDS 4 TO 9 NOT BUCKLED IN SAFETY: Parents Aren't Sure When Booster Seats Are Required, Safety Groups Say, And Many Children Are At Risk As A Result
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  June.01/04  Page A17
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Four-year-old &#201;mile Kingsbury was in an unusually chatty mood on his way home from daycare. He started talking while he was being secured in his booster seat, and kept talking as he headed home, with dad turning his head repeatedly to answer the boy's questions.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The distraction led him to miss a red light and plow into another car at about 60 kilometres per hour. Their Kia Rio was totalled.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#201;ric Kingsbury was a little beat up by the deployed air bag. Little &#201;mile was left crying, the powder from the air bag burning his eyes, but otherwise unscathed. (Occupants of the other car were wearing seat belts and received very minor injuries.)<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It was a violent collision, but he didn't even budge," Mr. Kingsbury recalled yesterday. "The booster seat saved him from serious injury. I hate to even think about it, but it probably saved his life."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 31-year-old Blainville, Que., man was recounting the incident that occurred only two weeks ago to help kick off a new a campaign to make booster seats mandatory for children aged 4 to 9. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"This is really a forgotten group of children. They're too big for car seats, but too small to use seat belts safely. They need booster seats," said Allyson Hewitt, executive director of Safe Kids Canada, an injury-prevention group.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Safe Kids released polling data yesterday that showed only 28 per cent of children in that 4-to-9 age group use booster seats. That is a stark contrast to the number of Canadian adults who wear seat belts -- more than 90 per cent -- and the number of younger children in car seats -- almost 80 per cent.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The poll revealed that the vast majority of parents mistakenly believe that a seat belt alone will provide ample protection for children. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In fact, seat belts are designed for adult bodies: In a violent collision, the hips absorb the pressure of the lap belt, and the shoulder the pressure of the shoulder belt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In children under about 1.45 metres in height (4 feet 9 inches), when there is a collision, the pressure from the lap belt is absorbed by the abdomen, and the pressure of the shoulder belt is absorbed by the neck. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Ken Shaw, a pediatric trauma surgeon at Montreal Children's Hospital, said this leads to horrific injuries, such as snapping of the spine and crushing of vital organs like the liver and spleen. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"This phenomenon is so common, we have a name for it: Seat Belt Syndrome," he said. "When you treat these badly injured children, you can actually see the imprint of the seat belt on the child's abdomen."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Shaw said by boosting the children up a little higher, to simulate adult height, these injuries can be largely avoided. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">To date, Quebec is the only province where booster seats are mandatory, but the Ontario government has introduced draft legislation to do the same. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In Quebec, all children with a seated height of less than 63 centimetres must be secured in a car seat. The penalty for not doing so is the same as not wearing a seat belt -- a $100 fine and two demerit points.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The proposed Ontario rules would make it mandatory for all children weighing less than 36 kilograms (80 pounds), or measuring less than 1.45 metres to be secured in a booster seat. Currently, it is mandatory for all children under 18 kilograms (40 pounds) to be in a car seat. The proposed legislation states that once children turn eight years old, however, they are no longer required to use boosters.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ms. Hewitt praised Quebec and Ontario for their approach, and urged all other provinces and territories to follow suit. But she said there needs to be some effort put into educating parents.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The polling also shows that parents get resistance from children.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Some kids are more conscious of wanting to look grown up," said Karen Odegaard, a mother of two from Brantford, Ont., whose eight-year-old, 30-kilogram daughter graduated from a booster seat at age six.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I can see a lot of kids saying, 'I'm not a baby any more.' It would be quite hard," she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Safe Kids Canada decided to embark on the booster-seat campaign after analyzing data on motor-vehicle crashes and injuries. During the past decade, the number of injuries and deaths of children in collisions has dropped sharply in the under-5 age group and in the over-9 age group. But injuries have fallen only marginally, and death rates not at all in the 5-to-9 group, when children make the transition from car seats to seat belts -- more often than not without booster seats.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Each year, 35 children in the 4-to-9 age group are killed in motor-vehicle crashes, and another 360 are badly injured. Research published last year suggests that using booster seats would cut those numbers by at least 60 per cent.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Seat belt test<o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">1. Measure your child from the tailbone to the top of the head when he or she is sitting down. This measurement, called "seated height," needs to be at least 63 centimetres (25 inches) before you can even consider using a seat belt for your child.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">2. Test the way the seat belt fits your child. Can the shoulder belt go across the shoulder and chest without touching the neck? Can the lap belt fit low over the hipbones, under the abdomen? Can your child sit up straight and still bend his legs over the edge of the vehicle seat?<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">If you cannot answer "yes" to all three points, he or she should be in a booster seat.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Source: Safe Kids Canada</SPAN></I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 15-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: BOOSTER SEATS SOUGHT FOR CHILDREN UNDER 10: Safety Experts Point To 'Horrendous' Car Accident Injuries
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  National Post  June.01/04  Page A1/A16
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Parents across the country are being urged to put children as old as nine in booster seats when travelling by car, as the Ontario government debates new legislation that sharply raises the minimum height and weight requirements for seat-belt use.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Safe Kids Canada, an injury-prevention program affiliated with Toronto's Hospital for Sick Children, will launch a campaign today telling parents to put kids between the ages of four and nine in booster seats -- even if they have been out of such seats for years.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Children in that age group are more likely to suffer serious harm in a vehicle accident than children younger than four or older than 10.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Seat belts are not designed for children," said Allyson Hewitt, executive director of Safe Kids Canada.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"What we have seen is that when children who should be in booster seats are restrained using seat belts only, the damages in an accident are horrendous. The seat belt can crush internal organs, and, in some cases, it can snap the spinal cord."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A Safe Kids Canada report on booster seat use says advances in vehicle and child-restraint safety have stemmed the injury rates for children involved in motor-vehicle accidents in recent years, but the four-to-nine age group remains at serious risk.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It cites Transport Canada statistics that show the death rate from car crashes dropped by 52% between 1997 and 2001 for children under age five and by 25% among children between the ages of 10 and 14, but held steady for children aged five to nine.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Numbers from the Canadian Institute for Health Information, meanwhile, show that hospital admissions from car crashes declined by 45% between 1994 and 2000 for children under age 5, and by 40% among children aged 10 to 14, but by just 18% for children between five and nine.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">And yet, a Decima Research survey conducted for Safe Kids found only 28% of Canadian children aged four to nine regularly use booster seats.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Safe Kids says the parents of the remaining 72% should take a hard look at whether their children are old enough to forgo a booster seat.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Seat belts are designed to sit on parts of the body that are hard and can absorb the impact of a car crash, such as the hip bones, the shoulders and the chest," Ms. Hewitt said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"But when children use seat belts, those hard bones are often not in the proper position. Instead, the lap belt rides over the stomach."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In a crash, that belt can cause injuries to soft-tissue areas such as the liver, kidneys and intestines.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Children who tuck the shoulder belt behind their back -- rather than have it rub against their neck -- are at even greater risk for serious harm, the report warns.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"These children are likely to jacknife forward over the lap belt," it says. "Their spinal cords may be severely injured ... their heads are likely to hit the inside of the vehicle, causing head and brain injury."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's just unacceptable that we don't have a law that applies to these children," Ms. Hewitt said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Safe Kids initiative dovetails with legislation introduced last month by the Ontario government that would make booster seats mandatory for children under nine who weigh less than 80 pounds and are less than 4-foot-10.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ontario law now requires only children under 40 pounds to remain in booster seats.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's a sad fact that children using seat belts instead of booster seats are 3.5 times more likely to suffer significant injury [in a crash], said Marie Bountrogianni, Minister of Children and Youth Services," when the bill was introduced on May 3. It will have its second reading in the provincial legislature today.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Quebec already has similar legislation on the books, and Ms. Hewitt said that her organization has been holding discussions with all the other provinces about the need to follow suit.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She conceded, however, that many parents are loath to try to convince a child who has not used a booster seat for months -- or years -- that they need to go back into a booster seat.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I have a six-year-old, and we had a celebration when he moved from the 'baby' seat to the 'big-guy' seat," she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"But, really, it should be a non-negotiable issue."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Other parents are less sure. Sue, a Toronto mother of a seven-year-old girl and a nine-year-old boy, says the "psychological" problems associated with putting her kids back into booster seats raise serious issues, even though they weigh less than 80 pounds.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Getting him back into a car seat would be a nightmare," she said. "He'd be teased to death."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She is hoping the Ontario legislation allows a grace period that won't force them to confront new regulations before both children are older than the minimum required age for boosters.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"If there's an out, I'm going to take it," she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Sher Bovay, a Toronto mother with children aged five and eight, said her youngest is always in a child seat and the eldest uses a booster on longer trips that involve highway driving.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"But if it's just local driving where we're only going a few blocks, then we usually don't worry about it."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ms. Bovay said the changes in Ontario have been a topic among parents used to carpooling their children to school, or having daycare providers shuttle them around town.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The law proposed would apply to all such vehicles, including taxicabs.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's going to be a bit of a nuisance," she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I don't even think you could fit three of the seats in the back of our car."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>-30-</o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 16-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CRASH KILLS 'TOBANS
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Two Manitobans were killed in an accident in Ontario yesterday morning. The wreck occurred near Upsala, a small town about 140 kilometres west of Thunder Bay on the Trans-Canada Highway, when an eastbound pickup towing a trailer filled with livestock left the road and struck a rock cut, said Ontario Provincial Police. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Phyllis Anne Strain of Carberry and Kurt Ostermann, 30, of Lockport died at the scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">DELIVERING LOAD OF PIGS <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The two were delivering a load of pigs to Quebec City for a Winnipeg-based company when the accident occurred, said Terry Strain, Phyllis' husband. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He declined further comment, as did an unidentified woman who spoke on his behalf. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I don't think we can talk about this right now," she told The Sun last night. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ostermann's brother, Scott, also declined comment. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The fatal accident is the second involving Manitobans in two weeks on the Ontario portion of the Trans-Canada Highway, better known in that province as Highway 17. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It's the second multiple fatality crash on the Trans-Canada involving Manitobans in the past two weeks. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipegger Troy Lansall, 35, was involved in a fiery four-vehicle wreck about 20 kilometres east of Kenora shortly after 1 a.m. on May 20. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Three others died in the collision. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Details of the horrific chain-reaction crash remain sketchy as police investigate. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It apparently occurred after a semi travelling west crossed the centre line and slammed head-on into an eastbound rig, causing an explosion. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Another trailer is believed to have collided with the rigs while a fourth semi swerved out of the way and hit a rock cut.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 17-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: REPO OR DEMO DERBY? Two Arrested After Truck Gets Rammed
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It was a soap opera with trucks -- starting with an attempted repossession, escalating when one vehicle rammed another, then turning into a chase that culminated with the arrest of two people. It started about lunch time in the parking lot of the Staples Business Depot at 947 St. James St. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A Dr. Hook heavy load tow truck, a Shreddfast truck and a GMC Sierra pickup truck were parked together. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Hook tow truck driver Gary Mangat said he was called to the area by the owner of the GMC -- identified only as Barry. Mangat said Barry runs a business and was trying to repossess the Shreddfast truck. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Its driver allegedly owed Barry money, Mangat said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">DIDN'T HAVE RIGHT PAPERWORK <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The trio discussed the situation for more than an hour before Barry realized he didn't have all the right paperwork to legally seize the Shreddfast vehicle, Mangat said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We didn't have the right papers to go along with it," he admitted. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Before Barry could tell the Shreddfast driver he was off the hook, Mangat started walking toward his truck. Mangat believes the Shreddfast driver thought he was about to take his rig -- and he panicked. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He pushed me out of the way," said Mangat, adding the Shreddfast driver allegedly got behind the wheel of his truck and backed up at high speed, smashing into the GMC with Barry still inside. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mangat said he tried to stop the driver by telling him, "You just can't leave now, after hitting somebody." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Shreddfast driver allegedly rammed the pickup once more before driving away, Mangat said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The impact smashed the front of the GMC Sierra and thrust it into the loading dock area of the adjacent Best Sleep Centre. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">CAUGHT UP <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police spokesman Const. Bob Johnson said police caught up to the Shreddfast truck in St. Boniface and arrested two people. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Barry declined to speak to media about the situation. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mangat said he's been involved with repossessions before, but never one as dramatic as yesterday's. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Usually, it goes smoothly."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 18-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: NOT TO THEIR TASTE: Car Thieves Pass On Mac And Cheese Booty
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Maybe they just weren't hungry. Erin Beaumont's 1993 Dodge Shadow was stolen from outside her Young Street home overnight on May 19 with dozens of boxes of macaroni and cheese bound for charity stashed in the trunk. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police have since found Beaumont's car with all 161 boxes of macaroni and cheese left behind, completely untouched. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's just such an odd situation," Beaumont said with a chuckle. "What more can you do but laugh?" <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The mac and cheese was earmarked for Winnipeg Harvest when the car thieves made off with the goods. Cops found the stolen car May 23 on Wellington Avenue. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's a happy ending," said Winnipeg Harvest spokesman Bruce Michalski. "Caring people like Erin Beaumont and her colleagues are really an inspiration." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The joyriders caused an estimated $1,700 in damage to the car and logged about 200 kilometres on the odometer. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Not only did the culprits spare the mac and cheese but they left behind everything else of value, including a stereo and computer disk. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I was shocked that nothing was taken out of my car," Beaumont said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">There have been no arrests, said Winnipeg police spokesman Const. Bob Johnson. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Beaumont and her co-workers at Unicity Customs Services had collected at least 800 boxes of Kraft dinner, beating out similar food drives by counterparts in eight other Canadian cities. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The boxes the 22-year-old was storing overnight in her car were the portion she collected with help from several co-workers and her father. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">When she picked up the vehicle from the impound, the first thing she did was take a peek in the trunk to check on the precious cargo. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I couldn't believe it was all there," she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 19-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: REPO-MAN VS. THE SHREDDER: Pair Arrested After Dispute In Parking Lot
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.02/04  Page A3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">IF it had been a wrestling match it might have been called <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Repo-Man versus The Shredder</SPAN></EM>. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police yesterday arrested two men in a shredding company truck after a report they were using it to smash the front of a pickup whose driver was trying to repossess the shredders' vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The two men in the Shreddfast Inc. truck were arrested in St. Boniface after the truck was allegedly used to smash the front end of a black GMC Sierra 4X4 pickup truck in a St. James Street parking lot. The lot is located between the Staples Office Depot store on St. James and the neighbouring Best Sleep Centre. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gary Mangat, a Dr. Hook Towing operator also taking part in the attempted repossession, said while the shredding truck had been boxed in for more than an hour, he thought the attempted repossession his company had been hired to assist with was going to end uneventfully because it had been aborted. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We were going to let him go because we didn't have the right papers," Mangat said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"But he backed up and hit the truck. I went to my truck and he rammed it (the pickup) again. I said you just can't leave now. He pushed me out of the way with his truck. "I got out of the way -- I didn't want to get killed." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mangat said the shredding truck backed into the building before taking off. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Repossessions "usually go smoother", Mangat said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver of the damaged pickup spent more than an hour in a police cruiser being interviewed. When the man emerged from the police vehicle, he refused comment. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Calls to Shreddfast went unanswered yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A colour advertisement in the SuperPages said Shreddfast is "100 per cent Manitoba owned and operated." The ad also said the company offered mobile paper shredding and stated, "Businesses prefer our exclusive mobile shredder for high security and peace of mind." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Barry Antonio, who is building a restaurant on Provencher Boulevard, saw the truck's driver being arrested. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We heard the sirens and we looked outside and I saw the police car up front, the shredder truck at an angle and another police car behind," Antonio said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The police were pulling him out of the truck and putting him on the ground with their hands on their holsters. The police were aggressive and taking control. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I thought (the driver) looked confused. Everyone was yelling at him. It was pretty exciting." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca">kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 20-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: NEW BRUNSWICK DRIVERS CATCH INSURANCE BREAK: Industry Reduces Rates To Steer Clear Of Possible Collision With Province
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  June.02/04  Page A9
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">FREDERICTON -- Heading for a possible collision with public insurance, the insurance industry in New Brunswick has reduced its high rates for automobile coverage. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Insurance companies in New Brunswick had to file new rates for the coming year with the Public Utilities Board yesterday, and the industry says consumers are in for a big break on premium costs.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We understand that companies representing about 70 per cent of the marketplace have filed for lower rates," said Don Forgeron, Atlantic region vice-president of the Insurance Bureau of Canada.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"From our perspective, this has got to be tremendous news for consumers in New Brunswick."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mr. Forgeron said the average premium in New Brunswick is now just below $1,000 a year, a significant drop from the $1,220 average before the provincial government brought in reforms, including a cap on claims for minor injuries.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He said the declining rates are the product of a competitive marketplace spurred by regulatory changes that have made business more profitable.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's clear that without any more changes the private system has the public system beat, at least in terms of premiums," Mr. Forgeron said<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The province is reviewing a major report on public auto insurance put together by an all-party committee of the provincial legislature.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Conservative government of Premier Bernard Lord is expected to decide within a month whether it will go ahead with a public system.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Tories were stung in the provincial election a year ago when public anger over soaring insurance premiums cost them numerous seats. The Tories squeaked back into office with a bare, one-seat majority.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It is encouraging and it shows that the reforms we put into place last year are having a significant effect," Justice Minister Brad Green said. "However, automobile insurance rates need to come down further and come down faster."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The major reform put in place by the province was a $2,500 cap on claims for minor injuries such as strains and sprains.</SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 21-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Speed cam alert: Dozen New Locations Unveiled
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">There are 13 more reasons to hit the brakes. Winnipeg police have unveiled the locations for 12 new intersection safety cameras to be installed by the end of August. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Cops are also introducing a new construction zone speed trailer, which is poised to catch leadfoots in construction zones -- just in time for construction season. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The city's photo enforcement program, which has been snapping tickets for more than 17 months, has already noticeably reduced the number of speeding and red-light running violations, says Winnipeg police patrol Sgt. Jerry Munch. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Our numbers are going down," Munch told The Sun. "Ideally, I'd like to see this program go out of business. That's not going to happen." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Photo radar is doing big business in Winnipeg. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">More than 218,000 tickets -- worth more than $17.3 million -- have been mailed out to the registered owners of offending vehicles caught on camera between Jan. 7, 2003 and May 21, 2004, said Brad Janzen, Manitoba Justice's executive director of court services. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">City officials initially estimated the program would fetch up to $11 million annually. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On average, 14,000 speeding and red-light tickets are handed out every month, Janzen said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Despite an apparent decline in the number of tickets being issued, police are still seeing some dangerous driving. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In April, a Winnipeg motorist was caught on camera going 126 km/h in a 50-km/h zone. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">While there will be 12 new camera installations by summer's end, police are only introducing six new cameras. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">That means the six new cameras and 24 old cameras will be rotated through 36 intersections, leaving six intersections without cameras in a form of Russian Roulette. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'm not a gambling man," Munch said with a smile. "Are you?" <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">By 2007, there will be 30 cameras rotated through 60 intersections across the city. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The intersections are chosen based on collision and speed data compiled by police, as well as public input. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An equal number of cameras are placed in each of the city's six police districts. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The new construction zone speed trailer, which displays an approaching vehicle's speed on a large speed-reader board, will be rotated through construction zones throughout Winnipeg. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">DISPLAYED ON READER BOARD <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"A speeding vehicle's speed will be displayed on the large reader board, which should encourage immediate compliance from the driver to reduce his or her speed," Munch said. "If the speed is not reduced, a photo will be taken and a ticket may be issued." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Cops also employ half a dozen mobile photo radar vans and SUVs in school zones. They are considering increasing their fleet, Munch said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Photos taken by the high-tech cameras include the offending vehicle's speed and licence plate number. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">No demerit points are issued because it's difficult to prove the registered owner was driving the vehicle.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 22-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LETTERS TO THE EDITOR: Put Money Into Roads, Rail Systems
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.03/04  Page A15
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The recent collision of freight trucks and tragic loss of life on a dangerous section of the Trans-Canada Highway near Kenora raises a policy issue that deserves debate during the current federal election. Fuel taxes generate over 91 per cent of the $4.7 billion federal transportation revenues, but very little of this money is spent on maintaining or improving the road infrastructure. The surplus of fuel tax revenues over highway expenditures now varies between $3.6 and $3.9 billion, annually. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The federal government's policy position on fuel taxes is stated in <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Straight Ahead</SPAN></EM>, their 2003 strategy paper for transportation. "Federal fuel taxes are an instrument of fiscal, not transportation policy and are an important source of general revenue, used to finance many federal spending priorities, including health care, social security and national defence." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">This means that fuel taxes are treated in the same manner as fiscal taxes on alcohol and tobacco consumption. Such "sin taxes" are justified as a means of discouraging negative social behaviour. Most of the election debate on fuel taxes thus far has focused on subsidizing urban transit, and no doubt, some voters believe that driving a car is an indulgence that should be discouraged. But is freight transportation also a "sin", or is the real "sin" the failure of our government to maintain the national transportation infrastructure in a safe and appropriate condition? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">National Transportation Week was proclaimed on June 1 in Manitoba to celebrate the industry and honour the people who we depend on to bring us all the necessities of life. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Celebrate National Transportation Week by asking the political candidates at your door whether their federal government will continue to treat the fuel taxes collected on freight transportation as a "sin tax", or will they put the money back into our national highway and rail systems from where it is being taken. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><B><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">DR. BARRY PRENTICE</SPAN></I></B><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&nbsp; - </SPAN></I><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Transport Institute, </SPAN></I><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">University of Manitoba</SPAN></I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 23-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: MORE PAIN FOR SPEEDERS: Six New Cameras To Be Rotated Among 12 More Intersections
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.03/04  PageB1/B2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TWELVE new intersection-camera locations were unveiled by city police yesterday as photo enforcement heads into its third year in Winnipeg. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">At the same time, police also pulled out a new tool to get city lead-foots to slow down -- the construction zone speed trailer. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Patrol Sgt. Jerry Munch said the trailer will be set up at various roadway construction sites around the city to help protect workers from being hit by errant drivers. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"What I'm hoping is with this, I give out no tickets," Munch said. "We're being very fair with the speed trailer." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A hidden sensor inside the trailer catches and records the speed of oncoming drivers and then displays it to the driver on a large electronic reader board. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Posted close by or even on the trailer is the speed limit, so the driver has a chance to slow down before passing the trailer. If the motorist doesn't slow down, a camera at the back of the trailer takes a picture and a ticket is issued. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The city has had the trailer for about two years but hasn't used it until now. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wayne Bergen, a safety technician with the public works department, said all city staff who work summer road construction want the trailer. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's pretty near and dear to these guys' hearts to keep the flow down," Bergen said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He added that three years ago, two city workers were hit by a speeding car at a St. Vital construction site, almost killing one of them. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was resuscitated on the hospital table and is now back at work," Bergen said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Munch said the 12 new locations -- only six will actually have cameras -- were chosen because of collision history, public input and viability of installing the necessary hardware needed for the camera to work -- underground road sensors and the flash box and post. The cameras are to be working by the end of August. One of the new cameras will be installed at Portage Avenue and Mount Royal Road, where a <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Free Press</SPAN></EM> carrier died last Aug. 15 and a Sri Lankan mother died Nov. 9. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">That and the others will bring the number of intersection cameras to 36. Starting in August, cameras will rotate through the intersections so that drivers won't know which intersection has a camera. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The intent of having locations without cameras is to slow drivers, even though their picture will not be taken. In 2005, another 12 intersections will get the camera hardware installed, but no new cameras will be purchased. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police also say the photo enforcement program appears to be successful because the numbers of speeding and red-light violations have decreased, but no statistical information was provided to back up that claim. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Munch said information would be provided at a later date. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">What is known is that photo enforcement has not earned the city the revenue that was once projected. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">When it was unveiled in the fall of 2002, the city projected it would generate about $20 million annually for the city by 2005, but that number has now been trimmed back to $15 million. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The camera system has been issuing offence notices since Jan. 7 last year. More than 218,000 tickets have been sent out and more than $17.3 million in fines have been collected.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">12 new locations for speed-fighting cameras <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">These are the 12 new intersection safety camera locations for 2004. (Each location takes one camera, with six cameras rotated among the 12 sites): <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">1. Notre Dame Ave. at Sherbrook St. (Targeting drivers westbound on Notre Dame) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">2. Disraeli Freeway at Logan Ave. (Targeting drivers northbound on Disraeli) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">3. Ellice Ave. at St. James St. (Targeting drivers westbound on Ellice) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">4. Portage Ave. at Mount Royal Rd. (Targeting drivers westbound on Portage) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">5. Main St. at Redwood Ave. (Targeting drivers southbound on Main) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">6.
