McPhillips St. at Redwood Ave. (Targeting drivers southbound on McPhillips) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">7. Regent Ave. at Madeline St. (Targeting drivers eastbound on Regent) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">8. Panet Rd. at Munroe Ave. (Targeting drivers southbound on Panet) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">9. St. Anne's Rd. at Meadowood Dr. (Targeting motorists northbound on St. Anne's) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">10. Dunkirk Dr. at St. Vital Rd. (Targeting drivers northbound on Dunkirk) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">11. Pembina Hwy. at Grant Ave. (Targeting drivers northbound on Pembina) <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">12. Grant Ave. at Wilton St. (Targeting drivers westbound on Grant)<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 24-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: NEWLY REVEALED CAR DEFECTS MITSUBISHI'S LATEST BLACK EYE
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.03/04  Page C15
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TOKYO -- Japan's Mitsubishi Motors says it hid 26 defects in its cars from regulators for years -- in addition to four problems it publicized in 2000 -- to avoid issuing recalls for the vehicles. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The automaker said yesterday it would immediately start recalling the affected cars, estimated at over 160,000 and most of them sold in Japan. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The newly discovered problems are the latest to taint Mitsubishi since it acknowledged in 2000 that it had systematically covered up auto defects for more than two decades and issued massive recalls for the vehicles affected. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In 2000, however, Mitsubishi Motors only made public and issued recalls for four of the defects, even though it had discovered about 30. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A special investigative team the automaker set up last month as a part of a new revival plan disclosed the additional problems, the company said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We conducted a thorough probe back to 1993, the earliest possible date we could study," said Yoichiro Okazaki, the president of Mitsubishi Motors, at a hastily called news conference. "We apologize deeply for damaging public and consumer trust by failing to conduct recalls before and also for carrying them out now for problems rooted in the past." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The company said none of the defects had caused any accidents that resulted in death or property damage. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The number of newly recalled vehicles number 163,707 -- including 156,433 sold in Japan and 7,274 overseas, the company said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It did not give a breakdown by country outside Japan. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 25-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: HIGHER SPEED LIMITS NOT INCREASING ACCIDENTS
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.04/04  Page
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>REGINA -- Mounties in Saskatchewan say two major divided highways in the province have not become any more dangerous since speed limits on both were increased. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The government boosted the speed limit from 100 to 110 kilometres per hour on the divided portions of highways 1 and 11 in June 2003. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Traffic safety analysts at Saskatchewan Government Insurance say they have not found any statistical trends relating to speed limits. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>But the Crown insurance company says speed is a factor when the road is slippery or visibility is poor. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>There are other concerns about speed. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Environmentalists say fuel consumption goes up at faster speeds and burning more gasoline increases greenhouse gas emissions. <I>-- Canadian Press</I><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 26-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: BICYCLE LEFTS TURNS
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  June.04/04  Page A14
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Toronto -- Re Bicycle Bad Guys (letter -- June 1): George McNeillie catalogues quite a long list of cycling misdeeds. However, I was surprised to see him scold cyclists who "try to turn left from left-turn lanes intended for cars," since he introduced himself as a former urban cyclist.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Any experienced cyclist should know that left-turn-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>only lanes are not "intended for cars," but rather can and should be used by cyclists who are turning left. In fact, according to Canada's national cycling safety education program, Can-Bike, it is the correct lane position for a cyclist who is turning left<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>While I agree with Mr. McNeillie that obeying the rules of the road will increase the public's respect for cyclists, it is also important for motorists to understand that bicycles are not required to hug the curb at all times.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 27-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: AUTOMOTIVE SHOWCASE: Computer glitch may put Honda bikers in fast lane
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Sun  June.04/04  Page A10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>DETROIT -- Honda Motor Co. Ltd is recalling nearly 8,200 model year 2004 motorcycles because of a computer glitch that could prompt their drivers to go too fast, U.S. federal safety regulators announced.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>The program error causes the digital speedometer on some of the motorcycles to understate actual vehicle speed by about 25%, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>"This condition can result in the vehicle being driven at an illegal or unsafe speed," NHTSA said in an advisory on its Web site.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>It did not elaborate, but state police may already have noticed a disproportionate number of people breaking speed limits lately on late-model Honda motorcycles.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 28-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ROADSIDE MEMORIAL A MOVING TRIBUTE: Highway 44 Epitaph Inspires Safer Driving
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.04/04  Page F1
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>AS anyone with a "toy" can attest, there is something magical about that first springtime drive. No slush to dirty the flanks, no grit to chip the paint. If you're lucky, you find yourself practically alone on the open road, as though you are the first to emerge from your car cover cocoon. Such was the case as I eased my Miata off Highway 59, heading east on 44 towards Beausejour. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I've known 44 since my youth, before it was twinned and smooth, when you slowed down passing through the hamlets of Garson and Tyndall. They're both set back off of 44 now; you would need a specific reason to visit them. It would have to wait for another day, as fifth gear was anxiously calling. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Spring had not yet begun to reveal its lush, green nature. The scenery was minor, save for the odd used vehicle parked at the end of a driveway with the oversized For Sale sign. It was in all this bleakness that I saw it; a little tinge of red at the side of the road. A roadside discard perhaps, easily missed. I was practically on top of it before I realized what it was. It was a memorial. A memorial that always signifies a violent and tragic end. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I could have easily given it the usual "I guess someone died there" nod that most do as they speed past at the expected 10 km/h overage. This time, I firmly applied the brakes and eased onto the shoulder. I slowly reversed the Miata until I was looking at the simple floral arrangement. It wasn't more than a foot high, with faux red and white roses. There was something written on an attached placard. I would have to get closer to read it. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>The epitaph had been applied with a black magic marker. It simply read; "Cathy. 1970-1997. Mom and Dad." That was all. As I knelt down, I scanned the landscape for some clue to Cathy's end. Seven years had long since erased any tire skids. There was no sign of broken glass, no errant wheel covers. It was as if this space had been vacuumed clean, save for these plastic flowers. And a mother's and father's torment. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I knew I could find out if I wanted to. It was just an RCMP detachment visit away, or a cursory look through some news archives. I played with the usual scenarios in my mind, scanning the scene for anything obvious. It wasn't at an intersection, where many wreaths are leaned up against stop signs. A single vehicle involved. The placard made no mention as to time of year, no hint as to whether or not an icy 44 was to blame. I even had to think the worst, that perhaps a few too many was responsible. All plausible explanations. None of them bringing any solace for Mom and Dad. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>The year of birth struck a chord. 1970. A year younger than me. Apart from Mom and Dad, who else did she leave behind? I don't know if those 27 years were of verve or of heartache. All I know is, that's all that Cathy got. And it seems so obscenely short. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I turned away from the memorial and scanned the concrete ribbon that is 44. It has no doubt seen the likes of Rocket 88 Oldsmobiles to beat-up farm trucks, to the latest safety-laden transportation. The automakers will keep putting in airbags. They will improve crush zones and restraints. They will do everything they possibly can to save lives. And 44, along with every other concrete ribbon, will continue to take lives. The dreaded phone calls will come in the night. The doctor's apologies in the emergency rooms. The roadside memorials. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I walked back to the Miata and grabbed my camera. If you don't feel right about stopping to pay your respects to the roadside Cathys, take a good, long look at this picture. Hopefully, you'll drop your speed a touch, make a proper mirror check before you change lanes, even perform a complete stop at an intersection. Mom and Dad will thank you for it.</FONT></SPAN><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 29-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: COMMON COURTESY FLICKED OUT THE WINDOW: Road-Warrior Act Creates Chain Reaction
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.04/04  Page F4
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>IS it just me or has common courtesy behind the wheel been flicked out the window like a lit cigarette butt? <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Way back when, my high school driving instructor, Mr. Gardner, preached the three Cs of responsible driving: care, caution and courtesy. It was his mantra. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>In his opinion, if you didn't exhibit all three Cs, you weren't fit to drive. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I can only imagine his reaction to all the street-hogging, sign-dodging lead foots who have forgotten, or perhaps never learned the three Cs. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>I hadn't thought much about Mr. Gardner until a high school reunion, and far too many aperitifs, brought back a flood of memories. The topic turned to pet peeves, specifically, the kind that get you hot under the hood. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>What gets your oil boiling? I'm almost embarrassed to say. I'm a relatively simple woman with simple desires. I don't ask for much. But when I back off to allow a driver into my lane, is it too much to ask for a courtesy wave to say 'Hey, thanks.' <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>It sounds silly, I know. And in the grand scheme of things, failing to acknowledge an act of kindness isn't as pressing a concern as global warming or depleting natural resources. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>And it isn't exactly cause to call in Miss Manners or rescind someone's driver's licence. But, it ticks me off, darn it . . . I wouldn't call it road rage, exactly. It's more like a mild case of road rash that rubs me the wrong way. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Ignoring my good deed means I'm more likely to simply ignore another driver trying to change lanes, which only escalates the whole courtesy problem. Call it negative courtesy. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>One of the wives at the reunion says she used to "go straight for 'em." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>"But people are crazy," she said. "And you're afraid to raise your hand because you don't know what kind of nut's driving the other car." For her, mild road irritation is brought on by drivers crossing a busy four-lane street who make it to the median only to be stuck there, blocking two lanes of traffic because -- you guessed it -- no one will let them in. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>It only dawned on me while writing this column why people don't, or won't, use turn indicators. I don't think it's a failed attempt at responsible driving, but a survival tactic. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Think about it: the minute some drivers see a blinking light, what's the knee-jerk (and I stress the second syllable) reaction? For some drivers it sparks a primal instinct to protect their territory. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Now, this guy has every right to beat his chest and claim his own section of pavement, I suppose. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>But his caveman, road-warrior act creates a chain reaction, because when the driver who has been patiently waiting to get into the next lane finally does so, they're so fumed that they don't let anyone else in. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Eventually we all end up in gridlock, slowly creeping past our designated turns because no one lets anyone else in. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>So, how would Mr. Gardner handle drivers like Mr. Blue Pick-Up? He would probably tell you to smile, nod politely and wave, as you drive right past him. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><I><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>Rhonda Wheeler is a journalist with Wheelbase Communications, a worldwide supplier of automotive news, features and reviews. You can e-mail her at </FONT><A href="mailto:rhonda@wheelbase.ws"><FONT face=Verdana>rhonda@wheelbase.ws</FONT></A><FONT face=Verdana>.</FONT></SPAN></I><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 30-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LETTERS OF THE DAY: North End Drivers Hosed
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Well, I see they have announced the sites for the 12 new red-light cameras. This will make 36. Of these, 12 are on the south side and 22 are in the north half of Winnipeg (with two more on Portage Avenue, the historical dividing line). I wasn't aware that we North Enders were such poor drivers that we need nearly twice as many cameras as the south side. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Or maybe the real problem is our poor and ineffective North End councillors who have done nothing to ensure equitable and fair implementation of this program for all citizens of Winnipeg. They are supposed to represent the citizens in their wards. Are they asleep? <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">This is also a perfect example of how our ex-mayor had such an unfair and unbalanced agenda for Winnipeg. I hope St. James thanks him for us North Enders and sends him straight to the unemployment line. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dale F. White, </SPAN></I><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg <o:p></o:p></SPAN></I></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><I><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><STRONG>Say you live in the flashy part of town</STRONG>. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></I></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 31-Oct-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LOCAL BRIEFS: Driver Still In Hospital
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver of a station wagon that T-boned an RCMP cruiser on the weekend was recovering in hospital yesterday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Four people were injured when a Ford Taurus wagon struck an RCMP cruiser about 1:30 p.m. on Saturday at the intersection of Highways 12 and 15 in Anola. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A male passenger and 16-month-old baby have been released from Concordia Hospital while the female driver is recovering in fair condition, RCMP said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An injured male Mountie was also released. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The collision is under investigation. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 1-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LAX RULES FOR ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLES THREATEN KIDS: REPORT
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.07/04  Page A8
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TORONTO -- A ride in the country on an all-terrain vehicle may sound like a fun outdoor adventure, but the Canadian Pediatric Society says ATVs are not toys and children have no business being on them. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Based on the number of injuries and deaths related to ATV accidents involving children, the society is calling for changes to ATV legislation across Canada. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In a position paper released today, the society says children under the age of 16 make up nearly a third of serious injuries related to ATVs. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Andrew Lynk, chair of the society's action committee for children and teens, says over the last five years about 900 children have been hospitalized in Canada because of ATV-related injuries. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"(The) most common cause for hospitalization would be fractures or broken bones," Lynk said by telephone from his office in Cape Breton, N.S. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Internal injuries such as bruised hearts and lungs or torn livers and spleens can also occur when the ATV rolls over and crushes the vehicle's occupants. Lynk said head injuries occur because many kids don't wear helmets. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"A lot of provinces do mandate that you wear helmets, but they (regulations) haven't been enforced or they're difficult to enforce," Lynk said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">ATV regulations vary widely across the country even though warning labels -- often printed on the steering column -- spell out the dangers to children and young teenagers. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The paper, published in the current issue of Pediatrics and Child Health, includes a table summarizing provincial and territorial ATV legislation. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Quebec has one of the most strict regulations, requiring drivers to be at least 14 years of age, wear a helmet and have a certificate of competence if they're under 16. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On the opposite end of the spectrum, British Columbia doesn't have any minimum requirements for ATV drivers -- not even mandatory helmet use. The society wants all jurisdictions across the country to harmonize legislation and ban children under the age of 16 from being on ATVs. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We feel that children under the age of 16 don't have the maturity in terms of judgment or motor skills or strength to operate and ride on these vehicles safely," Lynk said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I wouldn't let my 14-year-old drive my car or motorbike, and seeing what I've seen in the emergency room, and unfortunately in the morgue, I wouldn't let them (children) near an ATV right now." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The society is also recommending that ATV drivers complete an approved training course, such as the Canada Safety Council's ATV Riders Course. It also wants manufacturers to make the vehicles safer by adding features such as rollover protection.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 2-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: KIDS CAN’T CONTROL ATVS, WARN  DOCTORS: Children, Teens Account For Nearly 25% Of Deaths
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  National Post  June.07/04  Page A4
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">CALGARY - The Canadian Paediatric Society is recommending children under 16 should not be allowed to operate an all-terrain vehicle.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The society says children and adolescents continue to account for almost 25% of deaths and more than one-third of serious injuries related to ATVs.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We know that ATVs are dangerous when used by children and young adolescents, and that they are more likely to be injured and killed because they can't control the vehicle," said Dr. Andrew Lynk, chairman of the CPS Action Committee for Children and Teens.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The number and severity of these injuries can be reduced by restricting ridership among young operators and passengers and by improving compliance with established safety recommendations.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We feel that children under the age of 16 don't have the maturity in terms of judgment or motor skills or strength to operate and ride on these vehicles safely," Dr. Lynk said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I wouldn't let my 14-year-old drive my car or motorbike, and seeing what I've seen in the emergency room, and unfortunately in the morgue, I wouldn't let [children] near an ATV right now."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A statement by the CPS's Injury Prevention Committee is expected to be released today and published in the current issue of Paediatrics &amp; Child Health.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It states ATVs are dangerous when used by children and young adolescents because they lack the physical size and strength, knowledge and cognitive and motor skills to operate them safely.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Lynk said that over the past five years, about 900 children have been hospitalized in Canada because of ATV-related injuries.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"[The] most common cause for hospitalization would be fractures or broken bones," Dr. Lynk said in a phone interview from his office in Cape Breton, N.S.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Internal injuries such as bruised hearts and lungs or torn livers and spleens can also occur when the ATV rolls over and crushes the vehicle's riders.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Lynk said head injuries occur because many children do not wear helmets.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"A lot of provinces do mandate that you wear helmets, but [regulations] haven't been enforced or they're difficult to enforce," Dr. Lynk said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">ATV regulations vary widely across the country even though warning labels -- often printed on the steering column -- spell out the dangers to children and young teenagers.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The position paper includes a table summarizing provincial and territorial ATV legislation.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Quebec has one of the most strict regulations, requiring drivers to be at least 14 years of age, wear a helmet and have a certificate of competence if they are under 16.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On the opposite end of the spectrum, British Columbia does not have any minimum requirements for ATV drivers -- not even mandatory helmet use.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The society is calling on all provinces and territories to harmonize off-road vehicle legislation including legislating a minimum operator age of 16 years, a restriction of passengers to the number for which the vehicle was designed, compulsory helmet use, mandatory training, licensing and registration and ban of the use of three-wheeled vehicles.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Off-road vehicle legislation needs to be tightened in many provinces if we are to protect children from injury," the CPS says. "It is startling to see how lenient legislation is when it comes to children using ATVs in many provinces across Canada. We hope that our recommendations will be used to raise awareness and influence the government to take action."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Carol Beringer, of the Calgary Health Region's Injury Prevention &amp; Control Services/KIDSAFE Connection, said the CPS message is consistent with what the CHR has been promoting.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She said the CHR also wants youth who are older than 16 to complete training before they are allowed to operate an ATV.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The CPS, which represents more than 2,000 pediatricians, advocates for the health needs of children and youth.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">(Calgary Herald)<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 3-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLES AREN’T TOYS DOCTORS SAY
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  June.07/04  Page A10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TORONTO -- A ride in the country on an all-terrain vehicle may sound like a fun outdoor adventure, but the Canadian Pediatric Society says ATVs are not toys and children have no business being on them.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Based on the number of injuries and deaths related to ATV accidents involving children, the society is calling for changes to ATV legislation across Canada.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The society says children under age 16 account for nearly one-third of serious injuries related to ATVs.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Andrew Lynk, chairman of the society's action committee for children and teens, says that in the past five years about 900 children have been hospitalized in Canada because of ATV-related injuries.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The "most common cause for hospitalization would be fractures or broken bones," Dr. Lynk said in a phone interview from his office in Cape Breton, N.S. Internal injuries such as bruised hearts and lungs or torn livers and spleens can also occur when the ATV rolls over and crushes the vehicle's occupants.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dr. Lynk said head injuries occur because many children don't wear helmets. "A lot of provinces do mandate that you wear helmets, but they [regulations] haven't been enforced or they're difficult to enforce." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">ATV regulations vary widely across the country even though warning labels, often printed on the steering column, spell out the dangers to children and young teenagers.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The position paper, published in the current issue of Pediatrics and Child Health, includes a table summarizing provincial and territorial ATV legislation.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Quebec is one of the strictest regulators, requiring drivers to be at least 14 years of age, wear a helmet and have a certificate of competence if they're under 16.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On the opposite end of the spectrum, British Columbia has no minimum requirements for ATV drivers -- not even helmet use.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The society wants all jurisdictions across the country to harmonize legislation and forbid children under age 16 to be on such vehicles.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We feel that children under the age of 16 don't have the maturity in terms of judgment or motor skills or strength to operate and ride on these vehicles safely," Dr. Lynk said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I wouldn't let my 14-year-old drive my car or motorbike, and seeing what I've seen in the emergency room, and unfortunately in the morgue, I wouldn't let them [children] near an ATV right now."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The society is also recommending that ATV drivers complete an approved training course, such as the Canada Safety Council's ATV Riders Course. It also wants manufacturers to make the vehicles safer by adding features such as rollover protection.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 4-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: [PHOTO] Cop Crash
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Sun  June.06/04  Page A10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoBodyTextIndent style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align=left><FONT face="Book Antiqua"><SPAN lang=EN-CA>Four people were injured when a Ford Taurus wagon T-boned an RCMP cruiser about 1:30 p.m. Saturday at the intersection of Highway 12 and Highway 15 in Anola. A man, a woman and a 16-month-old baby in the Taurus and a male Mountie were taken to hospital in stable condition.</SPAN><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></FONT></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 5-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: THREE HURT AS CAR, RCMP CRUISER COLLIDE
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.06/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">THREE people were injured yesterday following a collision between a car and an RCMP cruiser at a major intersection on Dugald Road in Anola, RCMP said. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The nature of the injuries and the identities of the injured -- who were all in the car that collided with the cruiser -- were not disclosed. The lone Mountie involved in the crash was not hurt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">RCMP spokesman Sgt. Steve Colwell said the three injured people were taken to Concordia Hospital for treatment. The driver was later transferred to Health Sciences Centre in stable condition. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">No information was released yesterday on the possible cause of the accident and RCMP would not say if either vehicle was speeding. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The RCMP cruiser, based at the Steinbach detachment, was headed south on Highway 12. The other car was headed east on Highway 15. RCMP would not identify the make or model of the vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The two highways cross in Anola, a farming community located about 30 kilometres east of Winnipeg where highway speeds give way to a maximum posted speed limit of 60 km/h. The corner is clear of obstructions and the terrain in the area is flat and wide open, giving motorists a clear view of traffic ahead. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An RCMP traffic analyst crew was on the scene late into the afternoon investigating the scene, said workers in the two gas stations at the intersection. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Colwell said he could not say if charges were being contemplated.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 6-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: [PHOTO] Leaky Semi
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Firefighters clean up a fuel spill at </SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">McGillivary Boulevard</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> and </SPAN><st1:Street><st1:address><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Lindenwood Drive</SPAN></st1:address></st1:Street><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"> where a semi lost control and punctured its gas tank yesterday.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 7-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LUXURY TRAILER DESTROYED
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A Charleswood area man said his wife will probably never go camping again after their luxury trailer exploded outside their home last night. "I don't know what I'm feeling right now. This is weird," said the homeowner, who declined to give his name, while looking at the charred remains of his 29-foot camper. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Fire officials rushed to 1523 Liberty St. about 8 p.m. after reports of an explosion. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The owner said he'd plugged the trailer's battery into a charger, then left it and wandered into a nearby shed. The motorhome exploded about 10 minutes later. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It was a loud woof," he said. "Fortunately I didn't go into it." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The man, who wasn't injured, said he and his wife purchased the camper new two years ago. Last night, he was planning to replace the interior floor coverings. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">They hadn't taken any trips this year. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Officials examined the burned-out husk, which had been flattened and hardly resembled a trailer -- save for the spare tire, which somehow managed to escape damage. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The trailer's long walls also remained intact, but were also blown off with such force that one of them knocked down a tree. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The homeowner said a leaky propane tank may have caused the blast. Investigators were still on scene at press time.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 8-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: [PHOTO] Cleaning Up Fuel Spill
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.05/04  Page B7
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoBodyTextIndent style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><FONT face="Book Antiqua"><SPAN lang=EN-CA>A firefighter applies sawdust while mopping a diesel spill yesterday at the intersection of McGillivary Boulevard and Dovercourt Drive. Fire crews and the Hazmat unit were called out to clean up the spill from a tractor after its gas tank was punctured. The incident occurred just before 3 p.m. when a tractor owned by Direct Messenger jumped a curb. The vehicle struck a street sign, which ripped a hole in its fuel tank. Hundreds of litres of fuel were mopped up. Several litres also leaked into a storm sewer catch basin and had to be sucked out.</SPAN><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></FONT></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 9-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: THIRD COMPANY QUITTING NFLD. AUTO INSURANCE
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  June.05/04  Page B7
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Third company has announced it is getting out of the auto insurance business in Newfoundland and Labrador. <B>Federation Insurance Co. of Canada</B> said yesterday it is giving up on writing new automobile business in the province immediately. Tom Hickey of the Insurance Brokers Association said combined with the withdrawal of Aviva Canada Inc. and Dominion of Canada General Insurance Co., close to 40 per cent of the market has advised it will be leaving the province. The companies are upset with the Tory government's insurance reforms, currently before the House of Assembly. The legislation orders reductions in premiums from 9 per cent to 37 per cent and contains non-withdrawal clauses for companies. Mr. Hickey said consumers could start feeling the pinch as early as next week. He added those trying to start new policies will have trouble finding anyone willing to take them. <I>CP</I><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 10-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: MORE HELP FOR BRANDY: Famed Author Aids 'Pegger
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Best-selling author Dr. Wayne Dyer and some 1,600 total strangers jumped in to help out a Winnipeg single mom whose car was confiscated by the province when a mechanic behind the wheel broke the law. The motivational speaker and author of 25 books heard of Brandy Simmons' plight while scanning the newspaper over breakfast at a Calgary hotel the morning of a recent lecture. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He said he was moved by the 26-year-old's ordeal. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It just seemed to me that it was an incredible outrage," Dyer said from his home in Maui, Hawaii. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Last November, when Simmons took her '93 Pontiac Sunbird into a local repair shop for a tune-up, the police pulled over the mechanic while he was moving the vehicle from the parking lot to the garage. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The mechanic was driving without a licence. It was his third offence within five years, which allows police to impound the vehicle no matter who the owner. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Simmons got her car back briefly before receiving a forfeiture notice in the mail, which she ignored, figuring the matter had been dealt with. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">That wasn't the case. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">To make matters worse, Simmons' car was stolen and Manitoba Public Insurance said it was a write-off. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She would have received $5,300 in insurance but the province claimed the money instead. Financially strapped, Simmons was forced to leave Red River College where she was studying child and youth care. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">'One day at a time' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Right now I'm dealing one day at a time, listening to what my lawyer says," she said. "I'm definitely not giving up. The stress they've caused me is worth a fight." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dyer shared Simmons' story with about 1,600 people attending his lectures in Calgary and Vancouver and encouraged them to make a difference. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Some gave small change, others donated $100 bills. One person gave Simmons a gold chain while another gave children's CDs for Simmons' four-year-old daughter. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I was not expecting any of this," said the overwhelmed Winnipegger. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dyer said the Manitoba government's policy contradicts lessons about coming together and helping others which he writes about in his latest book The Power of Intention. He called the legislation in question a law that hurts rather than helps. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dyer's girlfriend, Ellen Goldhar flew to Winnipeg yesterday to deliver the cheque in person. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The donation is enough to pay for Simmons' car. Dyer said he'll also cover her tuition for the fall. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It was about 1,600 Canadians all coming together," said Dyer, whose PBS specials have raised close to $60 million.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 11-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CLASSIC CAR BUFF TAKES THE PRIZE: Wins Restored '67 Firebird
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Virginia Zelinsky went to Sunday&#8217;s Cruisin&#8217; the &#8216;Peg kickoff to see who would drive away with the big prize.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Little did the Oakbank woman know she&#8217;d be the one sitting behind the wheel of a restored 1967 Pontiac Firebird at the end of the night.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I was so shocked I didn&#8217;t know what was going on,&#8221; said Zelinsky, whose name was picked during a cruise night contest at Canad Inns Transcona.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I never dreamed I would win it.&#8221; The retired classic car buff beat out several thousand entries to win the $17,000 car, which a crew from Dias Auto took about 10 months to restore.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Zelinsky and her husband, Roy, picked up her new ride yesterday.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;We&#8217;re dying to get ahold of this and take it for a drive,&#8221; she said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Zelinskys, who used to be members of a vintage car club, will have to make room in their garage for the muscle car. They already own a 1958 Edsel convertible and a 1960 Edsel hard-top.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H6 style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Received an offer<o:p></o:p></SPAN></H6>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;Those two are older but (the Firebird) is more of a sporty car,&#8221; Zellnsky said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">It was only a matter of seconds before she received an offer for the Firebird.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">&#8220;I kind of fell in love with the car after I saw the work that was done on it,&#8221; said Ron Ledohowski, Canad Inns corporate vice-president.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He talked to the Zelinskys after the draw but got the impression they weren&#8217;t willing to take their hands off the wheel just yet.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Yesterday, Virginia Zelinsky said she doesn&#8217;t know what to do with the car because &#8220;I haven&#8217;t gotten over the shock of winning it.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Everyone who entered the Canad Inns promotion was asked to make a donation to the Winnipeg Humane Society, which collected about $2,400 Sunday night, said Katherine Paizen, the society&#8217;s events and promotions manager.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ledohowski said Canad Inns will probably hold another car giveaway next year.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 12-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: FREAK CRASH 'AN ACCIDENT': Classmate Hits Woman
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 21-year-old Winnipeg woman was fighting for her life last night after being struck by a car believed to be driven by a female classmate. Both women had just left class for the day at Edutech Training Centres at 609 Erin St. -- where they were taking a course to become administrative assistants -- when an eastbound 1987 Grand Am hit the woman on Portage Avenue near Newman Street before 5 p.m. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Friends identified the victim as their classmate, Andrea. The shaken 23-year-old driver was being consoled by classmates on the boulevard after Andrea was taken away in an ambulance. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"This is an accident. You cannot blame each other. It's an accident. Nobody wants that," said classmate Efren Santos. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I was crying when I saw (Andrea). She's like a sister to me." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos was crossing Portage Avenue southbound with Andrea and two other female classmates, also making their way toward the bus stop to head home. Andrea was lagging behind the group, Santos said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos had his back to his friends when the car struck Andrea and came to a stop in the curb lane. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I was taking off my sweater when I heard a big bang and boom," Santos recalled. "I turned my head and I saw her lying there, bleeding." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos feared the worst when he first saw Andrea lying motionless on the pavement but he could see she was still breathing as he approached. Along with other classmates at the scene, Santos rushed to her side, shouting her name and hoping for a response. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We tried to help, to hold her, but she was not responding," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Grown close <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The students had grown close to each other despite only being about one month into the seven-month course, Santos said. Moments before the collision, Santos was joking with Andrea about the course workload.
