She is a young wife, he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"She's nice," Santos said. "She's always making jokes." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver was the only occupant of the vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos said he usually avoids jaywalking and crosses at the Erin Street intersection because of heavy traffic. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's dangerous -- too risky," he said. "I'm always telling them I can't cross the street. It's dangerous." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Classmates said they would hold a vigil at Health Sciences Centre last night after giving their statements to police. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police spokeswoman Const. Shelly Glover said investigators would be at the scene for several hours. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Because of the seriousness of the injuries of our victim," Glover said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 13-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LOCAL BRIEFS: DOUBLE-DIPPER DINGED BY MPI
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 46-year-old Winnipeg woman has been ordered to repay more than $14,000 after being caught "double-dipping" by Manitoba Public Insurance. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Odete Maria Reis suffered a broken shoulder, along with leg, back and neck injuries in a July 2000 car accident at the corner of Logan Avenue and McPhillips Street. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She began receiving income replacement legitimately from MPI, but after 10 months, the Crown corporation received information suggesting she'd gone back to work while still collecting payments. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An investigation confirmed their suspicions, and Reis was charged with one count of fraud over $5,000. She pleaded guilty in court on Friday, and was fined $4,000 by provincial Judge Judith Webster. She was also ordered to repay $14,400 -- the amount of money she fraudulently collected. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An MPI spokesman said Webster's sentence reflects the court's frustration with people who suffer legitimate injuries, then try to squeeze even more out of the system.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 14-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: SEIZED CAR A MOTIVATION TO TOP AUTHOR: Raises Big Bucks For Hard-Luck Mom
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.08/04  Page A3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">BRANDY Simmons may not have her car back, but at least she's got enough to pay off her Visa bill through the help of a bestselling author. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Simmons, a 26-year-old single mother on social assistance, yesterday was handed a cheque on behalf of bestselling author and motivational speaker Dr. Wayne W. Dyer. This follows her being featured in <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Free Press</SPAN></EM> stories after she permanently lost her 1993 Pontiac Sunbird to the Manitoba government when a suspended mechanic drove it. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'm amazed," Simmons said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I was really surprised to hear about this. I never would have expected this." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Simmons, who wouldn't say how much the cheque was for, said the entire amount would go to pay off her Visa bill that was used to pay off the seized car. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Contacted at his home in Maui, Hawaii, Dyer said the money came from individuals in his Calgary and Vancouver audiences last week after he and his girlfriend read the <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Free Press</SPAN></EM> story reprinted in the <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Calgary Herald</SPAN></EM> and brought it up during his speeches. Saying the average donation was $5 from the hundreds of people in his audiences, Dyer said because the woman has already had her car seized by the province, he hopes the same government doesn't go after the donation by deducting it from her social assistance. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Maybe the government will be shamed not to touch the money," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We're supposed to have elected officials helping us, not screwing us. This is a really abusive law." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Last November, Simmons' car was seized by police after an inner-city garage mechanic suspended from driving drove it when she took it in for a tune-up. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She retrieved the car from an impound lot a few days later, but three months later thieves stole and smashed it beyond repair. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">When Manitoba Public Insurance went to pay her $5,300 for her loss, the province took the money because the mechanic had pleaded guilty to the Highway Traffic Act offence in March. Under the act, a vehicle can be seized regardless of who the owner is if it's an offender's third offence within five years. Simmons later ignored a forfeiture notice, which would have let her appeal it, because she thought her role in the matter was over. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Free Press</SPAN></EM> story sparked a wave of public support, including at least eight car dealerships offering her a loaner for free. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A provincial government Crown counsel has said the government is reviewing the matter. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dyer, who is called the "father of motivation" by his fans, is probably best known for his book <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Your Erroneous Zones</SPAN></EM>, but he has also written <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Meditations for Manifesting</SPAN></EM>, <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Staying on the Path</SPAN></EM>, and <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Secrets of Your Own Healing Power</SPAN></EM>. He also wrote <EM><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Creating Your World the Way You Really Want It to Be</SPAN></EM>, with Deepak Chopra. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Dyer also said he is personally going to help Simmons by paying her tuition next year. She was in the final year of studying child and youth care at Red River College when she dropped out because of the financial fallout of losing her car. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I haven't told her that yet, but whatever the tuition is, I'm paying it," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ellen Goldhar, Dyer's girlfriend, who presented the cheque in person to Simmons, said "I wish you could have heard the moans and groans in that room when (Dyer) raised the story. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"When the government, sponsored by us, starts to victimize us, then it's a problem. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"When the system is at fault, someone has to bring attention to it. It's really robbery what they've done already." <A href="mailto:kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca">kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 15-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: PEDESTRIAN SERIOUSLY HURT IN CRASH
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.08/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A student at a West End business school was seriously injured yesterday after a car driven by one of her classmates hit her while she walked across Portage Avenue. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police have not released the name of the injured 21-year-old, who was in critical condition last night, but fellow students from Edutech Training Centres identified her as Andrea. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'm always telling them I don't want to cross there -- it's too dangerous," said student Efren Santos, who had walked across the street just ahead of Andrea at about 4:30 p.m. to get to a bus stop at the corner of Newman Street in Wolseley. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">When he heard a loud bang behind him, Santos turned and saw the young woman lying on her back in the eastbound lanes of Portage Avenue covered in blood. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I saw Andrea lying there as if she was dead." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He said the young woman was still breathing, but did not respond when her classmates called her name. The driver of the 1987 Grand Am was also a student at the training centre. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos said the driver was trembling when she emerged unhurt from her car. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"This is an accident. We cannot blame each other whose fault it is," Santos said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police questioned the 23-year-old driver while her friends waited for her. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos said the full-time administrative assistant students are "like brothers and sisters". They were leaving the training centre at 609 Erin Street after the day's classes were over. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police Patrol Sgt. Bob Chrismas said he could not speculate about whether any charges would be laid before traffic analysts completed their investigation. The students crossed the street in the middle of a block, halfway between traffic lights with pedestrian signals. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:helen.fallding@freepress.mb.ca">helen.fallding@freepress.mb.ca</A> <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 16-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CANADIAN IDs SOLD ON U.K. WEB: Site Offers Drivers' Licences, Foundation Of False Idenity
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  National Post  June.08/04  Page A12
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TORONTO - Fake Canadian drivers licences of astonishingly good quality are being sold on a British Web site, a breach of security that critics charge will encourage fraudsters to spawn false identities.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Licences from British Columbia, Nova Scotia, P.E.I., Alberta, Ontario and Quebec are available on the Web site at a cost of $90 each (group discounts are also available).<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The B.C. driver's licence was listed as a hot-selling item.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's impressive," said Ontario Tory MPP Bob Runciman, who was told about the site by police officers investigating it. "I thought [the licence] was remarkably accurate. It's obviously got to be a challenge to combat stuff like this."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Canadian licences feature holograms and PVC-coated magnetic strips -- two security features intended to prevent forgery.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mr. Runciman said the driver's licence is a foundation document, a building block around which false identities can be created.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"This is something you can use to obtain a health card, perhaps to start calling yourself Charles Smith or whatever the intent, criminal or otherwise, might be. And I think that's the primary concern, that especially given the tenor of our times after Sept. 11, that apparently it's so easy to access this kind of document that you can build a false identity on."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Digital Products, <A href="http://www.digitalproducts.cwc.net/">www.digitalproducts.cwc.net</A>, a Luton, England-based company sells, forged licences from around the world as well as fake certification and employee ID for large tech companies such as Microsoft Corp. and Cisco Systems Inc. ID card printers, which cost between $899 and $1,399 are available for purchase.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The company boasts its two years of Internet sales "makes us something of a veteran in this emerging field."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Digital Products advertises to buy "genuine ID cards," encouraging potential sellers to phone its U.K.-offices or drop into the shop.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Moments after the site was raised during Question Period in the Ontario legislature, Transportation Minister Harinder Takhar said the forged licences did not contain stolen private information from Ontario residents.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They're all fake numbers," he said. "They have no relationship to the numbers we have in our database."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">RCMP officials said they were aware of Web sites similar to Digital Products and advised the public to use extreme caution in dealing with such vendors.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 17-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: WIDOW TO GET JAIL: Caused Fatal Crash
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A former Peguis First Nation woman will find out today whether she'll do prison time for causing the alcohol-induced crash that killed her husband two years ago. Ignored warnings <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Eleanor Thomas, 39, was convicted last month of impaired driving causing death. She was behind the wheel during a crash that took the life of her husband, Jeffrey Keith Thomas, on July 22, 2002. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Eleanor and Jeffrey had been drinking at a bar on the reserve, but ignored warnings from friends and serving staff who told them not to drive home. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Instead, they raced out of the parking lot with Eleanor driving Jeffrey's truck. Minutes later, the truck spun out of control and rolled into a field next to a gravel road. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Yesterday, Crown attorney Andrew Barg said Eleanor was driving at least 114 km/h on the gravel road, and was extremely intoxicated when she took the wheel. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Barg, who's seeking a three-year prison term, also said it's troubling that Thomas refuses to acknowledge she has a problem with alcohol, despite a conviction for impaired driving in 1981, and an arrest for refusing to provide a breathalyser just three months after her husband was killed. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Defence lawyer Ryan Rolston pushed for a two-year conditional sentence, noting Thomas has already lost something of immeasurable importance. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=left><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Queen's Bench Justice Holly Beard is expected to deliver a sentence this morning.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 18-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LOCAL BRIEFS: MOUNTIE DRIVING DRUNK - CITY POLICE
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A Mountie was arrested by city cops last weekend for drunk driving.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Mountie, a 14-year veteran who works at the RCMP headquarters in Winnipeg, was pulled over Saturday night about 9 p.m. at Isabel Street and Pacific Avenue after police were told a vehicle in the area was driving suspiciously:<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 42-year-old man was arrested and briefly taken into custody. Police did not release his name because criminal charges have not yet been laid.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 19-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: RCMP CRUISER 'BLEW THROUGH THE STOP SIGN AND HIT US'
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.09/04  Page A3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A passenger in a car involved in a weekend collision with an RCMP cruiser said yesterday the lone Mountie behind the wheel ran into them. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Roger Mantie, 35, said he was in the passenger seat and his wife Angela, 30, was behind the wheel of their Ford Sable on Saturday when the collision occurred. Their 15-month-old daughter was also in the car. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"And all of a sudden, out of nowhere, this police cruiser comes screaming across the (intersection). He blew through the stop sign and hit us," Mantie said in an interview. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">RCMP refused to discuss Mantie's account of the collision yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gimli RCMP have taken over the investigation of the crash from the Oakbank RCMP detachment, RCMP spokesman Sgt. Steve Colwell said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">RCMP officials decided to hand the case off to avoid a possible conflict of interest, since the officer involved in the crash is technically a member of the Oakbank detachment, Colwell said. The cruiser, based at the Steinbach detachment, was headed south on Highway 12. The Manties' car was headed east on Highway 15. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The two highways cross to form the major intersection at Anola, a farming community about 30 kilometres east of Winnipeg. There is a four-way stop sign at the intersection. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Roger Mantie and the couple's little girl weren't hurt, and were released later the same day from hospital. Angela Mantie suffered a broken arm, four broken ribs and a punctured lung, her husband said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mantie wondered if the officer's view of them had been obstructed by a truck travelling ahead of the cruiser on <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Hwy 12. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"My wife didn't see the cruiser screaming through the intersection before I did." "And I yelled at her 'Look out' and she turned the wheel," Mantie said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">That instantaneous reaction probably saved her life, said her husband, a sentiment echoed by her father, Blaine <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Canning. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Canning said his daughter sat up yesterday for the first time in her bed at Health Sciences Centre. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Angie is doing relatively well," said Canning. He said the point of impact in the crash was the left front wheel -- on the driver's side. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It was within a 100th of a second of being a fatal crash," Canning said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The family emphasized yesterday that the crash was an accident. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Manties don't want to see the officer's career damaged, which is what would happen if criminal charges were to be laid, the husband said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:alexandra.paul@freepress.mb.ca">alexandra.paul@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 20-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: RCMP VETERAN ARRESTED FOR IMPAIRED DRIVING
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.09/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 14-year-veteran of the RCMP was arrested Saturday night in Winnipeg for impaired driving. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police stopped a vehicle around 9 p.m. at Isabel Street and Pacific Avenue after it was reported to police as suspicious. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A man was taken into custody and released on an appearance notice for court at a later date. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 42-year-old officer's name wasn't released because charges haven't been formally laid. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The officer has been assigned to administrative duties with his unit at D Division headquarters in Winnipeg.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 21-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: ACCIDENT SHOCKS BUSINESS SCHOOL
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.09/04  Page B5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">STUDENTS and staff at a West End business school were still in shock a day after a student was struck by a car driven by a fellow student. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The 21-year-old woman, known only as Andrea, was still listed in critical condition yesterday at the Health Sciences Centre. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It was a tough day," Warren Gander, executive director of Edutech Training Centre, 609 Erin St., said yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"She and her classmates have been here for five weeks and with only 12 students in each class, they are really close friends. They're all like brothers and <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">sisters. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's pretty devastating for the students here. Two students witnessed it and five or six students were at the bus stop. Everyone is walking around in a daze and crying." Winnipeg police said the woman, who was hit while crossing Portage Avenue with two other students at Newman Street, suffered severe head and spinal trauma. She was rushed to the Health Sciences Centre. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police said her next of kin have been notified and the department's traffic investigation unit is continuing to investigate. The 23-year-old driver of a 1987 Grand Am was not injured. No charges have been laid. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Outpouring of grief <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gander said classes went on yesterday, but probably little was done because of the outpouring of grief at the school. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He said the woman, married with a two-year-old child, has relatives coming in from northern Manitoba and across the country. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gander said she was taking an administrative assistant course at the non-profit business school, which mostly teaches people whose tuition is covered by the federal employment insurance program. He said the driver of the car is devastated about what happened. "She was her friend." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"She didn't stand a chance because the student ran into the side of her car. She didn't have a hope of stopping." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca">kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 22-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: BUSINESS WATCH: More Defects Disclosed
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.09/04  Page C11
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TOKYO -- Mitsubishi Fuso Truck &amp; Bus Corp. disclosed yesterday an additional 93 vehicle defects based on an investigation going back to 1992, including some that reportedly caused 21 accidents resulting in injury. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The latest revelation comes as Mitsubishi Fuso tries to re-establish its credibility after acknowledging last month that officials had covered up wheel and clutch defects suspected of causing two fatal accidents. Prosecutors have charged former executives and current officials in those cases. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Last week, Mitsubishi Motors -- which spun off Mitsubishi Fuso in 2003 -- acknowledged it had failed to disclose all known defects in 2000, when it admitted to systematically covering up problems to avoid costly recalls.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 23-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: BELMONT BIKE RODEO THE WHEEL DEAL
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.09/04  Page N5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Chances are good that a person's first experience in an ambulance won't be a good one. Unless, of course, that first experience happened to be on May 15 at Belmont School. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On that day, the Belmont School Parents Association held a Bicycle Rodeo, which included a visit from the Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We wanted (the paramedics) to show the kids what goes on in an ambulance when they are treating a bicycle-related injury," explains Parents Association president Al Gowrilik. "We wanted to make the kids' first experience in an ambulance a good one. As it turns out, that was one of the more popular activities." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The event was a tremendous success, with approximately 350 students and family members attending. Gowrilik says the number is flattering considering the French immersion school only has about 225 students. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We had a lot of siblings out, too. Kids brought their brothers and sisters," he explains. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Perhaps the only negative aspect of the day was the weather. The snow in early May left ice in the parking lot where there rodeo was held. The event was designed to teach kids about bicycle safety, including how to properly wear a helmet, bicycle maintenance, and road rules and safety. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Assisting in the endeavour, aside from the paramedics, were representatives from Manitoba Public Insurance, the Winnipeg Police Bicycle Unit, and Kylie Case, one of the world's top ranked mountain bike athletes. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The event started with some classroom instruction by two members of MPI, followed by a 'road test' in the parking lot. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Participants also had their bicycles safety checked by representatives of Olympia Cycle and Ski, and got to grill the bicycle police on what their jobs are like. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I found that the kids, especially the boys, really paid attention to what the police were saying," says Gowrilik. "Some of the students are getting to that age where they think wearing helmets isn't very cool, but then they see these policeman wearing helmets, then they have more respect for it." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gowrilik says that proper helmet fitting was one point that was really stressed. "It's important that they keep the helmet on and horizontal, not on the back of their heads like many wear it. A helmet isn't a fashion statement," he says. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">But more than anything, says Gowrilik, the day was simply fun. In fact, before any of the presentations began, eight teachers and the principal of the West Kildonan school participated in a tricycle race. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"And they wore helmets, too," laughs Gowrilik. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Canadian Tire at Garden City Shopping Centre donated six bicycles for the event, all of which were randomly given away to six lucky students, one from each grade. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gowrilik believes that the safety message was received by the students. Even his youngest daughter, who is three and who participated on a tricycle, learned how to signal to make turns.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 24-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: VICTIM SUCCUMBS: Pedestrian Hit By Car On Portage
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 22-year-old woman who was hit by a car -- allegedly driven by a female classmate -- as she crossed Portage Avenue after school on Monday has died of her injuries. Police have identified the accident victim as Andrea Farguson, of Winnipeg. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"She was quiet and always friendly," former neighbour Mary Martens said, adding Farguson was kept busy with her education plans and her two-year-old son. "She seemed like a content woman. ... I would've liked to get to know her better." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Farguson was crossing Portage southbound near Newman Street just after 4:30 p.m., when an eastbound 1987 Grand Am struck her in the curb lane. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Witnesses said she was lagging behind three friends en route to the bus stop when the accident occurred. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I heard a big bang and boom," Efren Santos, who had been walking just ahead of Farguson, told The Sun earlier this week. "I turned my head and I saw her lying there, bleeding." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Farguson, who had suffered severe head and spinal trauma according to police, was taken to Health Sciences Centre in critical condition. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Minutes earlier, Farguson had left class for the day at Edutech Training Centres at 609 Erin St. -- where she was taking a seven-month course to become an administrative assistant. Friends said she had only been enrolled in the course for about a month. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Officials at the private vocational school declined comment yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">'Always making jokes' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Santos described his friend as a "nice" woman who was "always making jokes." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Martens, who lived next-door to Farguson in Fort Rouge, said Farguson moved last month to a downtown apartment with her husband, Brent, and their two-year-old son so she could be closer to school. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Brent is a kitchen manager at a Smitty's Family Restaurant on Pembina Highway. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"They don't even own a car," Martens said. "She was always taking a taxi everywhere." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Farguson was originally from Nunavut, Martens added. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Farguson's grieving friends and relatives, reached yesterday at her downtown apartment, weren't prepared to talk about the young woman's life. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Meanwhile, Winnipeg police were continuing to investigate, but charges against the 23-year-old female driver appear unlikely. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Const. Bob Johnson said yesterday "the likelihood of charges is low." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Investigators believe Farguson was jaywalking and was running to catch a bus when she was hit.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 25-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: THIEF DUMPS ON HIS TRUCK: Excrementating Evidence?
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">As far as acts of vandalism go, this one was pretty crappy. Auctioneer Terry Wachniak awoke Tuesday morning to find someone had smeared human feces inside his 1997 Ford pickup truck and on the exterior walls of his Wolseley home. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He used his hands to do some primitive artwork on my window as well as to my building," Wachniak, of Wachniak Auctions, told The Sun yesterday. "My vehicle was abused in not a very nice way at all and my building was smeared with the evidence." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Besides leaving the mess involving bodily waste, the culprit also stole about $500 worth of "odds and ends" -- including some collectible ornaments -- from the glove compartment in the half-ton truck, Wachniak said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Most importantly, the vandal apparently left his fingerprints in the human excrement. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">However, under department policy, Winnipeg police don't take fingerprints from vehicles, said spokesman Const. Bob Johnson. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We don't fingerprint vehicles because it makes no sense to fingerprint vehicles," Johnson said, explaining a vehicle could have numerous sets of fingerprints. "Finding a fingerprint on a car doesn't mean he's responsible for the damage." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wachniak disagrees in this case. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It can't be anybody else. Who else would be touching and smearing that stuff?" he asked. "The guy was creating works of art." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wachniak said he has a pretty good idea of who may be responsible because there was a man in his driveway Monday night who seemed to be "off his medication." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The man, who appeared to be harmless, was white, in his 40s, about 5-foot-10 and 200 pounds, wearing a plaid pullover shirt, Wachniak said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police have taken a report of the incident. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wachniak is disappointed cops won't be investigating the incident any further because he said whoever is responsible is a disturbed individual who should be arrested. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"That is somebody who is crying out for help and needs it," Wachniak said, adding he's certain he is not the first victim. "And if no one is looking for him, I'm not going to be the last."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 26-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: DRUNK DRIVER EARNS TIME FOR KILLING HUBBY IN CRASH
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A judge's sympathy wasn't enough to save a former Manitoba woman from going to prison for three years for the booze-fuelled crash that killed her husband. Eleanor Thomas, a former Peguis First Nation resident, was handed the three-year prison sentence yesterday. She was convicted last March of impaired driving causing death. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In sentencing her, Queen's Bench Justice Holly Beard pointed out Thomas is a victim of her own crime, having lost her husband, Jeffrey Keith Thomas, in a rollover on the reserve on July 22, 2002. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">But Thomas' related criminal record, including a prior conviction for impaired driving and one for refusing to provide a breath sample, disentitles her from a more lenient sentence, Beard said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">'Made bad choices' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I have no doubt that when you got up that morning, you didn't plan to drink and drive, you didn't plan to have an accident and you didn't plan to cause the death of your husband," she said. "I'm not saying that you're a bad person, but you made some bad choices." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">On the day in question, Thomas and her husband had been drinking together at a bar on the reserve, becoming so intoxicated they were refused service by the bartender. They later ignored warnings from friends and serving staff who told them not to drive home, opting instead to race out of the parking lot with Eleanor at the wheel of Jeffrey's truck. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Minutes later, the truck spun out of control and rolled into a field next to a gravel road. Thomas' husband died at the scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Yesterday, his family members embraced each other as Thomas was led away in shackles. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'm just glad the judge made the right decision," said Shannon Thomas, Jeffrey's 24-year-old daughter. "I'm glad it's over." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">At her trial, experts testified that Thomas was driving at least 114 km/h per hour -- 24 clicks above the posted speed limit on the gravel road. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Beard counted Thomas's age, related record, and apparent lack of remorse as factors that contributed to her decision. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She also questioned Thomas' claim that she couldn't remember the accident. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I can't tell whether this is a genuine lack of memory or if she just doesn't want to remember her role in such a terrible event," Beard said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 27-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: HUSBAND DIED, DRUNK DRIVER JAILED 3 YEARS
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.10/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 39-year-old Interlake woman was sentenced to three years in prison yesterday for a drunk driving accident that killed her husband. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Eleanor Thomas's lawyer had asked for a conditional sentence, but Justice Holly Beard of Court of Queen's Bench said there were too many aggravating circumstances, including the fact Thomas has two other drinking and driving related convictions -- one of which occurred just months after the <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">fatality. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'm not saying you're a bad person but you made some bad choices," Beard said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Jeff Thomas was a passenger in the vehicle driven by his wife in July 2002. He died after being thrown six metres from the vehicle after it rolled on a gravel road. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">His 24-year-old daughter was in court yesterday for the sentencing. "I'm glad the judge made the right choice," said Shannon Thomas, adding that she's relieved the case is over. She said she no longer has any contact with her mother, who has since moved to the Northwest Territories. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Court was told that Eleanor Thomas, her husband and a few others were drinking at a friend's house when they all decided to go to a bar in Hodgson. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">After having one round of drinks, the bartender cut them off. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"That should have been a clear indication to Ms Thomas that she was impaired," Beard said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Witnesses at the bar, who testified at Thomas's trial earlier this year, said she was clearly drunk, noting that she was arguing, talking and laughing loudly and had difficulty walking. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Beard said Thomas had options other than getting behind the wheel. Court was told the bartender offered to find the couple a ride but they refused. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:david.kuxhaus@freepress.mb.ca">david.kuxhaus@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 28-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: YOUNG MOTHER CITY'S EIGHTH '04 TRAFFIC FATALITY
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.10/04  Page A7
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 22-year-old woman hit by a car Monday on Portage Avenue is the eighth person killed this year in Winnipeg in a traffic-related incident. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police say Andrea Farguson died yesterday in hospital. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She was injured after she apparently darted into eastbound traffic near Portage and Newman Street at about 4:30 p.m. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A former neighbour of Farguson said she originally came from Nunavut and rented a house in the Fort Rouge area with her husband over the past year. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mary Martens said the couple had a young boy and were friendly, quiet neighbours. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She said they moved out of the house about a month ago to live downtown so that Farguson could be closer to school. Farguson, a student at Edutech Training Centres, 609 Erin St., is believed to have run across Portage to catch a bus home when she was hit by a car driven by one of her classmates. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's very, very, sad, "Edutech director Warren Gander said yesterday. "There's a lot of healing that's needed." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Gander said students yesterday had a memorial service for Farguson and lay flowers on the street near where she was struck. She suffered severe head and spinal trauma. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The students want to do something more," he said. "She had a young son that needs to be taken care of. This has traumatized a lot of people." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Farguson's family declined to be interviewed. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police have not named the 23-year-old female driver of the 1987 Grand Am, but added an investigation is continuing. Farguson was taking an administrative assistant course at the non-profit business school, which mostly teaches people whose tuition is covered by the federal employment insurance program. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:bruce.owen@freepress.mb.ca">bruce.owen@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 29-Nov-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: INSURANCE RATES GO THE DISTANCE: Charging By The Kilometre Could Reduce Driver's Costs
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Financial Post  June.10/04  Page FP11
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Auto-insurance prices often look arbitrary. A friend of mine who lives near London, Ont., until recently clocked about 20,000 kilometres each year in leisure and work travel. Because of a prolonged illness, however, he has cut the distance he travels annually by as much as 85%. Have his premiums fallen because he now drives little and thus presents less risk? Not by a cent. Is there a system available that could make his rates fairer? You bet -- and it is one that has proven to be effective.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">One remedy for high auto-insurance costs is insurance premiums based on a vehicle's actual accumulated mileage, sometimes referred to as per-mile or per-distance insurance. The price drivers pay for insurance would increase according the added risks of added driving, and the costs of driving, including fuel and maintenance, would be better aligned with the benefits. There would then be a further incentive to occasionally take public transit, and a smaller insurance subsidy implicitly paid by low-mileage drivers to people who drive more frequently.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The per-distance approach has an outlook quite different from the current one. Under a typical insurance plan, premiums are based on past risk experience: Did the driver have an accident or get a speeding ticket, drive to work in a city with a high claims rate, or drive a car model associated with many accidents? The price of car insurance is based on an inherently backward-looking risk assessment, an incomplete one at best.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In reality, however, the risk drivers pose to others, to themselves and to property also depends on the next trip they take. Drivers present a risk by driving additional distance, raising the likelihood of an accident, and they create an added risk to others by congesting streets, a cost those drivers do not directly pay. The more they are on the road, the more likely someone else is to hit them, or vice versa.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">How tight is the link between distance and accident risk? Other factors, such as the fact that drivers in less accident-prone rural areas tend to drive more, complicate the answer. While higher-mileage drivers, as a group, have a lower per-mile rate of accidents, the effect of an extra mile on the margin for a given individual driver should be a proportional increase in accident risk because mileage is the only variable for that individual that has changed. Hence, the problem. Take two drivers identical in every other risk factor such as age, location and past driving experience, including how much they drive. Now suppose one takes a recreational car trip across the country every summer. They both continue to pay the same insurance, even though the one driver is now creating more risk to him or herself and others by driving a great deal more.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Because of the incentive of per-distance insurance to drive less, the potential savings to society from a reduction in insured accident costs are substantial. Aaron Edlin, of the University of California at Berkeley, put the U.S. saving at US$9.8-billion to US$12.7-billion, or $US58 to US$75 annually per insured vehicle. Secondary benefits, such as a lower uninsured accident costs, congestion and environmental damage, make the potential benefits even greater.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Some commentators suggest a per-distance premium system could most easily be implemented through periodic monitoring of odometers by a service technician registered for the job. Proponents say tampering with the odometer readings, either through oversized tires, changing axis ratios or disconnecting the odometer, could be detected using tamper-evident seals and with an examination of the vehicle. Inevitably, the question of costs arises, with estimates ranging from $8 to $40 per vehicle per year. Still, as long as the net benefit is positive, there are gains to be made, even if per-distance premiums might be unattractive from an insurance company's perspective if consumers are relatively insensitive to price.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Progressive Auto Insurance Company ran a pilot project in Texas in 1998, installing GPS and cellular technology in the cars of willing clients. This allowed mileage to be monitored, while the price per mile for insurance was set according to an assessment of the risk per mile, based on the company's data analysis and experience in the business.
