Police did not release his name. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:bruce.owen@freepress.mb.ca">bruce.owen@freepress.mb.ca</A> <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 31-Dec-12
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: SASKATCHEWAN ENVIRONMENT MINISTER PUTS MONEY WHERE MOUTH IS, BUYS HYBIRD CAR
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  National Post  June.16/04  Page A7
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Saskatchewan's NDP Environment Minister has traded in his 1986 Nissan truck and now owns a hybrid car that uses a combination of gasoline and battery power. "We all worry about the price of gas, and really, I am not sure how much it will go down," David Forbes said as he took a test drive around the provincial legislature yesterday. "We really have to look at ways of reducing the consumption of gas.... I think this is something that people should be thinking about when looking to buy new vehicles. As Gandhi says: 'Be the change you want to see.' " Mr. Forbes noted the car was his own -- bought and paid for by himself, with no kickback from the manufacturer, Toyota.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 1-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: SUSPECTS HAULED IN: Heist With Tow Truck Too Hot
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 72-year-old man and a 25-year-old woman have been arrested for allegedly using a bright pinkish-red tow truck to steal a $38,000 sports car last month in West Kildonan. The elderly man, who is accused of driving the flashy tow truck, and his alleged younger female accomplice are each facing a charge of theft over $5,000, police said yesterday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Cops are looking for one other suspect, a 34-year-old man, who is also wanted on an unrelated charge. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's freaky, absolutely unbelievable," said Rice Lander, who owns the prized vehicle -- a 2002 Pontiac Trans Am -- with her husband Shael. "It's just too outlandish. How could this happen?" <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The red Trans Am was stolen sometime before 2 p.m. May 17 from a parking lot outside Heavenly Bodies Fitness Centre at 2146 Main St. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Several witnesses reported seeing an unmarked pinkish-red tow truck hoist the legally parked sports car -- which was equipped with an alarm system and an immobilizer -- and drive off. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Four days later, a front-page story ran exclusively in The Winnipeg Sun detailing the bizarre theft. Early that day, the brazen thieves dumped the rare Trans Am on Royal Avenue in West Kildonan, just blocks from where it was towed away, and police recovered it. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Landers and a Manitoba Public Insurance official figured the media attention was too much for the thieves, who apparently decided to immediately get rid of the car, which the Landers had specially ordered in January 2002. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The vehicle sustained about $7,000 damage -- mostly to its tan leather interior, Lander said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Several easy-to-remove parts had been stripped, including the fuses, airbags, battery and the mirrors. The crooks also smashed the steering column, and the paint was scratched. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It was minimal damage, thank God. It could've been worse, so we're very lucky," Lander said. "We're lucky they didn't start it on fire." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Over the next few days, tips poured into police about a pink tow truck that was owned by an automotive business in Stonewall. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Coincidentally, the 51-year-old owner of that business was busted last Friday for allegedly running a chop shop. However, cops said yesterday that the chop shop isn't related to the theft of the Trans Am. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H5 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">'PINKISH-RED' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H5>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I think our car sparked an investigation into them (the chop shop)," Lander said, adding the tow truck that took her Trans Am was "pinkish-red," rather than just pink. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A grateful Lander said she received about 30 calls from tipsters after the bizarre theft was featured in The Sun. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The community outpouring was amazing," she said. "Everybody out there was trying to put all the pieces together. It just blows us away." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The elderly suspect in the Trans Am caper was allegedly working for someone who instructed him to pick up the vehicle and deliver it to another location, police said. The female suspect, meanwhile, has been unco-operative with investigators and the wanted man is allegedly an illegal alien, Lander said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Their names have been withheld because they won't officially be charged until they appear in court.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 2-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: MAKE CRUISE ISSUE IN ELECTION: PETITION - Area Residents Fed Up With Sunday Pastime
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.17/04  Page B6
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">WHETHER they like cruising night on Portage Avenue or not, supporters and detractors are signing a petition aimed at making it an issue in the mayoral election. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Wolseley and West End residents have complained for years about illegal street racing by some cruisers, loud engines revving, and noisy vehicles driving down residential side streets and back alleys. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Carol Friesen, a West End resident who signed the petition, said the noise gets so bad that a few weeks ago "I had my windows and doors closed and I could still hear it. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I've been here 13 years, but it's the last three years that it has got really bad. It's like having a street party at the end of your street every Sunday." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Friesen said the most disturbing development is now there are prostitutes coming into her area on Sunday nights. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It concerns me what is going on in our back lanes," she said. "We're fed up with it. "They should move it somewhere else because I don't see how you can tone it down." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Fred Morris, a resident in the area who is spearheading the petition, said he just wants a debate on the issue by the mayoral candidates. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Right now there are two or three councillors worrying about the issue and everyone else is ignoring it," Morris said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I think everyone should be working on it. The people running for mayor should show some leadership." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">His petition seems to be working. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Several of the mayoral candidates are talking about what they would do about cruise night. Mayoral candidate Al Golden would move Sunday night cruising from Portage Avenue to downtown. Dan Vandal would work with the community to identify cruising problems. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">And MaryAnn Mihychuk would continue to drive her 1955 fire-engine red GMC pickup truck up and down Portage Avenue on Sunday nights. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I think cruising is fabulous," Mihychuk said recently. "I've even gone cruising in my husband's Mustang convertible. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I cruised (on a recent) Sunday night and there were hundreds of people and everyone enjoyed it. There are some speeders and reckless drivers, but the police were vigilant and present. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I saw 1,000 drivers and only one hot-rodding around. But the police pulled him over." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Mihychuk said there are benefits to cruising. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's like a festival every Sunday. It makes people smile and feel happy about their city. And I represented the West End for 15 years and I only had two families complain out of 10,000." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">But Golden said because of the complaints he has heard, he would move the cruising to an area of the downtown that is relatively dead on a Sunday night. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I've asked them instead of going down Portage that we run it down St. Mary Avenue from Main Street to Vaughan Street to Graham Avenue and then around," Golden said. "All the vendors could set up there and there are few residents. Everyone would benefit." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Golden said his idea is one more that sets him apart from the other candidates running for mayor. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's one thing to promise a solution -- it's another to come up with a solution," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The area residents should not have had to wait this long. I think I've come up with a constructive solution that isn't negative for anyone. But if something negative comes up about it, we'll come up with another solution." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Vandal said he would work with local residents and the police traffic service officers "to identify the problems. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It's probably noise and probably congestion. I'd always, always involve the area residents because they're the ones who have to live with the effect." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca">kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 3-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: AUTOMOTIVE SHOWCASE: CARMAKERS MULL SUIT OVER CALIFORNIA EMISSIONS PLAN
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Sun  June.18/04  Page A9
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">DETROIT (Reuters) - Automakers may sue to block California's plan to require that new vehicles sold in the state cut greenhouse gas emissions by 30 percent in the next 10 years, an industry group said on Tuesday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The draft plan of California, which accounts for nearly 13 percent of the U.S. auto market, would phase in reductions of gases linked to global warming in two steps for cars and trucks sold in the state from 2009 through 2014. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The automakers believe the state's plan, which comes at a time when U.S. gasoline prices are close to record highs, would raise vehicle prices by forcing them to boost fuel economy. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"It is illegal," said Eron Shosteck, spokesman for the Washington-based Alliance of Automobile Manufacturers. "States cannot set their own fuel economy standards," he added, saying a lawsuit to counter the California measure was an option the alliance was seriously looking into. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The new proposal is likely to add "thousands of dollars" on each vehicle, Shosteck said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The alliance represents nine automakers including Detroit's Big Three, whose profit comes mostly from sales of low-mileage sport utility vehicles and pickup trucks. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">To cut tailpipe emissions, automakers must improve fuel efficiency since greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide cannot be filtered from vehicle exhausts. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">General Motors Corp. and DaimlerChrysler AG have already fought California in the courts to delay clean-air regulations. In 2002, they won a court injunction that postponed California's plans to force automakers to sell a certain number of low-pollution vehicles. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Last year, GM and DaimlerChrysler dropped their lawsuit after California changed its policy to allow more hybrid vehicles, which use batteries to cut gasoline consumption. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Asked about California's latest plan, which was unveiled on Monday, the head of DaimlerChrysler's Chrysler division echoed the argument that only the federal government had the authority to regulate fuel economy. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I would be skeptical if that really would come into law in California," said Chrysler Chief Executive Dieter Zetsche.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He added that a 30 percent improvement in fuel economy was achievable in the "foreseeable future" only if automakers totally change their vehicle lineups, offering only small-sized cars instead of a mix of cars and light trucks. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"That's a choice I think we should leave to our customers and not mandate or enforce in the market," Zetsche said. He spoke at the Chrysler proving grounds in Chelsea, Michigan, where he unveiled two new variants of Chrysler's Dodge Ram pickup, including one equipped with a 500-horsepower V-10 engine. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Many automakers, including Detroit's Big Three, have plans to roll out hybrid vehicles and Zetsche said clean-burning diesel engines could also help reduce fuel consumption and emissions going forward. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Ford Motor Co. will launch its new Escape hybrid SUV, which gets an estimated 35 to 40 miles per gallon, later this summer, and has plans to roll out others in the near future. Hybrid versions of the Chevy Silverado and GMC Sierra from GM, and Chrysler's Dodge Ram pickup truck are also scheduled to go on sale later this year. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Shosteck said fuel economy is not a top priority among consumers. "It still ranks behind cupholders," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Regardless of consumer attitudes, many states may follow California's lead in its battle against the auto industry and global warming.</SPAN><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 4-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: DAD HIT ON ROAD, KILLED
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 28-year-old father of two was fatally struck down by a suspected drunk driver in his northern Manitoba community on the weekend. Brian Luke Anderson, of Norway House Cree Nation, died instantly when he was hit by a northbound 2001 Ford pickup truck about 11:40 p.m. Saturday, police said. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H5 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">'MOMMY'S BOY' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H5>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He'll have to live with that for the rest of his life," Alex Anderson, the victim's uncle, said of the alleged drunk driver. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He will probably not be able to face a lot of people." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Anderson was walking along Provincial Road 373 toward the home where he lived with his mother, Dora. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He worshipped his mother," Alex said. "He'd do anything for her ... He was a mommy's boy." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The single mom is taking the news hard, Alex said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"She did everything for him. That was her son. Her son couldn't do anything wrong," he said. "She's having a hard time." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Moments before the collision, the driver of the truck had passed another northbound vehicle. Norway House RCMP believe rain combined with excessive speed were contributing factors. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 28-year-old man, also a resident of the reserve, was charged with two drunk driving-related offences and the dangerous operation of a vehicle causing death.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 5-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: IN BRIEF: NORWAY HOUSE MAN KILLED
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.21/04  Page A3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A pedestrian in Norway House was killed instantly after being hit by a pickup truck Friday night. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Brian Luke Anderson of Norway House Cree Nation was walking along Provincial Road 373 on the reserve at about 11:40 p.m. when he was struck by a northbound white 2001 Ford pickup, RCMP said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 28-year-old, who will not be named until he appears in court in Thompson tomorrow, is charged with impaired driving and dangerous operation of a vehicle causing death. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN>

Title: 6-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CANADA IN BRIEF: B.C MINISTER DEFENDS RECORD ON DRUNK DRIVERS
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  June.21/04  Page A7
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Vancouver. B.C. Solicitor-General Rich Coleman said the group Mothers Against Drunk Driving is way off the mark in giving the province barely a passing grade in its battle with boozing motorists.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In its 2004 progress report, MADD Canada gave British Columbia its lowest, &#8220;needs improvement,&#8221; rating alongside Nunavut, New Brunswick and Quebec.CP<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 7-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: TAXI PLOWED TWICE: Suspected Drunk Driver Held In Cabbie’s Death
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 63-year-old Spring Taxi driver was killed early yesterday after an alleged drunk driver slammed into his cab and forced him into oncoming traffic. Police did not release the 63-year-old victim's name, but friends identified him as Robert Nebone. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was a really nice guy, the right kind of guy," said Avery Spigelman, manager of Spring Taxi. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Nebone was headed south on Salter Street about 3:45 a.m. when the 20-year-old female driver of a 1999 Ford Escort, driving east on College Avenue, approached the Salter Street intersection. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The woman -- who was allegedly drunk and driving without a licence -- drove through the stop sign and hit Nebone's taxi. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The cab was pushed into the northbound lane where it crashed head-on into a Crown Victoria, police said. The 28-year-old driver of the Crown Victoria was not hurt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver and a female passenger, who weren't hurt, tried to run from the crash scene, police allege. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Witnesses held the women until police could get there. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Nebone was taken to Health Sciences Centre in critical condition where he was pronounced dead. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Spigelman said Nebone drove for his company since 1989. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was a valued employee. He was with Spring Taxi from the start," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Albert Collette, who was drinking coffee at Soap Opera Laundry Centre and Coffee Shop at 500 Sargent Ave. yesterday, said he's known Nebone, who was a regular at the shop, for a couple of years. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H5 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">TWO SONS AND A DAUGHTER <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H5>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I'm shocked. It's too bad," Collette said. "He was a well-known guy around here." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Collette said Nebone had two sons and a daughter. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He lived with his boys in an apartment at the corner of Balmoral Street and Sargent Avenue, Collette said. Krista Wishart, who works at Soap Opera, said Nebone had at least two grandchildren. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Nebone was a "really great guy," Wishart said, adding he tipped well. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was just Cab Driver Bob, that's how I knew him," Wishart said. "He had his nicknames for all of the young girls who worked here. He always used to have a joke whenever he came in here." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Collette said he was concerned that the woman who allegedly caused Nebone's death wouldn't spend any time in jail. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"The laws around here suck," he said. "If you were in the States, that would never happen." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Yesterday morning, the intersection of Salter Street and College Avenue was taped off while police photographed and analysed the crash scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The teal-coloured Ford Escort was near the curb on the east side of the intersection. A white Crown Victoria's crumpled front was smashed into the beige taxicab. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The intersection reopened later in the day. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police charged 20-year-old Shirley Spence with impaired driving causing death and took her into custody.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=NL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: NL; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 8-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: DRUNK? STRICTER SENTENCES: Pols Need To Get Off Butts - Relative
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A Winnipeg man says the death of a cab driver killed early yesterday by an alleged impaired driver reinforces his family's call for tougher sentences. "There has to be something to serve as a deterrent and it can't be a conditional sentence like what happened to Lindsay McCaughan," Alan Storie said of the woman who struck and killed his brother-in-law on Aug. 15, 2003. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">McCaughan, 20, was driving drunk when she slammed into Michael Antosh while he was getting out of his vehicle on Portage Avenue. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Antosh's relatives say they were disgusted with the 18-month conditional sentence McCaughan received last week. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Politicians need to get off their asses and change the law so conditional sentences can't be used in cases where somebody is fatally injured," Storie said yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Maybe one of the politicians' family members needs to be involved for that to happen." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Manitoba received a 'B' grade yesterday from Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) in its annual report card that reviews the efforts of provinces to introduce new impaired driving laws. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">MADD says Manitoba is one of three provinces that is setting a good example.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 9-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: FAST FOOD PROVES DRUNK'S DOWNFALL
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">An alleged drunk driver picked the wrong time to get to get into a collision Thursday evening, right in front of an off-duty cop.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The driver banged into another vehicle in the drive-through line of a fast food restaurant in Brandon and then stumbled out of his vehicle to check the damage.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police say the driver blew .17 and .18, more than twice the legal limit.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 10-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CRASH KILLS 'TAXI BOB' AFTER 30-YEAR-RUN
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.19/04  Page A1/A4
NEWS_ITM_BYLN_TXT: By Kevin Rollason And David Kuxhaus
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 63-year-old cab driver is dead after a suspected impaired driver plowed into his taxi early yesterday morning. Bob Nebone, a driver with Spring Taxi for 30 years, was rushed to the Health Sciences Centre but was pronounced dead on arrival. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Winnipeg police said a 20-year-old driver and her passenger attempted to flee the scene but were held by bystanders until officers arrived. The collision, at Salter Street and College Avenue, happened at 3:45 a.m. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Nebone's relatives did not want to comment yesterday, but friends said the cab driver was a father of two teenagers. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The owner and staff at the Soap Opera Laundry Centre and Coffee Shop at 500 Sargent Ave., who knew Nebone only as "Taxi Bob", were devastated at the loss of a person they considered more than just a customer. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I knew something was wrong," owner Sharon Oger said yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I said, 'Bob is usually in.' I figured something must have happened. He was always here in the morning when the girls opened up, but he wasn't (yesterday). He was our protector. He would even sit in our parking lot waiting for calls." Oger said Nebone was so well liked that he would be invited in for coffee when the day staff got to work more than half an hour before the shop's doors opened for the day. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She said Nebone has two teenage boys he's raising by himself, so when he ran short of cash she would loan him some. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was always good for it." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Oger said Nebone was such a large man that he carried a special permit allowing him not to wear a seatbelt. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Maybe if he'd been able to use a seatbelt he'd be OK. But you never know." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Glen Hall, another worker at the laundromat, said: "Bob was very giving. "He was a great guy. It's unfortunate. It's a tragedy. There's not many really good people in the neighbourhood, but he was one." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">At Spring Taxi, a longtime employee said Nebone had been with the cab company for 30 years. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He was a good, hard worker. He worked seven days a week. Everything he earned went to his kids," said the worker, who didn't want his name used. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I did not know one person who didn't like Bob. Everybody around here is pretty choked up." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The impact of the collision woke Kathy Kopychanski, who lives on the corner of College Avenue and Salter Street. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She said she heard a loud bang and looked out her front window. Kopychanski said she saw two girls standing at the scene of the wreckage. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I saw one girl grab another and say to her, 'Look what you've done,' " Kopychanski said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Kopychanski said the brake lights of the taxi were still on and the engine revving. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She said an ambulance arrived moments later and the driver was taken away. For most of yesterday, a stretch of Salter Street from Redwood Avenue to Mountain Avenue was blocked to traffic as investigators surveyed the scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police say the 20-year-old woman, who allegedly didn't have a driver's licence, was driving a 1999 Ford Escort. Officers believe the car was travelling east on College when the driver apparently failed to stop at a stop sign and hit the taxi, which was going south on Salter. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Police say the impact pushed the taxi into the northbound lane on Salter, where it hit a Crown Victoria auto. The 28-year-old driver of that car was not injured. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Both vehicles were nose to nose yesterday as traffic investigators took pictures of the scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The Crown Victoria appeared to have little damage, but the hood of the taxi was crumpled. The front windshield on the driver's side was also smashed. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Several metres away, the front of the Escort was up on the curb on the southwest corner of Salter and College. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Its front end was smashed and the bumper nearly torn off. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Shirley Spence of Winnipeg is charged with impaired driving causing death.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:Kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca">Kevin.rollason@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:David.kuxhaus@freepress.mb.ca">David.kuxhaus@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 11-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: DRUNK-DRIVING FOES LAUD PROVINCIAL LAWS: MADD Gives Manitoba And Ontario Top Marks
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  June.19/04  Page A8
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">MANITOBA'S impaired driving legislation received top marks for the second year in a row on the Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD) annual report card. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Manitoba has been, last year and again this year... a real leader in the country," said Louise Knox, national president of MADD Canada. "It's my hope that the other provinces take note of that." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">MADD released the report yesterday comparing legislation for impaired driving across Canada. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Manitoba scored high on the list, tying Ontario at the top with a B rating. British Columbia, New Brunswick and Nunavut rated the lowest. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Really, Manitoba is setting the pace for the rest of the country," said MADD executive director Andrew Murie. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The province was also singled out as one of three to make significant progress, along with the Northwest Territories, Newfoundland and Labrador. Manitoba's grade in 2000 was a C. Knox said Manitoba's main improvement for the 2004 report was new legislation that lets police conduct field sobriety tests on drivers, determining if they are impaired by alcohol or drugs. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Murie also praised Manitoba's vehicle forfeiture laws. The legislation allows police to crack down on people who drive while suspended by seizing their vehicles after they've been impounded three times. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">MADD would like to see Manitoba revise its graduated licensing program, making a blood alcohol content of zero mandatory for drivers up to the age of 21, said Murie. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"These are not just a wish list of MADD," he said. "These are actually things that are proven worldwide that they're very effective." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Knox also praised the efforts of Manitoba Attorney General Gord Mackintosh. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"He's always been very good at addressing impaired driving issues," she said. "We appreciate the recognition that MADD has given us, but we don't want to rest on these laurels," said Jonathan Hildebrand, a spokesman for the attorney general. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"We know there's more to do to stop impaired driving." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Knox said she thinks the annual reports have encouraged provinces and territories to step up their drinking and driving legislation. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Before that, provinces didn't have very much of an idea of where they stacked up as compared to other provinces," she said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"To be able to have that on paper and do the comparison, it definitely points people in the right direction."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><A href="mailto:Lindsey.wiebe@freepress.mb.ca">Lindsey.wiebe@freepress.mb.ca</A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 12-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: RISE OF ROADSIDE SHRINES: All Around The World, Motorization Has Led To Strangely Similar Rites To Honour The Dead
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  National Post  June.19/04  Page RB3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">For most of last summer, John Belshaw and Diane Purvey drove around in their red, 1990 Honda Civic hatchback, winding their way along the scenic roadways of British Columbia's northern interior, stopping every time they spotted a cross at the side of the road.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Their route took them up Vancouver Island to Port Hardy, over to Prince Rupert and along Highway 16, the Trans-Canada Yellowhead Highway, to Prince George, making detours from the major thoroughfare, once to Kitimat and back, or heading south to Quesnel and then on to Cache Creek. Much of the journey was made on single-lane roads that curved alongside various rivers, in the shadows of mountains, where memorials to collision victims at the scenes of their deaths were as plentiful as doughnut shops in the suburbs.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">By summer's end, the pair had tracked 55 roadside shrines in this remote and relentlessly beautiful landscape, carefully documenting any inscriptions and noting the mementoes left behind. Some were simple wooden crosses, bare save for a few sprigs of fading flowers; others were made of metal and grounded in a concrete base, surrounded by accoutrements that are not customary at death sites or tombs, such as hard hats or baseball caps, beer bottles or mickeys of a favourite liquor.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">For Belshaw and Purvey, historians who are partners in life as well as in academe at The University College of the Cariboo, in Kamloops (she is in the education department, he in history), it was a chance to get a glimpse inside the subculture behind roadside memorials, and attempt to figure out why this centuries-old tradition is gaining ground today.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">There is a growing consensus that these kinds of shrines -- which typically start out as impromptu and makeshift and often end up achieving some permanence -- are becoming more commonplace.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I think it's an attempt by people to take control over mourning," says Belshaw, who studies the history of death in Canada. "The roadside memorial is at a remove from any officially sanctioned mourning site, and is very different in function and form from the cemetery and the funeral home and any of the official spaces of mourning. It's really about taking some kind of control over death."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He and Purvey presented their findings recently at the largest annual gathering of academics in Canada in a paper called I See Dead People: The Rise of the Roadside Shrine, and their research will be part of the first international symposium on roadside memorials, which is being held in Australia next weekend.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">This multi-disciplinary conference will bring together for the first time academics in this new field, each of whom has been exploring the phenomenon from their own diverse perspectives, be it folklore, history, popular culture, sociology, religious studies or even road safety. With topics that range from The Attraction of the Fatal: The Media and Popular Memorial Practices, to Using Queer Theory to Examine Roadside Memorials as Performances of Masculinity, researchers from Australia, Canada, Britain and the United States will be putting their heads together to try to make sense of something that is one of the oldest and newest expressions of grief and mourning.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">French-Canadian trappers put up crosses for fallen fellow trappers along Canadian rivers from 1700 onwards, and Newfoundlanders have a long tradition of putting up crosses on cliffs near where people have drowned, or in the woods where someone succumbed to hypothermia after getting lost.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">In the southwestern United States, where the crosses have been traced to the early days of Spanish exploration, these memorials are called descansos, from a Spanish word meaning rest or relief. Traditionally used to mark the place where a coffin was temporarily set down by weary pallbearers travelling on foot to a cemetery, they were remade with the arrival of the automobile as poignant markers of a fatal accident.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Nowadays, most people are familiar with the massive heaps of flowers, teddy bears and poems that pile up in the outpouring of shock and grief that follows news of a child killed by a drunk driver, a devoted family man struck down by oncoming traffic or a beloved princess suddenly killed in a car crash.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"What we're seeing is the development of an international phenomenon, with differences that represent local traditions and subcultures, but which is really an international response to motorization," says Jennifer Clark, a classics professor at the University of New England, in Armidale, Australia, who has organized the upcoming conference on the topic.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She decided to pull together some researchers because much of the work in this area was going on in completely different disciplines, and scholars were largely oblivious to each other's findings.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She says the preliminary research shows that despite some minor cultural differences, these roadside shrines are remarkably similar around the world -- in their style, in the impetus behind their creation and in the responses they evoke in the community.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Belshaw agrees: "They are almost automatic in certain circumstances, such as sudden death, and for certain categories of people, such as youth, parenthood, sobriety. It's all about the whole idea of a good life lost suddenly, tragically."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He puts it down to an interesting cultural quirk that in Canada, those who kill someone because they're driving drunk are almost never memorialized (although their victims are the quintessential objects of these shrines), while in Australia, deceased drunk drivers are memorialized in a celebration of machismo.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">His research in British Columbia has also shown a wide variance in how roadside shrines are treated by their communities and the authorities, depending on the public impact of the tragedy and the clout of the mourners, so that some are swept away quickly with little fuss, while others simply endure.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Holly Everett, a folklorist who teaches at Newfoundland's Memorial University, is the author of a book, Roadside Crosses in Contemporary Memorial Culture. Her research is being presented at the Australian conference. She has chronicled the controversy that befell a planned community in Texas when its organizing body decided to ban roadside memorials. There were public protests, letters to the editor and editorials in the local newspaper, and emotional outpourings from the friends and relatives of those who had been memorialized.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"In the end, they had to come to a compromise, where they set the amount of time the memorial could stay up, 16 or 18 months, and said it had to conform to certain standards," Everett says. "I think what's happened over the years is that the people who have to deal with these things officially have gained a respect for them. They are recognized as important and meaningful."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">She says that even though these memorials are not always overtly spiritual, they still exert a sense of the sacred. In interviews with road crews from the Texas Department of Highways, she found most workers knew they were "supposed to get rid of them, but they won't go near them at all."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Belshaw says that reverence is the only way to explain why such mementoes as watches, rings and bottles of liquor and beer remain untouched on many of the memorials he saw in northern B.C.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"These are sacred spots and people treat them with that kind of respect. It's taking the private very much into the public, and taking over control" from cemeteries and churches, he says. "There is a social levelling. Anybody can afford a shrine. Many of these are blue-collar artifacts or they're for youth from any class, so it becomes an empowering thing, and that's part of the powerful sacredness to the spots."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">John Robinson is a highway-patrolman-turned-photographer, whose work is being displayed at the conference next weekend. When he was working the roads of New Zealand, he encountered many versions of the roadside homage to accident victims. Once he began making artistic documentation of the shrines and interviewing the people who had erected them, he had a dramatic turnaround in opinion.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"I had always told my wife that if ever I met my demise at the bottom of a power pole, there was no way I wanted it to be acknowledged at the site. I did not want to have people come round a corner and say, 'Oh, there's John's power pole, poor bugger,' " Robinson once told a reporter.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Now I can see how it happens, and why people do it."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 13-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: COLLISIONS CLAIM TWO
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Two men were killed in separate collisions on the province's highways last weekend. On Sunday about 10:20 p.m., 27-year-old Jody David Single of Brandon was killed after he lost control of the westbound car Mounties believe he was driving on Provincial Road 265, four kilometres west of Polonia and approximately 25 km northwest of Neepawa. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Single and three other males were coming home from a community event in Polonia when their vehicle rolled into the ditch, said Cpl. Colin Friesen of the Neepawa RCMP. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"Accidents are never nice. It was bad, that's why we figured that speed was a factor. The truck was laying on its roof," Friesen said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Single was pronounced dead at the scene, Friesen said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A 45-year-old man from Emerson was killed when his car rolled near Treherne on Saturday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Daniel Vandenbussche was the lone occupant of the vehicle when it caught the shoulder of the road about 10 p.m. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">He lost control and went into the ditch, the vehicle rolled on its roof south of Notre Dame de Lourdes near Provincial Highway 224. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN>

Title: 14-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: TRAIL MUST GO ON, JUDGE RULES
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A man charged in a drunk-driving accident that pinned a Winnipeg woman between two cars will not see his charges dropped because of the three-year delay in bringing them to court, a judge has ruled. Ryan Relleve, 23, was scheduled to go to trial yesterday on charges of impaired driving causing bodily harm, dangerous driving causing bodily harm, leaving the scene of an accident and refusing to provide a breath sample. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">Queen's Bench Justice Deborah McCawley dismissed Nozick's motion for a mistrial, ruling instead that the trial continue today.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 15-Jan-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: TEEN GETS JAIL TIME: Car Thief Sentenced To 18 Months
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">A judge came down hard on a teenage criminal yesterday, sentencing him to 18 months in closed custody for a string of car thefts and robberies. The youth, who can't be named, was convicted of a series of property offences -- including possession of a stolen vehicle, theft, robbery, breaking and entering, and possessing a firearm. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">The charges were laid after a crime spree committed between August and September 2003 where the teen and his cohorts stole cars and used them to commit break-ins and robberies. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <H5 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">POLICE CHIEF <o:p></o:p></SPAN></H5>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt;
