Twice elected as president of the university's student union, he pursued what he describes as a "right-wing" agenda to bring stricter accounting to the union's $5-million budget. He also invited companies such as Starbucks to open shops on campus.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">His changes were controversial, and he fought with the student newspaper. The experience only whetted his appetite for politics, however, and he was named president of the Progressive Conservative Party of Manitoba in 2001.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">"When people get to know me, they tend to forget that I'm in the chair, political friends and enemies alike. That's all I can hope for."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: line; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 22-Feb-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Bus collides with train
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P align=justify>CALGARY -- More than 20 people were taken to hospital yesterday when a tour bus cut into the path of a moving light rail C-Train. The crash happened just after 2 p.m. when witnesses said the driver of a northbound tour bus -- loaded with 22 South Korean passengers -- turned straight into the path of an LRT train. </P>  <P align=justify>"The driver of the C-Train hit the brakes and that wasn't so bad, but when the bus and train collided I saw one older lady fly down the aisle," said Charlene Singh, 25, one of about 20 passengers on the C-Train </P>  <P align=justify>Kevin Johnston, 24, was on his way to the nearby Moxie's restaurant when the collision occurred. </P>  <P align=justify>"I saw the bus turning onto the C-Train track," he said. </P>  <P align=justify>"The train hit its horn then hit (the bus)." </P>  <P align=justify>In all, 23 people were transported to hospital with the most seriously injured patient suffering a broken arm. </P>  <P align=center>-30-</P>

Title: 23-Feb-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Bus hits moose, man dies: Winnipegger Among 23 Injured In Fatal Crash Near Wawa
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, Mb    Free Press    July.02/04    Page B10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P>WAWA, Ont. -- A Greyhound Bus heading for Winnipeg with more than 50 passengers struck a bull moose on a darkened highway early Wednesday morning, sending the bus careening into the ditch, killing one person and injuring several others. </P>  <P>Allen Turner, 74, of Thunder Bay, Ont., was killed in the crash on a treacherous stretch of Highway 17, some 30 kilometres north of the Lake Superior town of Wawa, provincial police said. </P>  <P>Turner was seated several rows behind the driver's seat. </P>  <P>The driver was ejected through the front window, sustaining multiple fractures and significant injuries. </P>  <P>He was initially treated at Lady Dunn Health Center in Wawa along with most of other injured passengers. Four, including an unidentified Winnipegger, were sent to hospitals in Sault Ste. Marie with more severe injuries and the driver was transferred to Sudbury, where he lives. </P>  <P>Another five of the 23 injured passengers were kept in Wawa hospital overnight. Initially, all 54 passengers were sent to the Wawa hospital, an unprecedented number that threw the small hospital's disaster plan into effect. </P>  <P>"We've put it into effect before for other things but we've never had this many patients," said Maria Dupuis, a hospital spokeswoman. Extra staff in all areas were called in, including up to 14 additional nurses and support staff. </P>  <P>Police said the bus hit the moose, crashed into a ditch and rolled over, police said, adding the large bull moose was killed on impact. </P>  <P>"There were a lot of people injured, a lot of people very upset and distraught, some of them a little bit panicky," said Sgt. Steve Smith of the Wawa detachment. </P>  <P>The bus left Ottawa on Tuesday morning and was to make some northern Ontario stops before arriving in Winnipeg, said Lorraine Card, a Greyhound spokeswoman in the Calgary head office. </P>  <P>Card said another bus was immediately dispatched to the scene of the crash to take passengers who were fit to travel to their final destinations. "Obviously our concern is for the well-being of our passengers and our driver," Card said. </P>  <P>The bus company will wait for a report from police before conducting its own internal investigation on the crash, she added.</P>  <P align=center>-30-</P>

Title: 24-Feb-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: In brief: Collision injures seniors
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, Mb    Free Press    July.02/04    Page B10
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P align=justify>THREE seniors were taken to hospital yesterday afternoon after their van collided with a grain truck at an intersection north of Steinbach. RCMP Sgt. Steve Colwell said the minivan was westbound on Highway 311 about 4.5 kilometres east of Highway 12 when it was hit at about 2:45 p.m. by a northbound grain truck on Municipal Road 37 East. </P>  <P>A 62-year-old man and another senior male and female were taken to hospital after the van rolled three times. One is in hospital in Steinbach and the others are in Ste. Anne hospital, all with injuries that are not considered life-threatening. </P>  <P align=center>-30-</P>

Title: 25-Feb-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: good people in this town: These Folks Are Role Models
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P align=justify>Happy Canada Day! This being a day of celebration, let's talk about a couple of the good people in this town and what they're up to at present, beginning with Cameron Adamson, 20. </P>  <P align=justify>Cameron, born without legs, will pass along his expertise by acting as a junior counsellor at the War Amps 2004 Western Child Amputee (CHAMP) Seminar, July 9 to 11 in Saskatoon. He'll be available to Champs and parents to answer questions, give advice, help with sessions and be a role model. </P><B>  <P align=justify>LIFE LIFE TO THE FULLEST </P></B>  <P align=justify>Cameron's main objective will be to show others like him how to live life to the fullest, which Mr. Adamson will have no trouble doing whatsoever. </P>  <P align=justify>Yesterday, I asked him to share a few observations with us regarding life in his situation. </P>  <P align=justify>"Well first, it's not as bad as some might think it would be. Yes, there are some difficulties, particularly with mobility for example, but thanks to programs that War Amps offers, and advancements in technology, things are a lot better than they used to be. </P>  <P align=justify>"Besides, being different can be a very positive thing. It can be an excellent catalyst for making new friends and lead to a lot of interesting experiences. Funny ones, too. </P>  <P align=justify>"Like the time (four years ago), I was sitting atop a washing machine putting soap in and I dropped the scoop into the machine. As I reached for it, I lost my balance and fell in head first. I had to be rescued by friends, who really enjoyed my predicament. </P>  <P align=justify>"Growing up as an amputee truly can be 'character building,' and if you face the challenges with a sense of humour, life is still a lot of fun." </P>  <P align=justify>Cameron is the perfect example of that old saying -- life is what you make it. All the best in Saskatoon, Cam. Pleasure meeting you. </P>  <P align=justify>Next on the agenda today, happy trails to Adele Rygiel, 64, who last week retired after working 20 years as a crossing guard for Wellington School. </P>  <P align=justify>What she'll miss most: "The children, they're wonderful." </P>  <P align=justify>What she'll miss least: "Motorists -- pickup trucks and cab drivers being the worst -- that don't pay attention to either the flashing lights or the flag." Swine. </P>  <P align=justify>A friend of Adele's tells me her crossing guard career is not the whole story. </P>  <P align=justify>"She has been volunteering at the school for 30 years, reading to children, doing call-backs, helping at events, etc. She has also been prominent on the executive of the Burton Cummings Community Club for about the same length of time. She's a terrific person," says the friend. </P>  <P align=justify>Agreed. Well done, Adele. Go to the head of the class. </P>  <P align=justify>There are a million super people in this city folks, this has been two of them. Have a great weekend.</P>  <P align=center>-30-</P>

Title: 26-Feb-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Photo: Greyhound-moose collision fatal
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P>One person died and several of the 50 passengers on board were injured yesterday after a Winnipeg-bound Greyhound bus struck a moose about 30 km north of the northern Ontario community of Wawa and crashed into a ditch.</P>  <P>Allen Turner, 74, of thunder bay, was killed. Turner had been sitting several rows behind the driver, who suffered multiple injuries when he was ejected from the bus through the front window. It was not known if any Winnipeggers were among the injured.</P>  <P align=center>-30-</P>

Title: 27-Feb-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Letter of the day: Better to crash and burn?
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P align=justify>Re: &#8216;No support&#8217; for safe grad (Cary Castagna, June 30).</P>  <P align=justify>I am one of the students who helped plan the very first Murdoch Mackay Safe Grad in 1986. We booked a bus and had a safe place on a farm in Oakbank. Many parents (including mine) volunteered to transport the alcohol in a separate vehicle and provide first aid at the site. It was a great success.</P>  <P align=justify>I&#8217;m sad to see that the community would rather have their kids crash and burn than be safe.</P>  <P align=justify>It&#8217;s also disappointing that Mothers Against Drinking and Driving refuses to support safe grads because of underage drinking. That&#8217;s what kids do at grads, they drink. Refusing to support a safe grad environment is irresponsible. Would they rather have underage drinking in a safe, controlled environment or underage drinking and driving?</P>  <P align=justify>I think the answer is clear. <EM>-- Sheely MacPhail, Vancouver, B.C.</P>  <P align=justify>We just hope everyone got home safely.</P>  <P align=center>-30-</P></EM>

Title: 1-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: BUS HITS MOOSE, MAN DIES: Winnipegger Among 23 Injured In Fatal Crash Near Wawa
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.02/04  Page B10

NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: IN BRIEF: COLLISION INJURES SENIORS

RCMP Sgt. Steve Colwell said the minivan was westbound on Highway 311 about 4.5 kilometres east of Highway 12 when it was hit at about 2:45 p.m. by a northbound grain truck on Municipal Road 37 East. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A 62-year-old man and another senior male and female were taken to hospital after the van rolled three times. Title: 3-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: DEVASTATING BLOW: Crash Kills 3 Members Of St. Laurent Family
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Three members of a St. Laurent family died yesterday when a teenage motorist collided head-on with a car carrying his mother and grandfather. Doreen Boudreau, 37, and her father, Sylvain Boudreau, 60, were taking gasoline to 18-year-old Kevin Boudreau after he phoned to say he was running low while driving home from Winnipeg, family said. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading7 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>VEERED INTO THE LANE <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The Mounties believe the GMC Jimmy, driven by Kevin, veered into the lane of oncoming traffic on Highway 6 and struck his family's Ford Taurus about 3 a.m., one kilometre south of St. Laurent, about 70 km northwest of Winnipeg. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>It's a devastating blow for a tight-knit family who has already experienced significant tragedy. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>In April 2002, another of Doreen's sons, 17-year-old Craig Boudreau, was killed along with three friends when their vehicle veered off the road and slammed into a culvert near Highway 6, north of St. Laurent. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"To go through the same thing again -- it's very hard," said June McKay, a cousin to Doreen and niece to Sylvain. "Everyone's shocked. What are the odds of that happening." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The impact of the crash set the SUV ablaze. The flames were too hot for emergency personnel to approach the vehicle, police said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>An autopsy scheduled for today is expected to officially confirm Kevin as the third victim. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"He was a very happy man, always smiling," recalled June, who also lost a 23-year-old cousin, Paul McKay, in the horrific collision in 2002. "(Kevin) was just like his grandpa." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Sylvain worked in construction and two years ago celebrated his 40th wedding anniversary. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"He was a good family man," June said. "He was ready to help anyone." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>His daughter, Doreen, will be remembered as a friendly woman who was well-liked within the community. A former worker at a fish plant, Doreen is survived by a husband and two children -- nine-year-old Lucas and 11-year-old Janice. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I don't think it's registered yet. They're both so young," June said. "Her husband is going to miss her dearly." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The family is taking some solace knowing their lost loved ones are reunited. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Now they're all together," June told The Sun. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A traffic analyst was at the scene but the investigation into the cause of the fatal collision is ongoing, said West Interlake RCMP Cpl. Bob Chabot. "It's quite a sad story," he said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It gives me shivers just thinking about it." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 4-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LETTERS TO THE EDITOR: Motorcycle Owners Face MPI Roadblocks
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.05/04  Page A11
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Unbelievable! <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Manitoba Public Insurance (MPI) is yet again calling for an increase in motorcycle insurance rates. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Ever since I was a little girl I have dreamed of owning my own motorcycle. After being a stay-at-home mom for over 15 years, I decided to set a goal for myself. Before I reach 40, I will own my own motorcycle. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Through hard work I was able to purchase my first bike two years ago for $1,800 when I was 39. I now own a 1983 Honda Shadow 500. It's not a Harley, it's certainly far from new but it's in great shape and gives me the sense of freedom, thrill of riding and the wind in my face that I have longed for. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>To fully insure my 1983 Honda Shadow 500 costs me $1,000 per year. That's right $1,000 every year for a bike that I purchased for $1,800. To add to my frustration, this summer's potential riding days have been significantly reduced due to unseasonably cold and wet weather. I would love to ride my bike to work but the road conditions on my path are atrocious. My bike and I could be swallowed by a pothole. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>There are other men and women just like me. We work hard, pay our taxes, do all the things we're supposed to do and for fun own a motorcycle. However, this year I have heard from more and more riders that because of soaring insurance costs they are selling their bikes. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>All over the world, motorcycle use is standard transportation. People use it to go to work, school and run errands. Instead of MPI encouraging motorcycle use in our province, they grossly neglect these benefits: <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>* Economical and fuel efficient. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>* Reduces green house gasses. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>* Easier to park downtown. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>MPI continues to hammer us with exorbitant increases, using the excuse that we are already being subsidized by car owners. Instead of encouraging people to buy bikes and enjoy the above benefits, they are discouraging their use. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>When will MPI wake up and smell the coffee. There are more people in the 30+ age category who would like to own bikes for transportation and pleasure, but MPI is intent on making bike ownership a perk for the rich. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>BETSY HIEBERT, </FONT></SPAN><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Winnipeg<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 5-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: FLETCHER HAS ROLE 'TO BREAK DOWN BARRIERS'
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.05/04  Page B1/B2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>FOUR years before Steven Fletcher made history as Canada's first quadriplegic MP, U.S. Rep. Jim Langevin established a similar milestone in Congress. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Langevin, a Rhode Island Democrat who was paralyzed as a result of a firearms accident at age 16, said on the weekend he was excited to hear about Fletcher's election. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Steven will raise consciousness about the challenges that people with disabilities face, just by his position," Langevin said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It will open up doors and inspire other people to pursue their goals and dreams as well." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher, 32, of Winnipeg, who is paralyzed from the neck down as a result of a car collision with a moose, was elected the Conservative MP for Charleswood-St. James in last Monday's general election. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Langevin, 40, was elected to Congress in 2000 after serving in the state House and as Rhode Island's secretary of state. Though the U.S. Capitol was considered wheelchair-friendly when Langevin arrived, his presence has spurred numerous changes. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>New voting stations were built in the House of Representatives because Langevin could not access the existing ones. Until a new speaking area was built, Langevin had to address the house from beside the lectern. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>And more still needs to be done, Langevin said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Getting out of my own office door, I have automatic door openers now," he said. "I'd like to see automatic openers on the doors of every member of Congress." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher has cited similar issues with the House of Commons, such as stairs he can't climb and an elevator too small for his motorized wheelchair. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Like Fletcher, Langevin said he does not draw attention to his disability but is proud to serve as a role model. "The way to combat being a stereotype is to be yourself and to pursue those interests that you want to pursue -- it doesn't have to be disability issues," Langevin said. "I don't want to just be the poster child for disability issues, but I also recognize that I have a responsibility, and I believe Steven has, to break down barriers and open up doors for others. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It will be an important part of what he does."<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 6-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: HE'S BREAKING BARRIERS: Canada's First Quadriplegic MP Energizes Hopes Of Disabled
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.04/04  Page A1/A2
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>STEVEN Fletcher still hasn't taken his seat in the House of Commons, but he's already made an impact. As Canada's first quadriplegic MP, the 32-year-old Winnipeg man has gained national media attention and energized the hopes of the disabled community. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>He's also spurring changes inside Parliament, where the buildings are 75 to 140 years old and not as accessible as one might expect of the nation's premier public forum. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher, a Tory who defeated former mayor Glen Murray in one of the country's most competitive contests, says his 1996 car collision with a moose that left him paralysed from the neck down affected more than the way he will physically enter the House of Commons. It also changed his politics. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Before my accident... I didn't give the less fortunate any consideration," Fletcher said. Today, "I'm definitely a compassionate conservative." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>At the time of the crash, Fletcher was a two-time Manitoba kayaking champion who had recently become president of the Manitoba Recreational Canoeing Association. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>He had also founded the University of Manitoba chapter of the Manitoba Naturalists Society. "My goal was to walk away," said Fletcher, now the MP for Charleswood-St. James. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I was going to be the first person in the history of mankind to recover from a severe spinal cord injury. There was no way I was going to spend the rest of my life in this situation." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Before long, he reassessed that goal as unrealistic in the short term. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I made the decision to use what I have," he said. "What's important is from the neck up." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>By demonstrating that seemingly obvious but frequently overlooked fact, Fletcher has already made a huge stride for the disabled, advocates say. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"The time is right for someone like Steven to come forward and show what they can do," said Valerie Ravary, chief executive officer of the Canadian Paraplegic Association in Ottawa. Traci Walters, national director of the Canadian Association of Independent Living Centres, said Fletcher will help open Canadians' eyes. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Society in general thinks of us people with disabilities as not being seen and as people who have to be taken care of," Walters said yesterday. "We don't have to be taken care of and we can contribute." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>One of Fletcher's more immediate impacts will be on the House of Commons itself, which has narrow aisles and stairs in and around it. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Walters, who uses a wheelchair and is a frequent visitor to the public gallery, said she's often looked down on the MPs' area and wondered what would happen once someone like Fletcher was elected. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>There are doors Fletcher can't open and elevators too small for his motorized wheelchair. And Fletcher, who needs help to cough, swat a mosquito, or turn the page of a government report, will need an aide by his side in a departure from normal House procedure. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Instead of 308, "there will be 309 seats in the House -- but I bring my own seat," Fletcher said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>House Speaker Peter Milliken looks forward to meeting with Fletcher and will make sure his needs are met, Milliken's spokeswoman, Heather Bradley, said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Our mandate is to serve the members that are elected by Canadians," Bradley said. "We'll assess his needs and we will accommodate him." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher, who ran on improving the health-care system, greater government accountability and increasing access to post-secondary education, doesn't want to be known as the quadriplegic MP. But he doesn't shrink from his role as a breaker of barriers. "If my personal situation creates awareness and improves the situation for really what will be millions of others, wow, what an honour," he said. "Let's lay the foundation so we'll see people in wheelchairs contributing... and it's natural." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Provencher Conservative MP Vic Toews, who knows the rookie MP from Fletcher's earlier role as head of the provincial Tories, said Fletcher asks him for advice but doesn't always take it. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"He's a remarkable individual," Toews said. "There is a determination in him, a fire in him, that drives him." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher said he still can't talk about everything he experienced after his accident and the day when he can may never come. Unsure about his prognosis and unable to move or communicate except through eye movements, "it was a terrifying time." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>As his recovery progressed, many health-care professionals impressed him. At the same time, "quite frankly, there are some people in the medical system who shouldn't be there." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>His experience heightened his compassion, he said. "The accident was no fault of my own, but I found myself in need of assistance," he said. The same applies to many others and, "we should as a society do what we can to help those people." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher credits his parents, Dave and Joanne Fletcher, his brother, Gordon, and his sister, Julia, for helping him move from a hospital bed to the House of Commons. "Even in the darkest days, their love was unconditional and their hope was unfailing." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>What's next? "I hope we can get a prime minister," said Ravary of the Canadian Paraplegic Association. "Maybe Steven is going to lead the way and he'll run for the head of his party at some point." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Fletcher wouldn't bite, saying his political ambition is to serve his constituents under Stephen Harper as prime minister. Aside from that, "truly and to the core of my being, my ultimate ambition is to be a husband and a father," Fletcher said. "If I can be one-millionth the father that my father is to me and my siblings I will consider myself a success. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"The best title a man can have is "Dad."<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><A href="mailto:Paul.egan@freepress.mb.ca"><FONT face=Verdana>Paul.egan@freepress.mb.ca</FONT></A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 7-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: PRIVATELY RUN MOTORSPORT PARK AN OPTION: REPORT
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.04/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>THE city can't build a $6-million cruising park itself, but could work with private investors, according to a city report meant to help solve the Sunday night gridlock on Portage Avenue. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>City parks staff, asked to research the idea, ruled out building a city-run motorsport park mostly because similar facilities in Calgary and Saskatoon are run by private companies instead of the municipal government. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>But staff said the city could lease surplus land to private entrepreneurs willing to build and run a cruising park. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The park could have a drag-racing strip, bleachers, a canteen, a display area for "show and shines" and a two-lane perimeter road through a recreational park for cruising. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The cost for such a park is about $6.6 million. It could be located at any one of 13 sites on the city's outskirts, according to the report. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Councillors such as Harvey Smith, whose West End ward is plagued by Sunday night cruising, have been pushing for a solution to the problem for months. "It's easy to say no, but what we should be doing is reaching out to the private sector," said Smith. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The report will be debated at Tuesday's public works committee meeting.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><A href="mailto:Maryagnes.welch@freepress.mb.ca"><FONT face=Verdana>Maryagnes.welch@freepress.mb.ca</FONT></A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 8-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CRUISING SOLUTION?: Motorsport Park Idea Floated To Take The Heat Off The Streets
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>City officials are opening a door for a possible cruising park to take off with a two-lane racing strip, bleachers for a crowd of 900, a spotter's booth, sound system, cycling paths and picnic facilities. All these features -- not to mention a "burnout" area for very hot tires -- will soon be en route to Winnipeg if Coun. Harvey Smith and private-sector operators are allowed to take the driver's seat. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Smith and Bill Ward, operator of a St. Andrews vehicle test centre, are convinced that such a motorsport park could surge ahead with the help of Larry Niebel, former operator of Victory Lane Speedway. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading7 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>ACCELERATING <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Ward and Smith (Daniel McIntyre) are in talks with Niebel in hopes of establishing a racing and cruising site to pull problem motorists off public streets and into a safe place. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The planning is accelerating, Ward says. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I do know there have been some very positive responses to this," he said yesterday after the city released a report on amenities and safeguards any such park would need. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Though a municipally operated motorsport park has been widely proposed as a way to put the brakes on summer cruising dangers and congestion, public works officials are recommending the city stay off that road. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Councillors next week will weigh an option for the city to sell or lease property to a private operator. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Smith confirmed he's been helping investigate the potential for an isolated cruising zone since the recent byelection campaign. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"They've developed a proposal, and were to go ahead and contact the candidates running for mayor to give them a heads-up," he said of Niebel, who couldn't be reached for comment. "I want to see whether the figures are reliable." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>An administrative report lists 13 potential sites and outlines suggested features in a complex that would cost $6.6 million to build. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Rob Zanewich of the public works department said he "can't really comment" on whether a private proposal has been submitted. He noted that Calgary, Saskatoon and San Diego, Calif., have designated cruising and racing zones run largely by private interests. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It certainly has been done before. We're not breaking new ground here. And we're putting it up for ideas," Zanewich added. "We thought this may be another option to get the racing off the streets, and the police department would certainly like to see that happen." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Ward claimed that planning for a race park is further along than the city is suggesting. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Niebel told The Sun in June that he could develop a complex with an oval of one-third of a mile, a quarter-mile drag strip and other features at any of three proposed locations for $7.7 million if governments cover half its costs. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"The city isn't about to jump on this idea," said Bob Chubala, head of the Manitoba Association of Auto Clubs. "He's got to have people on board with serious money." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Mayor Sam Katz acknowledged the frustration caused by cruising, but suggested the city should find a way to please all sides.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 9-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: MANITOBA BRIEFS: DRUNK DRIVERS STUMP POLICE
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Brandon police were more than puzzled when three people were charged with impaired driving over a 12-hour period Thursday and Friday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"With all the publicity about traffic enforcement, you have to wonder," said Sgt. Ed Riglin. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A 23-year-old resident of Biggar, Sask., is charged with three counts of impaired driving causing injury, one count of impaired driving, and one count of refusing a breathalyser. He was released on bail yesterday. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The charges stem from a collision at 1:58 a.m. yesterday that sent three people to Brandon Regional Health Centre with serious, but non life-threatening injuries, said Riglin. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Another impaired driver was arrested at 10 a.m. Friday, Riglin added. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Statistics won't be available until at least Wednesday, but the RCMP crackdown on speeders and the non-use of seatbelts will continue through tomorrow, said Sgt. Steve Colwell.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 10-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CANADA BRIEFS: SIX KILLED IN SASK. CASH
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Cochin, Sask. &#8211; A rear-end collision that caused a chain-reaction highway crash involing five vehicles killed six people and injured several others in Saskatchewan on Thursday.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>RCMP said three cars were stopped at a T-type intersection on a highway waiting to make a left-hand turn into the town of Cochin, northwest of Saskatoon, when a fourth car hit the last car from behind. The fourth car then went into the oncoming traffic and was hit by a pickup truck.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>&#8220;There were multiple fatalities in multiple vehicles,&#8221; said RCMP spokesman CPL. Brian Jones. &#8220;It is not a good situation.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 11-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: SIX DIE IN MULTIPLE VEHICLE CRASH ON SASKATCHEWAN HIGHWAY
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Winnipeg, MB  Free Press  July.03/04  Page A13
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>COCHIN, Sask. -- A rear-end collision that caused a chain-reaction highway crash involving five vehicles killed six people and injured several others in northwestern Saskatchewan on Thursday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>RCMP said three northbound cars were stopped at a T-type intersection on Highway 4 waiting to make a left-hand turn into the town of Cochin when a fourth car hit the last car from behind. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The fourth car then went into the oncoming traffic in the southbound lane and was hit by a pickup truck. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"There were multiple fatalities in multiple vehicles," said RCMP spokesman Cpl. Brian Jones. "It is not a good situation." He said it was too early to say whether charges would be laid. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Any time there's a number of vehicles it will take a period of time to attempt to interview as many people as we can that were in the vehicles as well as any vehicles that may have been travelling in the area at the time," he said. "Unfortunately, with the number of injured and deceased in this crash, it will be a complicated matter." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>No names were released, but Jones said two of the dead were 20- and 24-year-old Saskatoon women who had been in the third car stopped at the intersection. The other four victims were all from the Cochin district, about 145 kilometres northwest of Saskatoon. They included men aged 48 and 42 and women aged 19 and 25. All four were passengers in the vehicle that collided with the Saskatoon women's car and started the chain <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>reaction crash. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The 35-year old female driver of the vehicle was among a total of nine people taken to hospital. Seven were treated and released, and two remained in hospital Friday. The injured were from North Battleford, Saskatoon and the Cochin district. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Highway 4 is a paved road with single north and south lanes. The crash occurred at the south end of Cochin, in a transition speed zone with the speed limit posted at 80 kilometres per hour. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Road and weather conditions were good when the crash happened at noon.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 12-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: VIOLENT CRIME FALLING IN CITY: But Home Invasions, Vehicle Thefts On Rise
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.03/04  Page B3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>FEWER violent crimes were committed in the city in 2003 compared with the previous year, but homes and vehicles were still prime targets for Winnipeg criminals. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>City police report more than 8,300 crimes were committed against persons -- the bulk of which were assaults. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>That's an overall drop of five per cent from the 2002 crime statistics -- a comparison found in the Winnipeg Police Service's annual report, released this week. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>However, break and enters jumped 13 per cent (873) to more than 7,600, while vehicle theft went up nine per cent (812) to about 10,100 incidents. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Chief Jack Ewatski said he was disappointed with those numbers. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I'm disappointed because property crime, auto theft and break and enters are very preventable," said Ewatski, who stressed the importance of anti-theft devices for vehicles. "We need to send the message loud and clear to our citizens that you can take steps to prevent those types of crimes. "When we look at statistics relative to the <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>use of (home) alarms, last year less than two per cent of homes broken into were ones that had alarms. That in itself speaks volumes of the deterrent effect of the use of residential burglar alarms." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Overall, crimes against property, including break and enters, auto theft, fraud, arson and mischief, were up 16 per cent last year. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>There were more than 60,000 of those crimes committed. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Meanwhile, 18 murders were committed last year, three fewer than in 2002, while the number of attempted murders dropped from 10 to eight. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The number of assaults in the city dropped by more than 550, or nine per cent, but still totalled nearly 6,000. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>About 2,800 people were charged with domestic assault, about 425 fewer than the previous year. "I am pleased those numbers are down, and I see that trend continuing," Ewatski said. "Society is realizing that domestic violence is something that will not be tolerated." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><A href="mailto:jason.bell@freepress.mb.ca"><FONT face=Verdana>jason.bell@freepress.mb.ca</FONT></A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 13-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: VANDALS SHATTER WINDOWS, PEACE: Fort Richmond Residents Suffer 'Senseless' Acts
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.03/04  Page B4
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>THE main thing on Jenica Lang's mind yesterday morning was her upcoming linear algebra exam -- but that was before she saw the basketball-sized rock that had gone through her car's rear window. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"My first thought was, why today?" said the 19-year-old. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Lang's father was driving the University of Manitoba student to her exam in his car when they noticed the back window of her '92 Ford Tempo was smashed. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"The rock is still sitting there," she said. "It's huge." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Lang said the car, her first, is essential for her to go back and forth between her two jobs and university classes. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It's not too good," she said. "I need it to get around." Lang's Fort Richmond home was one of three in the area that was hit by vandalism between Thursday night and yesterday morning. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>On a nearby street, 19-year-old Katelyn Blais woke up at 2:30 a.m. to the sound of her car window breaking. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Her father, Eric Blais, said bricks from the garden had been hurled at the car's windows. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"They took four of them and tried to put one through each of the side windows," he said. "They smashed one, scratched two windows, and then missed on one and sort of dented the car and scratched the trim." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Eric said he already paid $350 to replace the smashed window, and estimates the total cost to repair the car will be at least $1,200. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>He described the damage as "completely senseless." "It wasn't even as if they'd stolen anything," he said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>On Vassard Road, Margaretha van Oers woke up yesterday to find her living room full of glass, and a brick tangled in the curtains. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It shattered a big window, causing a lot of damage," she said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Both van Oers and Eric Blais were worried about the motives behind the vandalism. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"It's always frightening," said Eric. "The randomness is bad enough, but to think that somebody might be targeting you is even worse." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>All three attacks were reported to the police, but there was no word yesterday on possible suspects.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><A href="mailto:Lindsey.wiebe@freepress.mb.ca"><FONT face=Verdana>Lindsey.wiebe@freepress.mb.ca</FONT></A><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 14-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: SIZING UP SMART: It Looks Funky And It’s Being Hyped To The Hilt. But How Well Does The Mercedes-Benz Mirco Car Fare In Real Life?
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Financial Post  July.03/04  Page IN1/IN3
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>As the price of gasoline creeps ever closer to that $1-a-litre benchmark -- and trust us, in the not-too-distant future, you are going to fondly look back upon the days when gas was priced at "just" a buck a litre -- a beleaguered commuter faces but two alternatives. Option No. 1 is to endlessly kvetch about petrol prices while filling the voluminous tank of your Fat Bastard SUV. Or you can consider option No. 2: downsizing.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>On this point, there is some good news for those who embrace the mantra that less is indeed more: in the months to come, Canadians will be able to choose from a selection of so-called "micro cars" that are headed our way -- vehicles that are so diminutive they make subcompacts look like stretch limos.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The first micro to arrive on Canadian shores will be the Smart Car from Mercedes, available in September. Timing is everything, and given the mounting costs associated with running a vehicle these days, the Smart Car, which is priced at a mere $16,000 for the coupe and just under $20,000 for the convertible, will undoubtedly be a huge hit.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"From a consumer point of view, the Smart Car really is smart," says Dennis DesRosiers of Richmond Hill, Ont.-based DesRosiers Automotive Consultants. "It's a miser on fuel, it's a miser to repair.
