Mr. Levert is the president of the New Brunswick Senior Citizens Council, which has been fighting for public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> in New Brunswick. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The June 29 decision to retain private insurance with new legislation aimed at reducing rates and increasing choice, announced by Premier Bernard Lord's Progressive Conservative government, was not what Mr. Levert wanted to hear. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"This government has sold us down the river and really, really, missed the point...they still don't have the message. They have made a mockery out of the <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> file." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Mr. Levert says the government had appointed two committees on two separate occasions and spent thousands of dollars to go around the province, and then ignored the findings of the Select Committee on Public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">Automobile</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">Insurance</SPAN></B>. The committee, chaired by New Democratic Party leader Elizabeth Weir, released its report in favour of a public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> system in April. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"...And he (Premier Lord) has led the people of this province to believe that he was serious about public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">automobile</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B>," said Mr. Levert. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Drivers, he said, are being discriminated against within the borders of New Brunswick--not because of accidents and not because of claims, but rather for age. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"It is total discrimination for the young drivers aged 16 to 25...because they fall into an age category. Or they are not married." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>And the no frills system policy option offered by insurance companies in the province as a more affordable choice for drivers would open the door to a welfare system, said Mr. Levert. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"Anyone who is injured in an accident has no safety net, no income. This insurance in no insurance." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The next step in getting the message to the government, Mr. Levert says, is forming coalitions with different groups and organizations and putting up resistance over any issue the government is dealing with. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"We are not about to accept this. We are not going to lay down now. We are going to full speed ahead and are going to bring a message to (Premier) Lord. He will regret that he has ever misled the people the way he has in the last two-and-a-half years," concluded Mr. Levert. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> reforms introduced in legislature on June 29 are expected to be implemented in January. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>They include a first-chance insurance discount allowing first-time drivers to access coverage as long as they remain accident free, the no-frills policy option, a new New Brunswick Insurance Board to review rates and a consumer advocate office. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Also, new regulations in the reform package includes making driving history and experience the primary factor in determining insurance premiums. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Also proposed are tighter rules for new young drivers and increased power for law enforcement officers to immediately impound vehicles of motorists without proper insurance coverage. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>In a press release on June 29, Premier Lord stated that after reviewing the work of the Select Committee on public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B>, the right road was not a government-run monopoly. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"The reforms we have presented here today, building upon the work of the two Select Committees will result in stable insurance rates for all New Brunswickers for many years to come," said Lord in the statement. </FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 26-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: "What did you think of the province's decision to keep auto insurance in private hands?"
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Street Beat  The Northern Light (Bathurst)   Wed 07 Jul 2004   Page: A4   Section: Editorial   Byline: Amey morris and gregory delaney   Source: Northern Light
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>ALYRE LAGACE <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Beresford <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>I'm not glad about the decision, but I'm also not against it. There were good and bad things about public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B>. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>LUC POIRIER <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Beresford <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Personally, I trust Bernard Lord that he is trying to do his best. You can't please everyone. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>PIERRE OUELLET <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Beresford <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>It's the right decision. At the end of the day, taxpayers would have ended up paying the bill. N.B. is too small to support this kind of system. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>DAWN OUELLETTE <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Bathurst <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>I never really had a problem with my private <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">automobile</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> provider so I never followed what was going on too closely. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>EVELYN FOURNIER <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Bathurst <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>I say it is good. I didn't like the idea of public insurance because right now I am paying less then what I would with public insurance. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>ANDREW WHITE <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Bathurst <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Either way we are going to have to pay for our insurance so I just hope they decided on the best way for drivers in New Brunswick. </FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 27-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: The careful driver: Or, how to insure a car without toppling the government
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: See Magazine   Thu 24 Jun 2004   Page: 9   Section: News   Byline: Lech Linkiel   Source: See Magazine
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>While a Chilean court has stripped General Augusto Pinochet Ugarte of the immunity from prosecution he had bestowed upon himself, the University of Athabasca has patted our Premier on the back and cleared him of any wrongdoing with regards to his paper on that other right-winger's coup. So the road is clear for a trial of the 88-year old former dictator on at least 130 different charges brought against his bloody regime, but the Premier of Alberta can't be fingered for attempting a crude analogy. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>In the ensuing kerfuffle about whether the Premier cheats or not, the item that set the ball in motion in the first place has gone missing in action. Now, I know there's all this talk about all the various upcoming elections, but doesn't the rather ludicrous notion that public ownership and public delivery can irritate social conservatives to such a degree that a military coup d'etat would be inevitable scare you even more? <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>You see, if the Premier is right, then Regina or, say, Victoria--or any other capital of a province with public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">car</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B>--should be ripe for a bloody military coup any day now. Not to mention the regime of terror that surely must be waiting just around the corner for a tiny monarchy like Sweden, where social democratic governments have dominated politics--pretty much uninterrupted--since the '30s. Oh, the horror! The horror! <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Strangely enough the population of this Scandinavian democracy doesn't seem particularly terrified of where their folly is taking them. Without so much as a wince, Swedes accept 25 days' paid holiday annually, 450 days of parents' allowance, child allowance for all children up to 16 years of age, free instruction at universities and other institutions of higher learning, free school lunches, and universal health care. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>They don't even refrain from bandying about how much of their society's assets are owned publicly, and continue to shower the world with Volvos, SAABs, IKEA, world-class hockey-players, musicians, and various ideas of how to create a society that is a "Home to All," without great social and economic differences. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>All the while, the only truly extreme event Swedes have had to cope with in the recent past was the assassination of Social Democratic Prime Minister Olof Palme. The Trudeau of Sweden was shot in Stockholm one evening as he walked home from the cinema. But his murder can hardly be described as having political motives; eighteen years after the fact, the guilty party has yet to claim responsibility. Meanwhile, the Social Democrats keep governing. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Maybe Swedes are simply better at suppressing the extreme, conservative, fascist urge that no doubt lurks beneath their demure, soft-spoken facade. Maybe they've simply managed to steer clear of generous US military aid to a higher degree than Chileans. Maybe they're just too busy paying taxes through their noses to actually mount a coup. Maybe they've been able to live in a socialist haven simply because theirs is a country much smaller and a lot more homogeneous than Canada. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Or maybe Alberta's Premier just hasn't got a clue. After all, he did seriously suggest that public delivery would pose an ideological threat of such magnitude that it would leave insurance companies no option other than to call an air strike on the Legislature. A nifty science fiction scenario, for sure. But we're not dealing with a paradigm-shattering clash of ideas here; we're talking affordable, basic, bloody <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">car</SPAN></B>-<B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B>. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>On the other hand, perhaps the Premier is merely trying to avoid walking home from the cinema one night, and finding himself in the shoes of Olof Palme. Perhaps he's just trying to avoid enraging the conservative minority--the just over 30% of all Albertans--who actually elected him. They might just get so cross with Ralph re-establishing socialist ideas in this province, they'll put an insurance cap in his ass. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US">But you know what, Mr. Premier? Your worries are exaggerated. There're plenty of Albertans who would rather take a bullet for the Premier who gave them affordable <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">car</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B>--among other things--than for one who, despite there being no supporting evidence, insists on the superiority of private delivery. </SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 28-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Province defends delay in auto insurance cut; blame administrative backlog
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: Woodstock Sentinel-Review   Tue 06 Jul 2004   Page: 11   Section: News   Byline: BY CP
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The Ontario government is defending a delay in cutting <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> rates, blaming an administrative backlog in processing insurance company rate filings. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The Liberals said Monday all new rates will be approved by July 15 -- three months after the April 15 date they initially set for lower rates to take effect. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"It will take some time for people to see those, but already as of April 15 people are seeing decreases in their rates, and we're continuing to work to bring in other reforms so we can continue to see rates go down," said Diane Flanagan, spokeswoman for Finance Minister Greg Sorbara, who is on vacation. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>When the Ontario government was sworn in last Oct. 23, Premier Dalton McGuinty immediately froze insurance rates for 90 days, promising that rates would fall on average by 10 per cent when insurers filed new rates on Jan. 23 as the government required. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>But that was the first time all of the province's 61 insurance companies filed rate changes at once, which resulted in a mass of paperwork, and many of the filings were complex, Flanagan said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"Some of the filings were more complicated than the Financial Services Commission of Ontario expected," she said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>More staff were hired through an actuarial firm to process the documents, Flanagan added. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Rate decreases averaging about 10 per cent were approved April 15 by the government for firms representing 55 per cent of Ontario's <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> market. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>However, the remaining 45 per cent of the market won't get approval to drop rates until July 15. Approval must be granted before customers of those companies see rate decreases, and only when they get their renewals. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Mark Yakabuski, Ontario vice-president of the Insurance Bureau of Canada, said most insurers have already begun to factor in those lower rates as they send out renewals. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"Those approvals, in most cases have already taken place," he said. "The quarterly publication of new rates that have been approved in the last quarter won't come out until July 15, but many of those will already be in effect." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Yakabuski said that in November, the average <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> premium was $1,488, but that fell to $1,389 by April -- a decline of close to seven per cent. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The reforms have also led to rising competition in the <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> market, meaning more options and lower rates for consumers, he said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>However, not all consumers will see lower rates. Some rate hikes were already approved last September by the previous Tory government, and any rate cuts would be applied to those earlier increases, Flanagan said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"People are very frustrated," said Mark Arsenault, director of public and government affairs at the Canadian Automobile Association. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>"What's happening is some people might not see a rate decrease for a year or longer period depending on when the company's decrease was approved and when they submitted for their insurance renewal." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>&#8226; NOT SO FUNNY: Premier Dalton McGuinty and Finance Minister Greg Sorbara froze insurance rates for 90 days immediately after being sworn in and promised that rates would fall on average by 10 per cent. That rate cut has been delayed.</FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>-30-</FONT></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 29-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Pause for Thought
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: The Calgary Herald   Wed 07 Jul 2004   Page: A10   Section: Opinion   Source: Calgary Herald
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>&#8220;Public <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B> <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> could save Albertans so much more than the government's feeble plan.&#8221; <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Liberal Leader Kevin Taft.</EM> </FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial><o:p>-30-</o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 30-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: Insurance cuts hit a roadblock
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: The Ottawa Citizen   Wed 07 Jul 2004   Page: B4   Section: City   Page Name: City Editorial   Source: The Ottawa Citizen
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Last fall, the newly elected provincial Liberals ordered auto insurers to cut their rates promptly, on the grounds that they weren't doing it fast enough on their own. Then the government failed to process half the companies' paperwork for six months. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Diane Flanagan, a spokeswoman for Finance Minister Greg Sorbara, says the government regulates <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">car</SPAN></B>-<B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> prices to make sure they don't soar out of control. Which had started to happen, according to both the Liberals and their Progressive Conservative predecessors. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Many factors have contributed, including richer and richer claims for post-accident treatment such as physiotherapy and for the pain caused by so-called soft-tissue injuries, such as whiplash. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Both parties tried to reduce what insurers have to pay out after car accidents. One of about three dozen changes was increasing the insurance deductible for pain-and-suffering compensation from $15,000 to $30,000; another was limiting reimbursable towing fees to $300 outside the North. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>The Liberals figured the various changes should have resulted in average rate cuts of at least 10 per cent. Because the insurance companies couldn't be trusted to work it out for themselves, the government ordered the insurers to cut their prices that much. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>But because of the province's own rules, the cuts couldn't take effect until the companies had filed the requisite paperwork and the Financial Services Commission of Ontario had approved them. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>According to commission documents, its staff normally approve 25 to 30 rate filings each quarter. But under the Liberals' orders, all 61 companies doing business in Ontario had to file their new rates by the first-quarter deadline Jan. 23. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>How many of those filings did the commission churn through in time to get the new rates into effect by April? A typical 31, representing 55 per cent of the <B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">auto</SPAN></B>-<B><SPAN style="COLOR: #000066">insurance</SPAN></B> market. Ms. Flanagan says the commission hired a bunch of actuarial temps for the extra work, but not enough. The other companies' new rates won't kick in until the middle of this month. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>And even then, consumers won't see any difference until they renew their policies. So if you have insurance with one of the companies whose filings didn't get processed last winter and you renewed your policy this week, you won't see the effect until July 2005, despite the Liberals' promise to get rates cut within 90 days of their taking office last October. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 5pt 0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT face=Arial>Never mind the question of why the 61 insurers can't just compete the way other businesses do. Given the rule change, the financial-services commission should have had enough staff to process the documents the government demanded. More fundamentally, if the consumer-protecting financial-services commission didn't have the market control it does, Ontario drivers could have had their premiums cut quickly, rather than waiting for the government to approve its own price cuts. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US">Let's hope the Liberals figure out soon what kind of government they're going to be, because this fiasco shows the worst of both left-wing and right-wing thinking: close regulation of private industry coupled with a lean government that isn't up to actually doing the regulating. </SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 31-Mar-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: PHOTO: HANG TIME
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The bumper of a car hangs from another vehicle following an accident yesterday on Highway 9, eight kilometres north of the Perimeter Highway. Emergency personnel (inset) treat a man at the scene &#8211; who sustained minor injuries and was the only person who was hurt in the accident.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 1-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: RESIDENTS SUPPORT GRIEVING FAMILY
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Three wooden crosses mark the site where a St. Laurent family lost members from three generations in one fatal head-on collision on the weekend. The tight-knit community northwest of Winnipeg has been quick to comfort the Boudreau family who are grieving the deaths of Sylvain, 50, his daughter, Doreen, 37, and her 18-year-old son, Kevin. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">'READY TO HELP' <o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The teenager was behind the wheel of an SUV that veered into oncoming traffic on Highway 6 and struck a car carrying his mother and grandfather, just south of St. Laurent early Sunday morning. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"Whatever they need the community is definitely ready to help," said Hugh Sigurdson, a school principal shaken by the second tragedy to strike the family in as many years. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"It's beyond belief at first ... There's just concern for the remaining members of the family that they would be able to handle this only two years after losing Craig." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Another of Doreen's sons, Craig Boudreau, 17, was killed along with three friends when their vehicle slammed into a culvert on the same highway in 2002. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Kevin was a strong support for his mother when his brother died, Sigurdson said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"It was so hard on her," he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Kevin dropped out of high school in Grade 11 but joined in on the celebration at graduation a couple of weeks ago. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Sigurdson said the teenager was always more interested in the trades and would have likely followed in his grandfather's footsteps and pursued carpentry. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"He was happy, always happy," Sigurdson said. "Even though he didn't graduate he was still the life of the party." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The vehicle that Kevin was driving was a gift from his mother. He had only owned the GMC Jimmy for a couple of days. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The Mounties are trying to figure out what caused Kevin to veer out of his lane. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">RCMP Cpl. Bob Chabot said the autopsy, including a toxicology test, was rescheduled for today. "But we may not ever know why," Chabot said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Kevin was stopped by police during a check-stop in Winnipeg and was allowed to proceed, indicating the teenager was not impaired, a source said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">His mom and grandpa were en route to bring him gas after he feared he would run out driving back from Winnipeg. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Area residents are speculating strong winds might have played a role or Kevin could have fallen asleep at the wheel.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 2-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: LOCAL BRIEFS: CAR THIEVES ATTEMPT TO RAM CRUISER
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Two men in a stolen car tried to ram a police cruiser while they were being chased, cops say.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The pair from Sandy Bay First Nation, about 165 kilometres northwest of Winnipeg, were arrested by officers of the Dakota Ojibway Police Service when their car stalled during the pursuit, police said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Joseph Ryan McIvor, 21, and Bradley Robert Richard, 19, have been charged with various offences.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 3-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: 3 FAMILY MEMBERS DIE IN BIZARRE CRASH
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: WINNIPEG, MB  Free Press  July.06/04  Page A6
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">GRIEVING family and friends were making funeral plans yesterday for three family members from St. Laurent who were killed in a bizarre crash early Sunday. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The two-vehicle crash on Highway 6, one kilometre south of St. Laurent, killed an 18-year-old man in one vehicle and his mother and grandfather in the second vehicle. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The RCMP were awaiting an autopsy today before positively identifying one of the victims. But family members said the dead are: Kevin Boudreau, 18; his mother Doreen Boudreau, 37; and her father Sylvain Boudreau, 60. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">RCMP Cpl. Bob Chabot said Kevin Boudreau was returning from Winnipeg in a GMC Jimmy and had called ahead to tell his mother he was running out of gas. Doreen Boudreau and her father Sylvain Boudreau were bringing gasoline in the family's Ford Taurus when the collision occurred shortly before 3 a.m., he said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"It's really tragic, the almost unbelievable circumstances," Chabot said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Both vehicles were found in the west ditch. The SUV was engulfed in flames when police were called to the scene shortly before 3 a.m., he said. June McKay of St. Laurent, Doreen Boudreau's cousin, said the circumstances of the fatal crash are difficult to fathom. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"What are the odds of that happening?" she asked. "That's one thing we can't comprehend." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Family members held a memorial service Sunday afternoon at the side of the highway near the accident scene. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"We erected three crosses with their names on them and then we had the local priest come and bless them," McKay said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Funeral arrangements were still pending yesterday. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Tragedy also struck the family two years ago. In 2002, Doreen Boudreau's 17-year-old son Craig Boudreau and McKay's 23-year-old cousin Paul McKay were among four people killed in a single-vehicle crash near St. Laurent. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"It seems like it just happened," said June McKay. "We're staying pretty close together, the whole family. That's how we're going to get through this." <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Sylvain Boudreau, who worked in construction, is survived by his wife Dorothy of more than 40 years, McKay said. The couple, she said, also has five surviving children: Audrey Coutu, and Brenda, Claude, Elaine and Fern Boudreau. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Doreen Boudreau, who weighed and packed fish at a local plant, is survived by her common-law spouse, Darren Guiboche. They have a daughter Janice, 11, and a son Lucas, 9, McKay said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"She was a very happy person, bubbly, and a loving mom," McKay said. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Kevin Boudreau was Doreen's son from a previous marriage and his father is from Peguis First Nation, McKay said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 5-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: SON'S SUV HITS FAMILY MEMBERS IN FATAL CRASH
NEWS_ITM_SRC_TXT: TORONTO, ON  Globe and Mail  July.06/04  Page A5
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Winnipeg &#8212; A close-knit family continued to weep yesterday as their small town puzzled over terrible coincidences: How could a teenager smash his SUV into an oncoming car in the middle of the night that just happened to contain his mother and grandfather? <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">And how could it happen to a family that has already lost two relatives in another fatal highway crash?<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Five members of the Boudreau family have died in the past two years on the roads around their hometown of St. Laurent, a village on the shores of Lake Manitoba about 60 kilometres northwest of Winnipeg.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The latest victims were Sylvain Boudreau, 60, his daughter Doreen Boudreau, 37, and his grandson Kevin Boudreau, 18. They died in a fiery head-on collision early Sunday morning.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"They were good people," said Fern Boudreau, son of Sylvain and brother of Doreen. He sobbed and hung up the phone.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Police say Kevin Boudreau was driving home from Winnipeg in a GMC Jimmy when he noticed his gas gauge falling low. He phoned home, and his mother and grandfather loaded their Ford Taurus with spare fuel and began driving toward him on Highway 6 south of St. Laurent.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">The Jimmy swerved into the wrong lane shortly before 3 a.m., hitting the Taurus head-on. The impact threw both vehicles into the west ditch and ignited an intense fire. Rescue crews initially couldn't find the 18-year-old's body, which was burned so badly that forensic examiners will likely use dental records or DNA to confirm his identity.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">"It was only after the fire was extinguished that they noticed the third victim," RCMP Corporal Bob Chabot said.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Family friend Dolores Coutu, 67, visited the family home later that morning. "They were all shocked, especially such a close-knit family."<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">As the shock wore off, however, family members decided to express their grief with a public ceremony. Dozens of friends and relatives gathered at the charred roadside on Sunday to mark the crash site with white wooden crosses. A local priest attended and police blocked traffic.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Many people around St. Laurent say they're astonished by the astronomical odds involved in the case. Not only was it unlikely that a son would crash into his relatives in the early-morning darkness, but it's especially strange that tragedy would repeat itself in the same family: Doreen Boudreau's 17-year-old son Craig and a 23-year-old cousin were killed in another road accident in April, 2002.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">Family members are planning a trust fund to support Doreen's two other children, aged 9 and 11.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA">-30-<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

Title: 6-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: CYCLIST STRUCK BY SUV HAD BEEN OFFERED RIDE
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A 47-year-old cyclist who was fatally struck by an SUV on Tuesday afternoon in the North End had turned down a ride from his father just minutes earlier. Paul Schellenberg was riding his bicycle southbound on McGregor Street on the way to a friend's home shortly after 3 p.m., when he collided with a Chevrolet Tracker that was eastbound on Burrows Avenue. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I offered to give him a lift to his friend's," said Paul's dad, Bill Schellenberg, who had been visiting at his son's St. John's Avenue apartment. "He said he'd manage all right and he'd take it easy on his bicycle. I left it at that and that's what happened." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Schellenberg was taken with severe head injuries to Health Sciences Centre, where he was later pronounced dead. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A talented musician who played mostly rock music with local bands, he had been sick for the past two years with an unknown illness that doctors were still trying to pinpoint, his parents said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"Sometimes his legs just didn't want to carry him he was so weak," said Helen Schellenberg, Paul's mother. "He thought he felt good enough to (go for a bike ride) this day." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Witnesses say Schellenberg went through a red light. A police investigation is continuing. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"He was always careful," Helen, 81, said. "We can't see why he would go through a red light." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Cory, the 21-year-old driver of the Tracker, sent his condolences to Paul's family and friends through The Sun. "Before (he died) I was thinking about going to visit them but now I don't want them to ... hold it against me," he said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I just want to say sorry and let them know it's something that I'll never be able to forget. I wish like hell it didn't happen." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>But Schellenberg's parents don't blame Cory. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"We wish we could get a hold of that driver and talk with him," Helen said. "It would be nice if he could come for the funeral." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>FELT POWERLESS <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Cory, who didn't want his last name used, said he felt powerless while he stayed by Schellenberg's side after the collision. "There's a very big feeling of helplessness ... seeing the person and not being able to do anything," he said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Schellenberg, who was divorced with a 25-year-old son named Matt, will be remembered for his kindness and music talent, his parents said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The Steinbach-born musician, who had most recently worked as an upholsterer, played countless instruments, including the piano, violin and bass guitar, said Helen. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A funeral service is scheduled for 11 a.m. tomorrow at Elmwood Mennonite Brethren Church, 145 Henderson Hwy.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 7-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: TWO DIE IN 'CYCLE CRASHES: Speed Contributed: Cops
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Two young men died on their motorcycles within nine hours of each other yesterday in Winnipeg's North End. Police say speed contributed to both crashes -- the first occurring just after midnight near the intersection of Church Avenue and Milner Street. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Gregory Kyle Shumila, 23, of Cork Avenue had just upgraded the power on his motorcycle and was testing it out in the relatively deserted industrial park when he lost control and smashed into a tree, said Winnipeg police spokesman Const. Bob Johnson. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Shumila also struck a metal railway sign with his newer-model Suzuki. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"He was obviously trying out how fast it could go," Johnson said, adding Shumila had just picked up the cycle at 10 p.m., two hours before the fatal wreck. "Ultimately, it took his life." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Paramedics rushed Shumila to Seven Oaks General Hospital, where he was pronounced dead of severe internal injuries. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>One of Shumila's cousins said the family was horrified by the tragic news. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"We're all kind of in shock," said the relative. "Twenty-three years old, his life was just beginning and to have this happen ... " <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoHeading7 style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>WATCHED HIM GROW UP <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></B></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Neighbour Len Wardale said his family and the Shumilas have been neighbours for nearly 40 years. He remembers the couple bringing their first child, Greg, home from the hospital. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"We've seen them grow up," said Wardale, adding Shumila has a younger sister. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"He was a good boy. Just like any young man he liked cars and motorcycles. He was good for his parents, too. He was always out there doing work for his parents. Pray for the parents." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Later yesterday, at 8:25 a.m., police received calls about a second high-speed crash at the corner of Selkirk Avenue and Arlington Street involving a Honda bike. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Police identified the driver of the motorcycle as 25-year-old Machray Avenue resident Martino Soares. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A man from Kenora was travelling west on Selkirk Avenue when he saw the accident unfold. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Jim, who declined to give his last name, said the motorcycle was southbound on Arlington when the driver ran the red light at the intersection of Selkirk Avenue and slammed into the driver's side of an Acadian. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>"I saw that motorcycle hit the red light. I was right there," said Jim. "If I had been four feet further, he would have hit me." <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The driver of the Acadian wasn't seriously injured. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Ambulance and fire officials arrived on scene within a couple of minutes and rushed Soares to Health Sciences Centre in critical condition. He was pronounced dead shortly after arrival. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Officers used yellow tape to block access to the intersection, where the Honda bike lay on its side. A pair of shoes, a purple shirt, a black, scratched-up helmet and one bike glove were also lined up on the roadway, beside a dark pool of blood. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Plastic pieces and other debris were scattered across both lanes. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Police are continuing to investigate both crashes.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Verdana; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">-30-</SPAN></P>

Title: 8-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: RISKY MACHINE TO RIDE: MPI
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Motorcycles are slick machines but they offer little protection for riders in accidents, which often have serious or fatal consequences, says Manitoba Public Insurance. "Motorcycles are inherently risky," MPI spokesman Ted Wakefield said. "They provide no protection for the driver and they are inherently unstable and have a tendency to lose control ... you need to be conscious of how fast you're going." <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Winnipeg police say speed contributed to two fatal motorcycle crashes yesterday. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Wakefield said the company continually tries to promote its message of "speed kills." According to statistics, one in two, or 50%, of all motorcycle accidents involve only the bike. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Wakefield said the average cost for a motorcycle claim is $14,000, with 83% going to cover injury-related expenses such as rehabilitation, replacement income, equipment and personal care. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>An average claim for passenger vehicles only runs about $2,500, with just 35% designated for injury costs. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Wakefield said the numbers show that motorcycle collisions, more often than not, can result in serious injury to the rider. "By far, the greater component is injuries," he said. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Manitoba recorded two motorcycle deaths in 2003 and seven in 2002. Yesterday's crashes were the first two fatal accidents involving bikes in 2004.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 9-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: FIRE TOLL COULD HIT $4 MILLION
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A fire that destroyed part of a St. James seniors complex under construction caused up to $4 million in damage, officials say. An initial estimate released Tuesday pegged the damage at Sturgeon Creek Retirement Residence at $1.5 million "and counting," said Robin Alford, a spokesman for Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>The early-morning fire was so intense it melted venetian blinds in nearby apartments and plastic parts of cars parked across the street. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Investigators spent about 11 hours at the scene but haven't released an official cause. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><o:p><FONT face=Verdana></FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center; mso-pagination: none; tab-stops: 11.6pt" align=center><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>-30-<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Title: 10-Apr-13
NEWS_ITM_HDLN_TXT: GIRL, 2, DIES AFTER ACCIDENT IN DAIRY BARN: Parent Driving Bobcat Tractor Didn't See Child, Backed Into Her
NEWS_ITM_BYLN_TXT: By Alexandra Paul And Lindsey Wiebe
NEWS_ITM_TXT: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>A two-year-old Dufresne girl died yesterday following a farm accident in which she stepped into the path of a Bobcat tractor driven by one of her parents. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>RCMP said the parent did not know the child was there until it was too late. <o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>  <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 6pt 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN-CA style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Verdana; mso-ansi-language: EN-CA"><FONT face=Verdana>Police would not confirm which parent was driving the Bobcat at the time of the accident.
